Job Description:
Summary
Imagine what you could do here! At Apple great ideas have a way of becoming great products services and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there’s no telling what you could accomplish!


Apple Support Analytics is looking for an intensely curious analytically-oriented professional to join us in a senior business analytics role. You have a passion for conducting research answering high impact business questions with data and presenting your findings and recommendations to key decision-makers across the region and globally.


Key Qualifications
Minimum 5 years of relevant experience

Strong technical expertise in SQL Tableau. Python experience a plus

Expertise in advanced analytical techniques and statistical analysis

Broad-minded with scrupulous attention to detail and desire for end-to-end ownership of deliverables

Self-motivated and driven; comfortable working in a global fast-paced often ambiguous environment and with multiple cross functional teams

Business savvy and consumer focused to think strategically and act tactically and expeditiously to resolve issues

Outstanding written verbal and presentation skills with the ability to develop and present conclusions and recommendations to senior management

Comfortable supporting collaborating and communicating with senior management. Able to build solid working relationships through active listening delivering promised results and establishing trust

High level of professionalism energy and sense of urgency

Collaborative with a positive attitude strong sense of empathy and ability to make timely decisions

Lean Six Sigma expertise is preferred


Description
In this role you will identify opportunities to improve contact centre efficiency quality and productivity and provide recommendations for actions that drive cost-savings and other meaningful business improvements.


The ideal candidate has extensive experience communicating with stakeholders across all levels of the organisation and will have the passion to stand behind their recommendations which are supported by advanced analysis.


Education & Experience
Bachelor or Master’s degree in a field related to analytics such as operations research statistics or econometrics

Company Description

The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore Malaysia and Thailand – and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.

We also develop own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential office and other types of real estate in our development plans.

We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children women and the environment.

Job Description

About the job

IKEA Jurong is a unique city centre store in a popular shopping mall. It is a smaller store with a big turnover and with 3 million visitors. It will be led by an ambitious team consisting of the Store Commercial Operations IKEA Food and a Retail Foundation Manager.
  • Support Operations Manager in Business plan budget and forecast process by translating the store’s strategy and goals in Profit & Loss (P&L) scenarios using financial analysis and benchmarking;
  • Lead the store’s monthly financial reporting together with the regional and store’s accounting team by timely efficient accurate and compliant invoice management;
  • Monitor the store’s budget through close follow up of the P&L and provide regular updates to the store management on the store’s financial position and recommend improvement measures in case of deviation and potentials;
  • Provide relevant and user-friendly business information on the store’s performance KPIs;
  • Support the sales team in converting performance insights into actions towards maximising business opportunities in the most efficient and effective way;
  • Supporting correct procurement of indirect material by requesting and comparing supplier quotations by periodic reviews on contracts management administering purchase tool user management.
Qualifications

Your profile
  • Highly developed analytical and numerical skills; Result oriented;
  • Strong management and leadership experience;
  • Self-reliant and motivated with proven ability to work as part of a team as well as independently;
  • Ability to influence;
  • Flexible approach to work and open to change;
  • Being able to communicate clearly and succinctly both verbally and in writing;
  • Good working knowledge of all areas of IKEA business;
  • Experience in setting and implementing long-term strategic plans setting budgets and following up on goals.
Additional Information

Please apply by 15 November 2020

Scope of Work
  • Perform business analysis such as assess current state analyses stated requirements of stakeholders to define business needs;
  • Source and evaluate alternatives to identify solution that best fits business need identify gaps and determine workarounds/changes to the solution. Assess deployed solutions to see how well they met the original need;
  • Work closely with business users and project team members on project initiation solution design implementation deployment and post implementation support;
  • Lead the solution design effort and help to develop innovative solutions while complying to existing standards guidelines and processes; and
  • Manage conflicts issues and changes to ensure stakeholders and project team remain in agreement on solution scope communicate and manage expectations of stakeholders.


Requirements
  • Diploma / Degree in IT or equivalent;
  • At least 3 years of relevant experience;
  • Business Analysis certification (Certification of Competency in Business Analysis™ (“CCBA®”) Certified Business Analysis Professional™ (CBAP®)) or an equivalent certification will be an added advantage;
  • Analytical conceptualisation and problem-solving skills;
  • Ability to perform qualitative quantitative and root-cause analysis;
  • Pro-active resourceful and self-motivated to innovate and take smart risks to achieve business goals;
  • Good communication skills both oral and written with the ability to pitch ideas and influence stakeholders;
  • Knowledge of design thinking and workshop facilitation will be an added advantage.

Desired Competencies (Technical/Behavioral Competency)


Must-Have


  • 8 to 10 years of IT experience.
  • 5+ year of BA experience in banking and financial.
  • Must have worked as business analyst. 
  • Must have Vision Plus knowledge.


Good-to-Have


  • Knowledge on Cards domain.
  • Good experience in coordination with different groups
  • Good communication skills (oral and written) and experience in writing high quality project documents


Key Expectations from the Role 


  • Liaise with team to formalize high level requirements
  • Create functional Features & User Stories with clear Acceptance criteria from high level requirements 
  • Lead product backlog grooming sessions with relevant stakeholders in Biz & Technology and ensure requirements are well understood by all
  • Lead the solution for project as required
  • Participate in Functional Requirement & Test Plan Walk thru to ensure their completeness to match requirements
  • Review test cases prepared by Testing Team & suggest for optimization where possible

The Company

An investment holding firm is looking to hire a Business Analyst.

The Role

You are expected to evaluate and execute M&A and other investment opportunities performing valuation and returns analyses preparing investment memos for transaction approval developing corporate and business unit level strategy co-ordinating post-acquisition integration plans with investee companies identifying financial and operational efficiencies as well as analyzing industry trends and expansion opportunities.

Your Profile

You should have a Degree in Finance/Accountancy with a minimum of 1 year of relevant experience in corporate finance / business analysis. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills are pre-requisites for this role. Candidates from the big 4 / investment banking / private equity firms are welcome to apply.

Chubb is looking for a Business Analyst to join their regional digital team. Ideal candidate should be passionate about bringing and delivering innovative superior future ready digital solutions across insurance lifecycle. You will be required to identify & analyze business pain points gaps core problems industry trends business needs and translate these to tangible business requirements and needs. You should be able to clearly articulate document & communicate the requirements to different stakeholders and drive implementation of new solutions platforms models & methods for Chubb’s partners and customers. You will be working closely with product/platform/delivery/technology owners to conceptualize deliver & implement digital solutions & their adoption with partners customers regionally and locally.


Main Responsibilities:


  1. Work closely with business & product owners to analyse evaluate and understand business pain points/needs/opportunities develop clear and accurate specifications to ensure that solutions/systems fully address business requirements & needs.
  2. Work closely with product/platform owners to understand product/platform vision roadmap and value proposition. Define & document requirements aligned with product /platform roadmap
  3. Closely collaborate with different stakeholders (Business users partnership managers platform/product owners etc) to collect capture and document business requirements in form of specific documents (BRD FSD) and/or user stories.
  4. Facilitate prioritisation of user requirements/user stories based on business priorities & criticality product backlog & business case
  5. Ensure user/business requirements are clearly articulate translated and documented for efficient delivery by technical/delivery teams. Work closely with delivery teams across time zones while ensuring quality & timely delivery.
  6. Ensure proper due diligence across product/project lifecycle including compliance to architecture technical solutions external/internal dependencies & risks.
  7. Assist in project delivery/management while attending to multiple projects throughout delivery life cycle

 

Skills:


  1. Strong analytical problem solving skills. Ability to understand business problems and articulate the complexity in clear terms to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  2. Ability to work in a fast paced challenging environment while attending to multiple projects/deliveries. Aptitude for multi-tasking working to emerging & tight timelines.
  3. Good understanding of product/platform lifecycle management for web/mobile technology with a keen interest in customer experience user journeys customer acquisition.
  4. Ability to take the initiative independently be assertive and think strategically.
  5. Excellent organisational verbal and written communication skills.
  6. Facilitation communication skills and stakeholder management skills.

 

Soft Skills:


  1. Strong work and professional ethics
  2. Excellent people management & stakeholder management skills
  3. Strong interpersonal collaboration & team management skills
  4. High sense of ownership urgency drive and diligency. Proven track record of getting things done managing multiple tasks/priorities including communication with internal and external teams while consistently delivering on schedule

 

Knowledge & Experience:


  • Degree or equivalent qualification (Essential)
  • 5 Years + experience in digital delivery as a BA working in Agile environment (Essential)
  • Prior experience in insurance industry & products (Essential)
  • Formal Business Analysis qualification and Agile qualification/certifications (Desirable)
  • Prior experience on Product/platform lifecycle management (Desirable)
  • Knowledge on e-commerce customer lifecycle digital sales customer servicing insurance products (Desirable)
  • Working knowledge of tools like Jira Confluence MS Projects MS Office Suite
  • Experience of working with wide range of internal and external stakeholder audiences across globally distributed and cross functional teams

And with a network that stretches across the world you’ll gain unparalleled insight and experience from different geographies and sectors. So whenever you join however long you stay the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

Ideally you’ll also have
  • Keen appreciation of client’s needs and strong interest in software delivery

What We Look For

Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.

What Working At EY Offers

EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus we offer:
  • Support coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around

So that whenever you join however long you stay the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. We are looking for a Business Analyst to harmonize core business processes and systems in APAC; simplify harmonize automate update and optimize the functions processes and systems required for doing the Retail Lease/Loan business. Modernize business in the APAC markets. Solution will be used by 80% of all employees and all dealer and salespeople in the given markets. Enable innovations like eSignature eContracting and digitalization initiatives (e.g. alternative vehicle and SF sales processes

The Main Responsibilities Of a Business Analyst Are
  • Analyse current and future business requirements (REQUIREMENTS ENGINEERING)

Understand current business processes functions and IT realization on a per market level. Derive overall common requirements for new solution. Align with Senior BA and Product Owner to arrive with common understanding of functionality in terms of: necessary supported finance product portfolio business processes and functions regulatory legal and external/internal compliance requirements.

During the project be responsible for analyzing and breaking down complex new requirements often with a large impact on complete business /IT eco-system. Align with senior business analyst and product owner ensure proper and thorough understanding and recommend solution in terms of functional content cost/benefit and realization strategy (timing risk).
  • Design business functions to realise business processes in underlying IT solution (DESIGN)


Design Business Functional Solution (in Support Of Senior BA) Whilst Taking Many Often Conflicting Aspects Into Account Including But Not Limited To The Following

  • (user/customer) usability and ease-of-use (user interface ergonomics)
  • Benefit e.g. degree of automation and customer/dealer self-service process execution time process quality and reliability (exception handling) processing monitoring process steering process controls number of process exceptions data quality)
  • Maintainability – breadth and width of configurability and parametrization
  • Cost including assessment of alternative IT realization solution
  • Potential realization of functions in preparation for anticipated need (“build for today design for tomorrow)
  • Compliance to external and internal regulations law and guidelines e.g. credit bureau regulations Internal Control Systems data protection law consumer protection law. This includes aspects like segregation of duties role and rights data encryption data masking and archiving audit trail fraud avoidance etc.
  • time to realization
  • degree of risk e.g. disruption to ongoing business operations customer dissatisfaction dealer complaints escalations with regulatory body inaccurate accounting.

    • Furthermore the BA must work closely with IT colleagues to ensure that the functional design also sustainably meets non-functional requirements e.g. scalability (performance under load) availability (24x7) security reliability IT operations (monitoring incident management system deployment system configuration). Ensure holistic design optimum balancing functional non-functional architectural compliance and cost requirements.

    Ensure design is properly documented i.e. traceability of requirement to design ensure knowledge transfer ability to supply external auditors full explanation on how solution functions ensure documentation has proper basis to record future changes history of past changes (change audit trail).
    • Align with external vendors/partners (VENDORS)

    Discuss and align solutions with markets region HQ and vendor to realise best solution for BMW in support of senior BA.
    • Functional Testing (TEST REQUIREMENTS TRACEABILITY)

    Work closely with test team to align and support test case design. Support creation of end to end test scenarios with market functional owners.
    • Third Level Support / Solving complex live issues (3rd LEVEL PROBLEM RESOLUTION)

    In some cases BA must support analysis of problems with live systems which could not be resolved by first and second level support structures. Typically such issues occur infrequently but need assistance in determining the cause of issue and to ascertain whether issues are due to an underlying flaw in the original design.

    Work Experience and Requirements:-
    • At least 3 - 5 years of professional experience preferably in financial services banking or insurance industry. Extensive experience in business/IT projects or operations
    • Ideally in designer process/quality management IT test or management role
    • Working in teams distributed across multiple locations and countries
    • illustrate deep understanding and ability to design/change complex operational business processes)
    • Knowledge of the relevant regulations law and compliance and ability to incorporate these aspects into the development of optimal business processes.
    • Good Financial mathematics & numerical skills
    • Ergonomics (user interface design)
    • Banking & Financial Services knowledge ( industry trends and developments organization & controls business & IT regulations and law risk management tax treatments accounting treatments etc.)
    • Experience working in the Car industry trends competitive landscape
    • Knowledge of internet mobile technology and digitalization solutions
    • Very good knowledge and understanding of IT architectures and system integration paradigms
    • IT landscape management. IT security. Relational databases & SQL
    • Scalable IT architectural fundamentals for online business
    • Analytical skills and objectivity. Strong ability to go from abstract to detailed level.
    • Problem Solving and continuous improvement skills (e.g. 6 Sigma DMAIC etc)
    • Test methodology processes and tools
    • Fluent business English. Additional Asian languages would be a plus.
    • Experience in change rollout test management and training
    • Extensive experience and knowledge with using diverse design and project methodologies and tools
    • Excellent communication rhetorical and conflict resolutions skills also in a multi-cultural context

We are looking for a Business Analyst who is interested in using data to help HDB design solutions that address its business problems and stay close to the needs of our citizens. Your responsibilities include working with various stakeholders within HDB and with external agencies to identify business problems develop plans and engage relevant parties to execute both data analytics and digital services projects to drive desired and sustainable solutions for stakeholders to adopt in future.

As a Business Analyst You Will Be Required To
  • Build strong relationships with stakeholders to understand business challenges and opportunities scope the problem and turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used for policy making streamlining operations or developing comprehensive solutions for citizens;
  • Manage end-to-end data projects; identify issues gather information from various sources analyse data interpret patterns and trends build models give recommendations and create insightful data visualisation for monitoring outcomes; and
  • Review day-to-day operation processes; identify areas of improvement and make actionable recommendations based on underlying analysis.
Requirements

You should possess background in Business Analytics. You should possess knowledge of how various data are gathered stored and retrieved. You should have the ability to transform and interpret the data accurately to generate necessary insights as well as be able to present complex information in a friendly manner for end-users to understand.

You should be experienced in data modelling mining statistics and data analysis algorithm and able to use statistical software like Python/R Tableau/SAS Visual Analytics IBM SPSS modeller and EViews independently.

You should have excellent communication presentation and writing skills in order to pitch ideas and influence stakeholders. You should possess analytical/logical thinking and enjoy problem solving. You should also be a good team player able to collaborate with different teams and manage timeline and priorities effectively.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

For projects related more to data analytics you will be required to articulate and present analytics concepts; research and adopt new algorithms and analytics techniques to improve insight quality; perform model assessment and proper evaluation to identify and execute the appropriate techniques for different problem statements.

About us:


hoolah is a leading omni-channel buy now pay later payment company headquartered in Singapore. Up to 75% of ecommerce consumers look add items to the shopping cart but don’t buy. We help merchants of all sizes - predominantly in the retail travel and airline verticals - to solve this issue and in doing so drive sales and enable their consumers to afford responsibly. We deliver proven conversion and basket size increase utilizing our marketing engine our 3 monthly 0% interest instalment checkout solution and an amazing buying experience for all. For consumers they can now responsibly afford the things they want or need by paying over 3 months or salary cycles and better budgeting with no extra costs. Hoolah is creating closer relationships between merchants and consumers.

 

Overview

We’re seeking a Technical Business Analyst to develop and manage technical and business requirements for all hoolah software and systems. You will naturally have an affinity for digital commerce or technology as well as a dedication to making sure that products do not enter the world without thorough requirements. We would also love to hear why you are keen on working with us at hoolah!

The BAs should develop a good understanding of the Product its services and offerings as well as the system functionalities and limitations.

The Work Would Cover The Following Areas

We are looking for a Business Analyst to harmonize core business processes and systems in APAC; simplify harmonize automate update and optimize the functions processes and systems required for doing the Retail Lease/Loan business. Modernize business in the APAC markets. Solution will be used by 80% of all employees and all dealer and salespeople in the given markets. Enable innovations like eSignature eContracting and digitalization initiatives (e.g. alternative vehicle and SF sales processes

The Main Responsibilities Of a Business Analyst Are
  • Analyse current and future business requirements (REQUIREMENTS ENGINEERING)

Understand current business processes functions and IT realization on a per market level. Derive overall common requirements for new solution. Align with Senior BA and Product Owner to arrive with common understanding of functionality in terms of: necessary supported finance product portfolio business processes and functions regulatory legal and external/internal compliance requirements.

During the project be responsible for analyzing and breaking down complex new requirements often with a large impact on complete business /IT eco-system. Align with senior business analyst and product owner ensure proper and thorough understanding and recommend solution in terms of functional content cost/benefit and realization strategy (timing risk).
  • Design business functions to realise business processes in underlying IT solution (DESIGN)


Design Business Functional Solution (in Support Of Senior BA) Whilst Taking Many Often Conflicting Aspects Into Account Including But Not Limited To The Following

  • (user/customer) usability and ease-of-use (user interface ergonomics)
  • Benefit e.g. degree of automation and customer/dealer self-service process execution time process quality and reliability (exception handling) processing monitoring process steering process controls number of process exceptions data quality)
  • Maintainability – breadth and width of configurability and parametrization
  • Cost including assessment of alternative IT realization solution
  • Potential realization of functions in preparation for anticipated need (“build for today design for tomorrow)
  • Compliance to external and internal regulations law and guidelines e.g. credit bureau regulations Internal Control Systems data protection law consumer protection law. This includes aspects like segregation of duties role and rights data encryption data masking and archiving audit trail fraud avoidance etc.
  • time to realization
  • degree of risk e.g. disruption to ongoing business operations customer dissatisfaction dealer complaints escalations with regulatory body inaccurate accounting.

    • Furthermore the BA must work closely with IT colleagues to ensure that the functional design also sustainably meets non-functional requirements e.g. scalability (performance under load) availability (24x7) security reliability IT operations (monitoring incident management system deployment system configuration). Ensure holistic design optimum balancing functional non-functional architectural compliance and cost requirements.

    Ensure design is properly documented i.e. traceability of requirement to design ensure knowledge transfer ability to supply external auditors full explanation on how solution functions ensure documentation has proper basis to record future changes history of past changes (change audit trail).
    • Align with external vendors/partners (VENDORS)

    Discuss and align solutions with markets region HQ and vendor to realise best solution for BMW in support of senior BA.
    • Functional Testing (TEST REQUIREMENTS TRACEABILITY)

    Work closely with test team to align and support test case design. Support creation of end to end test scenarios with market functional owners.
    • Third Level Support / Solving complex live issues (3rd LEVEL PROBLEM RESOLUTION)

    In some cases BA must support analysis of problems with live systems which could not be resolved by first and second level support structures. Typically such issues occur infrequently but need assistance in determining the cause of issue and to ascertain whether issues are due to an underlying flaw in the original design.

    • Working in teams distributed across multiple locations and countries

Job Description:
Job Role

NVPC operates a national trusted platform for matching donors and volunteers to registered charities in Singapore. The Digital Innovation team is now expanding and we are looking for a passionate driven individual possessing the right purpose and aptitude to create impact to serve community and societal needs at a national level.


As a Business Analyst with the Digital Innovation team you will determine business requirements and translate them into user-centric stories for stakeholder alignment and development.


You will be working in a multi-stakeholder environment and must be comfortable working independently or collaboratively with analysts designers developers and various stakeholders to coordinate conceptualise plan execute track product releases and contribute actively to team goals.


Being able to communicate complex business insights in a clear and concise manner is a must.


Job Responsibilities

  • Work with both internal and external stakeholders to identify gather and verify user requirements as user stories for user alignment and development.
  • Work with development team and stakeholders and development team to establish delivery timeline key milestones resource needs monitor delivery progress including acceptance of UAT.
  • Analyse and support the design of technical solutions to enable integration with other systems
  • Work closely with the Product Owner and development team to ensure UI/UX designs conform to usability goals.
  • Provide support for existing operations including support and maintenance for existing systems incident management service requests and fulfillment of change requests.


Job Requirements

  • Possess at least a Bachelor’s Degree Post Graduate Diploma or Professional Degree in Computer Science / Information Technology Engineering or equivalent.
  • Minimum 5 years relevant working experience as a Business Analyst.
  • Experience in managing mobile and web applications and implementing business process systems.
  • Good understanding of UI/UX concepts
  • Experience in HTML CSS and Javascript for rapid prototyping is a plus.
  • Highly motivated in problem-solving with strong investigative skills.
  • Effective self-starter who excels in a fast-paced multi-vendor environment
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills with a track record of managing business stakeholders partners and external vendors
  • Exhibits critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Strong ability to step into details yet possessing full visibility of end to end view of the product development roadmaps.
  • Passion to transform Singapore into a giving nation.
  • Detail-oriented hands-on comfortable working in high-energy and dynamic environment.
  • Pro-active self-starter with an analytical and creative mind and a team player.
  • Results- and customer-oriented with multi-tasking capabilities.

About Aon

Aon’s Centers for Innovation and Analytics in Dublin and Singapore are the cornerstone of Aon’s $350M global investment in analytics. The ACIAs deliver data-driven insights to clients by leveraging our unmatched data capabilities across both risk and people solutions.

Established in 2012 there are over 100 colleagues employed by ACIA Singapore today with rapid growth planned over the next few years. The team currently includes actuaries computer programmers data scientists financial analysts and accountants. Through their concerted effort the ACIAs build best in class analytic insights and capabilities to better serve clients and colleagues globally.

The Opportunity

The successful candidate will join the Client Solutions team which forms part of Aon's Innovation Center in Singapore. The Client Solutions team helps Aon understand and interpret our client data and provides analytics to help us make better strategic decisions to develop our business.

The team delivers client-centric global initiatives across geographies and solution lines with the objective to embed actionable client analytics and drive performance growth. Our initiatives currently include Sales Effectiveness Local Market Planning Articulating Value Global Client Profitability and Cross Sell.

Responsibilities

    • Propose ways of analyzing data that aligns with client objectives

  • Project-led country deployments of Client Solutions initiatives:

    • Partner with local country to source data inputs address data quality challenges and determine configuration requirements
    • Work with internal and global team members to implement recommendations towards a positive and sustainable outcome.
    • Conceptualize solutions roll out and test products work with countries to ensure the solution is tailored and oversee product maintenance.
    • Own 2-4 countries and be responsible for country relationship which may involve team’s full suite of products.
    • Translate end user requests into technical requirements for our development team
  • Data management and Model delivery:
    • Understand new datasets reconcile reports cleanse data create joins and apply business logic.
    • Compile understand analyze data and derive meaningful insights
    • Support development of new analytical tools through design testing and implementation

  • Team player analytical problem-solving critical and innovative thinking skills
  • Articulate with excellent presenting skills
  • High-level written and verbal communication skills.
  • Able to multi-task self-disciplined organized detail-oriented with good prioritization skills

About us:


hoolah is a leading omni-channel buy now pay later payment company headquartered in Singapore. Up to 75% of ecommerce consumers look add items to the shopping cart but don’t buy. We help merchants of all sizes - predominantly in the retail travel and airline verticals - to solve this issue and in doing so drive sales and enable their consumers to afford responsibly. We deliver proven conversion and basket size increase utilizing our marketing engine our 3 monthly 0% interest instalment checkout solution and an amazing buying experience for all. For consumers they can now responsibly afford the things they want or need by paying over 3 months or salary cycles and better budgeting with no extra costs. Hoolah is creating closer relationships between merchants and consumers.

 

Overview

We’re seeking a Technical Business Analyst to develop and manage technical and business requirements for all hoolah software and systems. You will naturally have an affinity for digital commerce or technology as well as a dedication to making sure that products do not enter the world without thorough requirements. We would also love to hear why you are keen on working with us at hoolah!


Key Responsibilities 

• Define and manage technical and business requirements for new systems development and changes to those systems. 

• Translate requirements into Business Requirements and Functional Specifications. 

• Implement processes and procedures for the project initiation analysis and design phases within projects that align with the business’ goals for project management and delivery. 

• Provide high quality end to end process analysis and documentation services on projects (internal and external projects). 

• Work directly with the Chief Technical Officer Project Manager and Lead Engineer and others to manage programs of work from a requirements estimation process. 

• Maintain your understanding of system functionality and staying aware of the changes. 

• Ensuring you understand longer-term project requirements timeframes and specifications. 


Requirements 

• #startuphustle 

• Experience in Agile Development and Iterative Development work environments. 

• Understanding of relevant testing methodologies and experience in their implementation. 

• Understanding of SDLC. 

• Proficient in understanding web applications and RESTful services. 

• Strong written and verbal communication skills. 

• Ability to visually prototype outcomes and workflows using diagrams wireframes and other prototyping tools. 

• Ability to work both independently and as part of a team. 

• Ability to build an excellent rapport with developers. 

• Qualification in Information Technology or related discipline (desirable). 

• Understanding of online payment and offline payment systems (desirable). 

• Willingness to work in a start-up environment. 

• Willingness to learn and apply new methodologies platforms and products as required is a must!

In a world of dramatic and fast-paced change the ability to retain existing customers and attract new ones is critical. As a customer advisory professional you’ll provide clients with a strong analytical framework to transform their sales and drive sustainable growth. Joining one of our high-performing globally integrated teams you’ll work closely with our clients’ marketing sales and customer service functions helping to ensure they interact effectively with their customer base.

Through our structured learning and development program you’ll develop the skills knowledge and experience to help grow our clients’ businesses. And with a network that stretches across the world you’ll gain unparalleled insight and experience from different geographies and sectors. So whenever you join however long you stay the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

  • Interact with business users/Product Owner and understand business processes and requirements

To Qualify For The Role You Must Have

Ideally you’ll also have
  • Keen appreciation of client’s needs and strong interest in software delivery
  • Knowledge of test automation will be an advantage

What We Look For

Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.

What Working At EY Offers

EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus we offer:
  • Support coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around

  • The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

About EY

As a global leader in assurance tax strategy and transactions and consulting services we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join however long you stay the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.

The Business Analytics Int Analyst is a developing professional role. Deals with most problems independently and has some latitude to solve complex problems. Integrates in-depth specialty area knowledge with a solid understanding of industry standards and practices. Good understanding of how the team and area integrate with others in accomplishing the objectives of the sub function/ job family. Applies analytical thinking and knowledge of data analysis tools and methodologies. Requires attention to detail when making judgments and recommendations based on the analysis of factual information. Typically deals with variable issues with potentially broader business impact. Applies professional judgment when interpreting data and results. Breaks down information in a systematic and communicable manner. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to exchange potentially complex/sensitive information. Moderate but direct impact through close contact with the businesses' core activities. Quality and timeliness of service provided will affect the effectiveness of own team and other closely related teams.

Identifies data patterns & trends and provides insights to enhance business decision making capability in business planning process improvement solution assessment etc.

May be involved in exploratory data analysis confirmatory data analysis and/or qualitative analysis.

Translate data into consumer or customer behavioral insights to drive targeting and segmentation strategies and communicate clearly and effectively to business partners and senior leaders all findings

Continuously improve processes and strategies by exploring and evaluating new data sources tools and capabilities

Work closely with internal and external business partners in building implementing tracking and improving decision strategies

Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup its clients and assets by driving compliance with applicable laws rules and regulations adhering to Policy applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior conduct and business practices and escalating managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

Qualifications

2-5 years relevant experience

Advanced process management skills organized and detail oriented

Curious About Learning And Developing New Skillsets

Positive outlook with a can-do mindset

Education

Bachelors/University degree or equivalent experience

PURPOSE:


To work with business stakeholders to develop Global Standard Process based on Dynamics 365.  This entails taking responsibility for project requirement gatherings; coordinating requirements for review approval and standardization; work with multiple stakeholders to define “as is” and “to be” state.


Main Responsibilities and Tasks:

This role will involve conduct studies on current processes and work will multiple stakeholders to develop Global Standard Process based on Dynamics 365.  Main responsibilities include:


  1. Assist Business Transformation Manager to drive process standardization;
  2. Consult subject matter expert on business processes as well as technical team on systems;
  3. Gathering ‘as is’ functional design specifications and process map;
  4. Fit-Gap analysis and work with stakeholders for resolutions;
  5. Writing technical and user documentation for ‘as-is’ and  ‘to-be’ state;
  6. Perform change management;
  7. Responsible for gathering processing and analysing data quickly effectively and developing insightful recommendation for improvement;
  8. Conduct and coordinate process redesign workshop or training to educate user responsible for managing and operating business processes;
  9. Perform other related duties and assignment as required by adapting to competing demand organizational changes and new responsibilities;

  •  Min Years of Experience 3-5 years working as Business Process Analyst or Data Analyst role
  • Good Degree in Business Management/ Computer Science;


Essential and Desired Experience:

  1. Effective communication and stakeholder management skills;
  2. Experience in managing stakeholder expectation with good influencing & negotiating skills;
  3. Ability to communicate with all levels of staffs and management team;
  4. An effective team player who is self-driven able to work independently within a fast paced environment under tight deadline and able to manage ambiguity;

  6. Written and verbal communication (technical writing skills is a plus);

  3. Have experience and good understanding of key ERP modules will be an advantage;

Job Description:
Human Resource Policy Cluster

PSD’s HR Policy cluster is the Public Sector Centre of Excellence for several areas relating to people policy including compensation performance management and benefits.

We take reference from best practices globally to ensure that our Public Sector can continue to attract develop retain and motivate the right talent to build Singapore for the next generation. This requires the coordination of multiple elements. We seek to ensure that our compensation and benefit package is market competitive to attract and retain our talent. At the same time we administer and review our performance management system to motivate our officers to put in our best to achieve agency and Public Service outcomes. We strive for progressive recruitment deployment re-employment and flex-work policies and practices to meet the needs of our public agencies and officers. We also the oversee organisational design superannuation and exit matters of the Service.

If you share our passion in shaping a first-class Public Service we welcome you to join us!

Responsibilities

As Analyst/Senior Analyst (HR Transformation) you will work in a team focused on driving comprehensive review and transformation of our HR policies with a particular focus on Benefits Superannuation and Exit policies.

Your Key Responsibilities Will Include
  • Work with agencies to review assess and implement changes to our benefits and welfare policies to support their staff
  • Review key elements of our benefits superannuation and exit philosophy and policies (e.g. staff welfare funding linkage with compensation in a total rewards framework soft and hard exit levers and triggers)
  • Formulate evaluate and review HR policies in partnership with other HR Policy domain experts (e.g. performance management appointments compensation and organizational design)
  • Study best practices in the private and public sector in reviewing how Public Service benefits superannuation and exit policies can evolve to meet future needs
  • Work with the PSD Data Office team to define the various data products needed to support timely analytics in the area of benefits superannuation and exits policy and working with HR systems teams and human resource leaders to implement work processes that ensure the analysis meets their needs and the necessary data is captured
  • Work with internal and external stakeholders to review and update policy and practices on items that can be subsidized by Civil Service medical benefits

This entails a spectrum of strategic operational and engagement work that includes:
  • Engaging in fact-finding and liaise with various parties (including government agencies and external vendors) to gather information and develop an understanding of the issues at hand and the interlinkages with other policy areas and HR systems;
  • Verifying datasets and perform simple computation or processing of data in Excel
  • Conceptualizing solutions to problems and develop a multi-angle assessment of the impact of proposed actions.
  • Understanding the legal obligations and frameworks that bind the Public Service and ensuring that our policies are compliant with and take into account the applicable legislation and legal obligations


Requirements

[Values]
  • Self-motivated values integrity teamwork and takes pride in going the extra mile to provide excellent service.

[Expertise & Experience]

An Ideal Candidate Should Possess The Following
  • [Analytics] Meticulous with strong planning and analytical skills and at ease with leveraging on the use of data and research to formulate strategies/solutions.
  • [Thinking Clearly and Making Sound Judgements] Appreciation of the strategic role purpose objectives and challenges of HR practices of the Public Service. Able to conceptualise ideas connect the dots understand current realities and translate them into actionable follow-ups.
  • [HR Policies] The ability to design translate and implement policies and processes that are employee-centric while taking into consideration employees’ and organisational needs relevant legislation and industry best practices. Ability to manage projects and HR policy initiatives. Appreciation of the dynamism between different areas of HR policies and how they interrelate as an ecosystem.
  • [Working Effectively with Stakeholders] Able to collaborate with different stakeholders to successfully implement HR policies. Excellent interpersonal and networking skills to convey new/revised policies to stakeholders.
  • [Total Rewards] Ability to lead and facilitate Total Rewards processes design and recommend initiatives and administration independently and have sound knowledge of common industry rewards practices and principles. Ability to evaluate the effectiveness of current rewards initiatives and recommend improvements to strategy in alignment with the organisation’s needs.
  • Ideally at least 2 years of experience in policy development or HR work. Experience with Total Rewards frameworks would be a plus.

[Personal Traits]
  • Meticulous with an eye for details and possess strong writing skills.
  • Self-starter who is able to work independently and in collaboration with others.
  • Ability to work well under pressure learn quickly and contribute as a strong team player.

Only shortlisted applicants will be notified within 2 weeks after closing date. Successful candidates will be offered a 2-year contract.

Are you able to simultaneously see the big picture while understanding the minutiae of a project? Do you excel when you need to switch between business and technical context?

ThoughtWorks is a global software consultancy with an aim to create a positive impact on the world through technology. Our community of technologists thinks disruptively to deliver pragmatic solutions for our clients' most complex challenges. We are curious minds who come together as collaborative and inclusive teams to push boundaries free to be ourselves and make our mark in tech.

Our developers have been contributing code to major organizations and open source projects for over 25 years. They’ve also been writing books speaking at conferences and helping push software development forward changing companies and even industries along the way.

As consultants we work with our clients to ensure we’re evolving their technology and empowering adaptive mindsets to meet their business goals. You could influence the digital strategy of a retail giant build a bold new mobile application for a bank or redesign platforms using event sourcing and intelligent data pipelines. You will learn to use the latest Lean and Agile thinking create pragmatic solutions to solve mission-critical problems and challenge yourself every day.

What happens when you have fascinating clients with challenging problems on the one hand and passionate software developers looking to build future-focused solutions on the other? This in-between is where Business Analysts reside acting as a bridge between the client and team. You will spend time determining what outcomes software must achieve assessing how it will be used and then generating bold ideas with our developers to create custom applications. You will work with clients across a variety of sectors and ensure the business-critical software solutions we develop deliver real business value every time.

You’ll Spend Time On The Following
  • You will co-facilitate workshops that generate customized business solutions
  • You will work in agile teams that facilitate organizational transformations for medium- and large-scale businesses
  • You will be an effective liaison between the client and a team consisting of SMEs C-suite executives Experience Designers Product Managers Consultant Developers and QAs
  • Collaborate with teammates on the analysis and design of complex business applications using the latest technologies
  • Mentor and evangelize Agile Lean and Continuous Development analysis best practices
  • Develop your career outside of the confinements of a traditional career path by focusing on what you’re passionate about rather than a predetermined one-size-fits-all plan


Here’s What We’re Looking For
  • You have a track record of delivering impactful software ideally on a collaborative team in a consulting organization
  • You have a practical approach to the day-to-day work of story-writing and delivery and can draw a line directly from an overarching client strategy to your team’s outcomes
  • You enjoy unearthing the root cause(s) of a client’s pain points validating a business opportunity or problem and partnering to deliver a solution
  • You are a champion of Agile Lean and Continuous Delivery methodologies and love to mentor others
  • You understand how businesses operate and have experience modeling business processes using a variety of tools and techniques
  • You thrive when you’re leading a workshop or facilitating a learning session
  • You have a knack for prioritization obtaining buy-in from stakeholders and resolving conflicts as they arise
  • You’re resilient and flexible in ambiguous situations and can approach challenges from technical and business perspectives
  • You have a genuine passion for quality software and the know-how to get from sketch to code


A Few Important Things To Know

Projects are almost exclusively on customer sites so candidates should be flexible and open to travelling locally within Singapore and very occasionally within the region.

Job Title: Central Procurement Office: Manager - Procurement Business Analyst
Job Description:
Department: Central Procurement Office

Description

As a Business Analyst for the Central Procurement Office the candidate will be a change agent in identifying and communicating data-driven insights in making informed decisions through data analytics. You will work closely with Procurement leadership team Business Partners and stakeholders in fostering an effective working relationship to support recurring and ad hoc reporting and analysis. You will have the opportunity to develop and expand your Procurement analysis skills and help drive changes in the Procurement process improvement journey as part of NUS Organizational Excellence initiative.

Duties & Responsibilities
  • Gather prepare process and analyse spend and transaction data to gain insights and drive procurement strategy and initiatives
  • Undertake analysis to identify key categories and support the development of specific category strategies
  • Prepare and consolidate data analysis presentations for internal business reviews supplier negotiation market benchmarking and industry trends.
  • Performs economic research and prepares analyses to identify supplier opportunities and risks
  • Develop dashboards and templates for reporting SLA/ KPI and drive performance improvement
  • Contribute to and participate in compliance reviews and work with procurement leadership to ensure compliance with policies and standards.
To be successful in this role you will need strong analytical skills stakeholder management and end-to-end knowledge of procurement processes.

Qualifications

The ideal candidate should have Bachelor Degree in Business Business Administration/ Management Engineering Supply Chain Management Computer Science or related field of study qualified with:
  • >3 years of experience in data analytics and visualisation
  • Having strong project management skills and ability to drive change management and continuous improvements.
  • Possess strong communication and stakeholders management.
  • Experience in Excel modelling (lookup and pivot table) and preferably with programming and SQL knowledge
  • Proficient with data visualisation software such as Tableau Qlik or Power BI
  • Familiar with SAP and ERP systems relating to procurement contract management and vendor management would be advantageous
  • Team player with cross-cultural skills.

Job

Executive and Administrative

Primary Location

Kent Ridge

Organization

Central Procurement Office

Schedule

Full-time

Your role:

Within our Process Solutions (PS) Business Tools & Digitalization Organization the Business Data Analyst will report to the Head of Incentive Compensation. With significant contribution of business tools and territory management for improving revenue and developing sales methods for one or more geographical areas this role is responsible for understanding a variety of data sources and points of tools required to implement and manage APAC territory management.

Success in the role will require a self-starter with a passion for data analysis a mix of business acumen and technical expertise commitment to iterative improvement and the ability to build and leverage strong relationships with internal stakeholders to accelerate business growth through actionable insights.

Working closely with the Sales leaders Analytics and reporting team Incentive team Analytics team (ACE) Business Technology and IT you are responsible for the design and deployment of optimal solutions and technology for the following business needs:

  • Sales reporting project: lead and implement the business tools enhancements for APAC specificities (end customer details) from the ERP booking up to the global sales reporting tool
  • Territory Management project: Define implement & maintain territories across multiple systems and participate as a key PS subject matter expert in tool integration projects
  • Interaction with all level of sales personnel and cross functional departments within the organization in order to provide them with support regarding Sales Territories Sales Hierarchy and other related areas
  • Independently or working with 3rd party team administer and maintain territory changes annually or resulting from organization shift as well as changes or territory maintenance activities throughout the year (i.e. maintain territory alignments customer allocation…) in a timely manner and within set timelines to ensure territory and sales incentive payout quality.
  • Data Analytics: support the design deployment and maintenance of relevant dashboard and analytics specific to territory review and alignment such as sales performance analysis (i.e. target versus actual performance) for this region using global corporate integrated tool (Palantir Tableau BI) and leverage the existing Life Science analytics to this region.
  • Design and maintain appropriate documentation around Territory management.
  • Research study and analyze system or process related incidents reported suggest and communicate resolution to key stakeholders.

 

Who you are:

Minimum requirements

  • University degree in Business or Finance +3 years of experience in the business financial or controlling environment in the pharmaceutical or life science industry
  • Advanced proficiency in database and reporting tools MS excel. Rigorous analytics sense of confidentiality well-structured and disciplined
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and strong ability to work in global and multicultural environment. Strategic thinking; goal-oriented and dedicated to meet deadlines
  • Proven experience as a Territory Management expert/ Business Data analyst
  • Ability to develop sales strategies and use performance KPIs
  • Problem-solving aptitude
  • Ability to train/coach employees or 3rd party team
  • Occasional travel expected

Additional Attributes

  • Understanding of the Pharmaceutical/Biopharmaceutical/Life Sciences Business Environment
  • Ability to work independently and develop personal initiatives
  • Sense of confidentiality well-structured and disciplined
  • Assess sales performance according to KPIs ensure efficiency of sales methods.
  • Monitor competition within assigned region
  • Prepare and submit reports to the Sales Director

Zespri is more than simply the world’s single-largest marketer of kiwifruit. We like to think of ourselves as fruit on a mission and as rebels with a cause: to help people communities and the environment around the world thrive through the goodness of kiwifruit.


We supply one of the world’s healthiest little superfruits to millions of people around the world in more than 50 markets. We are one of New Zealand’s best-known international brands dedicated to creating sustainable long-term value for growers.


Strategy Analyst

You will be responsible for analysing business topline & bottomline growth metrics to support improved decision-making in these areas as part of the 10 year strategy development process as well as wider strategic projects. This role has a strong focus on the establishment and continued improvement of analytics to unlock volume and value growth optimization automation and reporting. 


In this role your key responsibilities will be as follows:  


1.Drive the 10 year business growth and the respective analytics reporting business intelligence and growth scenarios with financials


  • Guides management decision-making with data management analytics reporting and financial modelling.
  • Informs opportunities on market & global submissions across Pricing Advertising & Promotion Customer Funds Post-harvest costs etc. via value chain analysis costs analysis growth phasing analysis; in-line with global guidance; with a focus on global overview optimized risks return on investment improved demand and value growth for the mid to long term.
  • Leads development automation and refinement of allocation optimization scenario planning tools
  • Provides recommendations on strategic changes to business assumptions pricing structures etc. in order to lift market and/or grower returns.
  • Identifies potential sources of OGR improvement at a market & global level via ad-hoc ‘deep dive’ analysis and modelling of value chain.
  • Manages OGR (Orchard Growth Returns) calculator development with finance to enable broader business to plan and make decisions required to achieving Global OGR objectives.
  • Establishes 10 year plan dashboards and reporting tables charts for Board papers and other management reports.
  • Supports integration of 10 year plan with in-season planning highlighting key changes to demand and value plan.


2.Provide support for the Global Integrated Business Planning (IBP) process and system development (supports Horizon Subject Matter Experts Head of Growth Strategy)


  • Involvement as required to integrate strategy processes into the broader Integrated Business Planning (IBP) process.
  • System setup management & data flow integration with other systems with Horizon team enabling long-term planning


3.Provide analytical and reporting support for wider strategic initiatives

  • Supports refinement and implementation of Market Development Framework (MDF) changes
  • Establishes and maintains mid to long-term competitor intelligence economic trend analysis informing potential risks and opportunities
  • Provides support analysis or information to strategy projects around the business (markets functions other topics).
  • Prepares analysis or consolidates information to support other ad hoc business queries as required.
  • Collaborates with Business Intelligence & Analytics team to drive use of and improvements in analytics space


In order to be successful bringing this to life you will ideally bring the following experiences with you:

﻿

Business & soft skills:

  • Able to gather manage analyse data and articulate recommendations
  • Able to scenario-plan with clear assumptions and rationale; tenacity to keep going to get the best scenarios of growth with minimal risks
  • Commercial & Business acumen
  • Strong stakeholder management and interpersonal skills
  • Self-motivated proactive and able to work under pressure with minimal supervision
  • Planning and Organizing: sets clearly defined objectives; plans activities and projects well in advance and follows though in a timely manner
  • Strong communication & coordination skills with cross functional/global/regional/market teams
  • Ability to sense-check data recognize anomalies and ‘think outside the box’
  • Excellent verbal and written communication


Technical skills:

  • Knowledge of analytics frameworks i.e. PTW PEST SWOT BCG matric VIRO etc.
  • Advanced data/financial analytics/modelling skills with ability to manage and operate large and complex data sources essential.
  • Advanced Excel Proficient with Word PowerPoint and Office 365 suite tools
  • SAP and Power Business Intelligence experience preferred.


Qualifications:

  • Tertiary qualification in relevant fields finance. MBA preferred
  • Minimum of 3 years' experience working in a similar role covering regional/global commercial business development analytics. Experience of this within a management consulting firm is advantageous.


In return Zespri offers competitive remuneration a great working environment opportunities to develop and grow and flexibility. If you would like to be a part of our growing team and to find our more hit apply!


Zespri will not accept applications or contact from any temporary staffing agency placement service or professional recruiter for this vacancy (“Agency”). 

 

Where Zespri requires the support of an agency to fulfil a vacancy we will proactively seek this support from our network of Agencies. We respectfully ask that you do not contact Zespri or any of it’s affiliates/employees regarding vacancies and reserve the right not to reply.

Agent's Responsibilities

As a Business Analyst you will get involved in a multitude of tasks supporting the business team. You will be the go-to person for communicating insights on the performance of our services for internal teams and customers through creating presentations and writing reports. You will be required to conduct market research analyse data and structure and complete ad-hoc analysis. We are looking for a motivated and meticulous individual who has a genuine interest in data and business and has strong storytelling and communications skills as well as a strong ability for analytical problem solving.


  • Conduct market research to support strategic business planning initiatives product development and business operations
  • Interpret data and work with internal teams to deliver data-driven presentations and reports for internal teams and external customers
  • Perform ad-hoc analysis as required


Competencies

  • Minimum Bachelor’s degree ideally in a highly analytical/numerical subject or equivalent experience
  • Strong desire to learn and adapt

Job Title: APAC Corporate Client Banking & Specialized Industries| Business Manager| Analyst
Job Description:
The Corporate Client Banking & Specialized Industries (CCBSI) business focuses on North American European and most recently Asia Pacific companies typically with revenues of over $500mm which require traditional banking services in addition to investment banking products.  The business  organized into regional and industry verticals partners with investment bankers credit and other  product partners to offer customized and complex financing solutions to our clients.
The CCBSI Finance and Business Management (F&BM) team is responsible for the organization delivery and execution of both strategic and tactical initiatives to support the business. The team partners closely with the CCBSI geographic and industry groups CCBSI senior management and key product and functional partners through various initiatives.
The Business Management Analyst will work under the direction of CCBSI’s International Business Managers to support projects and initiatives pertaining to CCBSI’s expansion into Europe and Asia as well as managing ongoing business needs. The role offers a platform to potentially grow and develop into a Business Manager role or other roles within F&BM.
  Key Responsibilities:
- Support Business Managers in partnership efforts with leadership including Head of CCBSI International or Asia Head via tactical and strategic assistance to help drive their businesses including:
- Assisting with key business management functions including project management analysis of sales/management reporting and ad-hoc requests
- Gaining exposure and building knowledge of financial results and other data to understand business drivers to support opportunities to grow the business
- Helping manage the group’s portfolio by supporting strategic targeting efforts from a tactical perspective and by executing data maintenance and client transfers between lines of business
- Engage with bankers treasury teams and other key business partners to gather input insights and   data that feeds into reporting leveraged by CCBSI senior management in CB and senior partners   across the firm
- Provide support to bankers as it pertains to Dashboard and reporting questions including researching issues
- Assist with select CCBSI-wide Business Management efforts under the direction of Business Managers
- Act as a local extension of F&BM by facilitating communication with the business  supporting F&BM efforts and working on joint projects (based on need)
Across all responsibilities:
- Identify areas for continued process improvement and enhance efficiencies by generating innovative ideas and solutions
- Analysis and reporting of key trends and themes for senior audiences
- Prepare presentation materials to be shared with management business groups and other relevant stakeholders
Key Skills Required:
- Execution and organizational skills – Well-developed organizational skills to manage multiple tasks and priorities. Able to quickly and effectively respond to rapidly changing business needs and urgent requests. Able to explore innovative ways to perform tasks in an efficient and timely manner. Must be proactive detail and results-oriented and willing to drive change. Strong time management and follow-up skills; flexibility ability to prioritize requests and multi-task.
- Communications skills – Must possess strong verbal and written communications skills with ability    to present updates requests ideas and other communications in a professional clear and concise manner. Proactively provides timely updates to Business Managers and others while working on projects/tasks.
- Problem solving skills – Strong problem solving and analytical capabilities coupled with the ability     to identify issues gather and manipulate data obtain consensus and implement change. Able to outline work process in a thoughtful and detailed manner. Intellectually curious with a genuine interest in knowledge gathering and problem solving.
- Technical and analytical skills – Able to produce accurate error-free analysis and reporting. Applies knowledge of the business and its drivers to ensure that the groups’ analyses are sound. Capable of synthesizing large amounts of data in Excel and from internal systems to develop strategic conclusions
- Interpersonal skills – Speaks and acts with the appropriate level of confidence and empowerment; demonstrates professional assertion. Ability to partner with Business Managers and actively listens to instructions feedback and viewpoints from others while proactively seeking feedback. Able to collaborate with individuals across the business to achieve goals while proactively looking for opportunities to continue building strong internal relationships.
Qualifications:
- 1-4 years of work experience in Investment/Commercial banking or management consulting experience is a must
- Business management and/or project management experience preferred
- Expertise in Excel (ability to program in VBA is essential) and PowerPoint
- Familiarity with internal JPMC systems (e.g. Client Central CKC Dash) is a plus
- Experience in Sharepoint Designer is preferable
- Minimum of a bachelor’s degree is strongly encouraged

Description

The APJ ISV Segment team is looking for a talented driven self-directed Business Analyst to join an organization that is responsible for driving adoption and embedding of the AWS platform by ISVs and end customers around the world. This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in a fast growing business and to provide significant value for customers building lean innovative new companies. Specifically this role will include measuring and monitoring scaling metrics and analytical insights that will measure the success and drive the week-to-week development of the AWS ISV Segment team. You will work closely with members of the Sales Partner Marketing Operations and Services teams to ensure we are capturing and surfacing the best data and information to make optimal business decisions. You’ll collaborate with engineers to build self-service reports and establish automated processes for large scale data analyses. Successful candidates will be analytical with business acumen and detail driven with excellent problem solving skills.

The ideal candidate will have a rock-solid background in report extraction and dashboard management analysis including experience extracting and manipulating data using SQL and producing digestible business intelligence and actionable information. The candidate should also have strong communication and project management skills enabling them to work with key business stakeholders to understand requirements and shape analytical deliverables. He/she should also have a demonstrated ability to work closely with the ISV Segment leadership to drive cross-organizational engagements and work on strategic programs and initiatives for the APJ ISV Segment team. A keen sense of ownership drive and scrappiness is a must.


Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics Statistics Engineering Computer Science Economics Finance or related field
  • 7-10+ years of industry experience in data analysis.
  • Experience in SQL and manipulating large data sets in a database
  • Advanced proficiency in Excel (including VBA Pivot Tables array functions Power Pivots etc.)
Preferred Qualifications
  • Strong planning and teaming skills including multiple project management and scheduling etc.
  • Experience or familiarity with the ISV community including B2B startups accelerators venture firms and more
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Excited to learn new technologies and analytical methodologies relating to business intelligence and data analysis
  • Strong communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills to translate ambiguous business requirements into complex analyses and actionable insight

Overview

AvePoint is seeking a Business Analyst with enterprise software solutions experience to join us in our Client Services division.

What will you be doing?

The Business Analyst analyzes business processes and applicable automated systems and develops As-Is and To-Be descriptions. This individual leads requirements gathering and analysis activities prepares and delivers written and oral communications participates in testing activities helps design methods and procedures for internal and external projects.

Your Responsibilities Will Include
  • Elicit requirements for software development using interviews document analysis requirements workshops surveys business process descriptions use cases scenarios business analysis and task and workflow analyses
  • Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources reconcile conflicts decompose high-level information into detail identify risks and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs

  • Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: Functional requirements (Business Requirements Document) Use Cases GUI Screen and Interface designs

OK I’m interested… is this the job for me?

We look for people who value agility passion and teamwork; those who can bring fresh ideas to the table and want the opportunity to learn grow and expand their careers. Bring your aptitude and build upon what you do best at for our customers partners team and you.

You will need to be a confident individual with the ability to motivate a team and ensure high standards are maintained. This role requires someone that can work on complex issues simultaneously and is able to provide viable solutions.

Other qualities that you’ll need to be a fit for this role include:

  • Understands Internet Intranet Extranet and client/server architectures
  • Professional experience with analyzing and documenting complex business processes software development requirements and taxonomies.
  • Professional experience with requirements gathering and analysis
  • Experience producing and analyzing As-Is and To-Be documentation

  • Strong analytical and project management skills including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements

  • Familiarity with MS Office Suite (Word Excel Powerpoint)

  • Experience supervising junior associates including conducting interviews making hire recommendations and completing performance reviews

Job Title: VP/FVP| Functional Business Analyst - RM tools| Group Technology and Operations
Job Description:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific Europe and North America. In Asia we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China Indonesia Malaysia and Thailand as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time we have been guided by our values — Honorable Enterprising United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right build for the future work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work consistently be it towards the company our colleagues or our customers.

About The Department

The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership technology operations risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.

 Requirements Analysis & Elicitation

Team Collaboration

Testing & Scope Management
  • Clarify test findings escalated by Test Manager and classify the findings accordingly (either as a defect or change request)
  • Perform impact assessment and estimation for Project Change Request

  • Passionate diligent and resilient individual with ability to thrive in ambiguity
  • Experience in scoping and evaluation – Defining overall considerations including scalability maintainability cost operations and technology principal risk to provide a recommendation.
