You are an advanced professional in the systems & process design and implementation space with experience in Avaloq software and Wolters Kluwer OneSumXFRR regulatory reporting tool implementation projects.  


Reporting to the APAC Head of Finance you will solicit understand and document the user's business requirements processes and workflows in order to develop both written and visual depictions of requirements and process flows.  You will create the functional and technical specifications that meet those requirements serve as a subject matter on those functions and work with business users to test the developed functionality.  


Working closely with the business users through each stage of the development lifecycle and also demonstrating both existing and new functionality to the business user’s stakeholders you will proactively identify and resolve problems and be responsible for recommending and instituting business and system analysis best practices tools and methodology.


You will develop and maintain understanding of business user workflows and business needs to support.  You will deliver precise functional specifications to include functional hierarchy workflow business rules interface design and definitions outstanding issues data analysis and data mapping to business users and development teams.  You will be responsible for direct interaction with business users business analyst including but not limited to eliciting comprehensive business requirements and use cases and recommending appropriate solutions.  


You will gather requirements and help build and document specifications for development teams where necessary.  You will also work with the Technical team to develop high-level labour estimates to develop and deploy functionality.  You will conduct gap analysis between application and stated business users requirements and collaborate with the business analyst and developments teams to estimate project impact if required.  You will work with the business analyst development teams and production support teams to communicate verify and test the desired functionality changes.  


You will also work with the business users and business analyst to demonstrate the changes to the systems to ensure all relevant business needs are addressed.  You will develop training materials and provide training in one-on-one or classroom environment and manage multiple competing priorities through effective organization and communication.  You will recommend and institute best practices and methodology and tools and be responsible for Avaloq Accounting rules (Booking/ Balancing) Profit Centre Costs & Fees Taxes (GST etc).  


You will be responsible for mapping and specification delivery for regulatory projects e.g. revised MAS610 etc. legal reporting e.g. Wolters Kluwer OneSumXFRR etc. Head Office data warehouse delivery e.g. meeting new/ adhoc requests.  You will also be involved in internal processes and procedures documentation; e.g. activity reporting release notes etc.


Pre-requisites:


  • Minimum Diploma in IT (Degree is preferred)
  • Minimum 10 years of relevant work experience
  • Knowledge in accounting and the finance aspect of the Avaloq software will be a strong advantage

Job Description



Role spans Business Transformation across consumer enterprise digital and customer services



Role Purpose:

As part of StarHub's overall strategic transformation journey to accelerate its digitalisation efforts PCCW Solutions was selected as its IT technology transformation partner. This partnership will lead to rationalisation of legacy IT platforms and systems and delivery of agile new IT capability to enable simplification of processes and operations. This will result in enhanced customer experience and quicker time to market.

Reporting to the Programme Director of Business Transformation the primary focus of this role is to own the entire requirements process for the business across multiple business units functions & products. You will be the single point of convergence in regard to the to-be business processes needs outcomes requirements success metrics & traceability to quality assure the IT transformation delivery is in accordance to current & future business needs. The Lead Business Analyst will be business and commercially orientated with strong knowledge and experience of business process engineering requirements capture and business onboarding of the solution that is delivered via a large transformational programme. The Lead Business Analyst will be supported from other Business Analysts and Process Engineers who will cover specific functional areas and technical analysis.



Responsibilities:

  • Own the portfolio view of all business processes and requirements across divisions functions areas and products (e.g. CBG EBG Digital CS HR LEGAL FINANCE COMPLIANCE SHINE etc.)
  • Span multiple units functions areas products stakeholders and delivery teams to ensure continuity of business requirements throughout the lifecycle of the transformation programme
  • Embed business outcomes requirements leading customer and user experiences and digital into process and requirements documents and traces down to delivery
  • Seamlessly bridge the business and technical worlds with ability to simplify the super complex
  • Strong ability to spot bad requirements and knows how to put it right. Ability to play the role of a Business Analyst and Process Engineer themselves as well as be able to guide and lead other Business Analysts and Process Engineers
  • Capture organise harmonise critically evaluate decompose and simplify business need and new value propositions into a set of clear understandable actionable and measurable set of processes and requirements
  • Resolve conflicts using interviews requirements workshops business cases benefits modelling use cases user journeys business process analysis consumer feedback analytics capabilities/constraints non-functional compliances and safety policies
  • Ensures non-functional requirements are captured as necessary
  • Sign off on test scripts test stages and reports to ensure the solution acceptance criteria and overall business need is being accurately tested so business acceptance can be met
  • Comfortable and has previous experience working in a multi speed Waterfall and Agile delivery model
  • Identify and suggest changes needed to business process or new processes that need to be in place for the successful delivery and in-life usage of the solutions
  • Identify and instruct the creation of training packages and modules to scale knowledge distribution in the most efficient way
  • Actively track and report progress to the project managers and programme director





Qualifications



  • Degree in Business IT Engineering or related discipline preferably with certification in Business Analyst / Business Process Re-engineering.
  • 6 - 8 years' experience in complex transformational projects in Technology space with at least 3 - 4 years of relevant experience as a Business Analyst / Process Engineer.
  • Strong experience of eliciting distinct requirements from multiple stakeholders through to successful solution delivery traceability and business run
  • Strong leadership interpersonal time management prioritisation and communication skills with the ability to communicate technical concepts to business stakeholders and influence trade-offs
  • Significant experience of successful complex digital transformation solution delivery and business onboarding at scale and pace
  • Can effectively navigate a matrix multi-stakeholder environment (from business leaders and teams technology leaders and teams to incumbent suppliers) to influence and successfully capture concise and clear requirements for multi-faceted projects across business and technology workstreams
  • Can command respect enthuse and create a sense of team spirit
  • Strong ability to proactively find resolution to issues and pre-empting problems
  • Exceptional knowledge of software development methodologies and interworking of Agile and Waterfall multi-speed delivery models and scaled Agile programmes
  • Strong knowledge of operations and in-life application run activities
  • Strong commercial knowledge and business case development
  • Good balance of commercial technical customer experience and user experience
  • Good knowledge of Design Thinking & Lean
  • Strong knowledge and portfolio of successful business change programmes where you have played a Lead Business Analyst role - examples with references will need to be provided

At Klook the World is #YoursToExplore - literally. The opportunities are yours for the taking if you’re brave enough to embark on this journey with us. Our team of diverse Klookers are passionate about travel collaborating tirelessly across time zones to bring people together through the best experiences. Collectively we are fearless in our pursuit of success - learning fast and adapting faster to build the future of travel. Up for the challenge? Join us today!

Role Overview

Klook provides a seamless way for travelers to explore the popular attractions tours local transportation food and beverage and unique experiences around the world on Klook’s website and app.

To support our growth into the new category of stays we are looking for an analytically savvy entrepreneurial yet process driven individual to build our pricing capability for the stays business.

This role will partner closely with product operations and business development teams to design scalable processes to ensure we are able to offer the most optimized and competitive price to our customers by owning price modeling updates and price reporting of our growing organization.

What you'll do:
  • Competition monitoring and benchmarking:
    • To identify the right data set for us to take actions and work with external providers to capture competitiveness
    • Define variables modifications coverage requirements for generating price comparisons
    • Work with internal / external stakeholders for managing cost of data gathering and also maintaining a healthy record of pricing data
  • Taking pricing decisions and managing workflow with the internal teams
    • Analyse the competitor pricing data and identify requisite actions to offer the best prices on Klook
    • Identify appropriate enhancements to the price display combination or bundling to improve the conversion rate or driver revenue growth
    • Work with the product team in defining the road map for future development and improving our product capabilities
  • Planning and reporting
    • Help articulate the pricing strategy and approach for the senior and cross functional stakeholders
    • Defining key metrics targets and reporting structure for the senior management regional / BU teams
    • Identify areas for improvements and gaps. Work with BU leadership to roll out appropriate solutions for the same
What you’ll need:
  • Entrepreneurial DNA: Ability to own lead and setup work flows and functions from scratch
  • Program / Process management Abilities: be comfortable to initiate and manage complex programs/projects.
  • Comfortable with ambiguity: A lot of the work we do is new be comfortable with not knowing all answers
  • Analytically Solid: uses data to find tangible value for the organisation. Strong with SQL Python and Excel
  • Min 2 years experience in the revenue or pricing management role in travel industry
  • Prior OTA experience is preferred
  • A start-up attitude – highly collaborative with an entrepreneurial roll-up-your sleeves attitude that ’s not afraid to work independently when required
What you will get:
  • An environment that values honesty transparency and respect with awesome co-workers across Asia
  • The rare opportunity to be part of building a global travel brand ensuring its success and evolving it for the future

Job Title: Corporate and Workplace Solutions| Business Finance Spend Management| Procure to Pay| Analyst| Singapore
Job Description:
Who We Are

The Goldman Sachs Group Inc. is a leading global financial services firm providing investment banking securities and investment management services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations financial institutions governments and high-net-worth individuals. The firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in London Frankfurt Tokyo Hong Kong and other major financial centers around the world.

CWS

Comprised of Corporate and Workspace Solutions (CWS) and the Office of Global Security (OGS) the division focuses on commercial management client support advisory solutions strategic planning risk management people security real estate and technology solutions. The division delivers a world-class work experience and environment to the people of Goldman Sachs. We effectively manage the firm’s third party operating expense including fostering opportunities to innovate and enable sustainable approaches while also managing the risks associated with vendor engagements and a contingent workforce. Our core disciplines focus on the following areas: Third Party Governance Strategic Sourcing Infrastructure and Transformation Procure to Pay and Product Finance.

The objective of the Procure to Pay (P2P) group is to deliver commercial value and front-to-back cost transparency across the firm. Under the Spend Management umbrella and focused on the front-to-back theme the Procure to Pay team is divided into 3 pillars - Procurement Management Expense Management and Accounting & Tax Control.

Position Summary

 RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS

This role will be responsible for directing and coordinating all aspects of Expense Management activities. This person will be the internal subject matter expert for the processing and control of external vendor fees and travel & expense and is expected to manage the relationship with the stakeholders from all the divisions in the firm and work effectively with our partner companies who support the operational processes/employee’s expense program as well as any other internal expense management systems.

This role will oversee support and maintain the day to day activities of all Expense Management functions including payment to vendors & service providers employees’ travel & expense supplier profile set-up tax & regulatory reporting query management and policy adherence for Asia entities.

Role And Responsibilities
  • Manage payments to vendors & service providers for Asia entities including vender profile set up and invoice processing in SAP payment platforms.
  • Acquire in depth understanding of the regulations tax handling and accounting controls in multiple jurisdictions in Asia associated with vendor/ employees’ travel & expense payments.
  • Understand and adhere the firm’s policies on vendor governance payment management and documentations.
  • Handle business and management ad-hoc queries and requests respond to business queries on a timely basis.
  • Participate in firm wide platform changes relating to Expense Management.
  • Manage risks in the process by implementing and reviewing relevant controls.
  • Conduct data analysis to identify the trend/root cases in order to effectively engage the stakeholders to address problems and opportunities for improvements.
  • Develop and deliver training programs to the team and end-users.
  • Exhibit confidence in communicating in a variety of forums sessions formal presentations training sessions and town halls.
  • Work with Engineering Divisional Finance and internal departments/divisions from a third party operating expense angle.
  • Building relationships with businesses at all levels within the corporation will be a key success factor for this position.

Qualification And Skills
  • Bachelor’s degree with 1-3 years’ experience in relevant profiles.
  • Knowledge and experience in accounts payable invoice processing employee’s travel and expense and vendor management.
  • Fluency in Chinese for business context (reading writing and spoken.)
  • ERP KnowledgeImplementation/Transformation experience on SAP (Concur Ariba Fieldglass S4/HANA) is preferred.
  • Hands on experience in end to end GL activities month-end activities (accruals sub-ledger / general ledger posting and reconciliations) is an added advantage.
  • Corporate Card Feed management/operation and handling payments is an added advantage.
  • Comfortable with spreadsheets and excellent knowledge of Office products.
  • Strong analytical organizational and interpersonal skills.
  • Should be able to effectively communicate and develop/sustain good working relationships with other teams and stakeholders.
  • Excellent partnership building skills and strong customer service perspective.
  • Effective organizational and time management skills.
  • Forward thinking with the ability to assert new ideas and follow them through.

About Goldman Sachs

 ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS

At Goldman Sachs we commit our people capital and ideas to help our clients shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869 we are a leading global investment banking securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York we maintain offices around the world.

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture benefits and people at GS.com/careers .

We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https:// www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html

Job Description:
In Asia Pacific BNP Paribas is one of the best-positioned international financial institutions with an uninterrupted presence since 1860. Currently with over 17000 employees* and a presence in 13 markets BNP Paribas provides corporates institutional and private investors with product and service solutions tailored to their specific needs. It offers a wide range of financial services covering corporate & institutional banking wealth management asset management insurance as well as retail banking and consumer financing through strategic partnerships.

Worldwide BNP Paribas has a presence in 73 markets with more than 196000 employees. It has key positions in its three main activities: Domestic Markets and International Financial Services (whose retail-banking networks and financial services are covered by Retail Banking & Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking which serves two client franchises: corporate clients and institutional investors. Asia Pacific is a key strategic region for BNP Paribas and it continues to develop its franchise in the region.

BNP Paribas offers you an exciting career in an international business environment that is fast-paced diverse and focuses on creating high-value relationships with our clients. We offer competitive salary and benefits as well as a working environment where you’re valued as part of the team.
  • excluding partnerships
https://careers.apac.bnpparibas/

Position Purpose
Role is part of the Business Analytics team of BNPP Wealth Management Asia that uses analytics and statistical methods to uncover insights from data to inform and guide business decisions.

Candidate will participate in all kinds of analytics initiatives ranging from exploratory data analysis building predictive models to delivering analytics insight reports to business users. He/she would be someone who is curious to find out why things work or don't work what are real drivers or causes of results and what kind of levers or practical measures can be used to influence change.

Responsibilities

Direct Responsibilities
  • Deliver data analytics projects
  • Carry out analytics activities at all stages of the data analytics life-cycle - understanding business needs sourcing cleansing and transforming data conducting exploratory data analysis developing and validating models and explaining analytics results implications and proposals in business terms
  • Engage stakeholders to understand business issues & opportunities and formulating it in a manner that can be analysed and modelled
  • Plan and track progress of analytics development activities
  • Identify and obtain data relevant for the analysis ensuring that proper data cleansing transformation and aggregation rules are applied explained and documented
  • Apply appropriate tools – R Python Tableau Business Objects SQL – for data extraction discovery aggregation statistical analysis and visualisation
  • Translate analytics findings and insights into actionable business proposals and activities
  • Prepare and present analytics findings and recommendations
  • Support ad-hoc analytics requests and regular reporting generation
  • Engage stakeholders to understand business requirements
  • Identify data needed to answer business questions consult data and process owners to assess whether data is available and if it is suitable for the task
  • Use appropriate analytics tools to extract cleanse filter aggregate and present data with a focus on meeting business needs and quick turnaround
  • Build and generate requested reports and dashboards ensuring that delivery meets agreed timelines insights are explained and analysis recommendations are actionable
  • Department Support
  • Support department initiatives and
  • Collaborate within BA team in joint analytics development problem solving and issues resolution
  • Support BA software application / tools enhancement / upgrade activities
  • Cover BA team members’ duties in their absence where needed
Technical & Behavioral Competencies

Skills
  • Critical thinking skills – ability to use data to find answers to questions to uncover and synthesize data behaviours and outcome connections
  • Data Visualisation skills – understanding of the science behind visualisation choices and expertise in designing effective high quality charts & visuals to present findings in a clear concise way
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills – ability to understand business problems summarise expectations explain analytical results and recommendations clearly in business terms
  • Problem solving skills – ability to assess situations verify facts formulate and propose alternatives.
  • Interpersonal skills – ability to interact with ease collaborate with diverse teams establish rapport and build trust.
Qualifications

Specific Qualifications (if required)
  • 1-2 years hands-on experience implementing data analytics projects or at the minimum hands-on experience in one or more phases of the analytics life cycle.
  • Bachelors or Master’s degree in Data Science Data Analytics or Applied Statistics
  • Expert level competency in one or more of the following tools - R Python Tableau Power BI Business Objects and SQL.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office and SharePoint collaboration tools.

SG-06-Singapore

Job Type

Standard / Permanent

OPERATIONAL EFFICIENCY TRANSFORMATION AND BUSINESS ANALYSIS

Job Description:

Get to Know Our Team:

The team dubbed the “cool kids” is unconventional exciting and mysterious. We embrace a culture of teamwork empowerment creativity diversity humour and diligence. We help shape strategic and operational decisions in the company by providing hard-to-obtain insights into the fields of transport food payments and platform services. Our value proposition comes from the many offbeat techniques used to complement traditional research and analysis. We are trusted and given the freedom to explore and innovate.

Get to Know the Role:

The Lead Market Analyst (Data) is someone who is:

  • Experienced and passionate in coaching and mentoring others
  • Exemplary in leadership qualities
  • Excited by solving complex and ambiguous problems
  • Creative in thinking up of new problems to solve
  • Intellectually curious - never being satisfied with what the data is saying constantly striving to derive additional insights
  • Comfortable with failing and possess the drive to keep trying
  • Critical in thinking and with a sharp eye for detail
  • Energetic and thrives in a dynamic and fast-paced working environment
  • Strong in data query/wrangling using SQL and Python/R/Scala and data visualisation using tools like Tableau
  • Strong in math and statistics
  • Experienced in application of Machine Learning
The day-to-day activities:

  • Coach and mentor the Market Analysts (Data) in the team
  • Strategise the integration of quantitative with qualitative insights
  • Problem-solve to ensure output of the team’s quantitative insights meet accuracy and timeliness requirements
  • Use quantitative tools to uncover strategic and operational insights on various business verticals regional markets competitors and any aspect of the external environment to help shape key stakeholders' perspectives
  • Explore analyze and aggregate data sets to provide actionable information. Create intuitive visualizations to convey these results to key stakeholders
  • Explore new data sources and types and develop new capabilities to further the team’s ability to provide valuable insights into the markets of interest
The Lead Market Analyst (Data) is not characterized by the following:

  • Specializing in ETL pipelining and other data infrastructure tasks. Though it is common to build and maintain some pipelines we have a dedicated Data Engineering team for this.
  • Building training and deploying machine learning models to production in support of our App. Most production models related to our App are managed by our Engineering and Data Science teams.
  • Taking an academic approach to Grab’s data. That is handled by our core Data Science team.
  • Responding to ad-hoc data requests from business teams. Most of the operational dashboards are maintained by our Data Analytics team.

Our client is looking for a Business Analyst who will be part of the APAC team to work closely with external and internal stakeholder across all functions/business supporting the implementation of Treasury Management System - Wall Street Suite (WSS) for APAC region.

This position will participate in any system deployment /upgrade projects related to Treasury working closely with Treasury Center of Expertise (CoE) to support continuous IT system improvement.


You will be involved in:
Business FitGap Analysis & Requirements Gathering:

  • Involve in Gathering Analyzing and Documenting of the Treasury Gaps and Requirements together with other Project IT team members CoE team and Business Users;
  • Update the finalized/approved requirements into ALM system;
  • Provide support in Requirements or Fit/Gap Review meetings;
  • Understand and document the end to end Treasury business processes and the impact for the module(domains) under WSS i.e. TRM (Trading) CMM (Cash) and ACM (Accounting);
  • Support and advise project team for any system changes that results in gap and requirement for WSS interface with other applications including ERP and those within the project or defined scope;

Interfaces:

  • Ensure that all interfaces to WSS interface including approved APAC localization interfaces are added and covered in under the global implementation template;
  • Connect and coordinate any cross-system interface issues/activities between the solution build team and integration team.

System Testing Training and Cutover:

  • Involve in the preparation review and update of test scenarios in ALM or agreed template;
  • Ensure testing scenarios traceability with business requirements;
  • Support system testing activities during all test phases - SIT UAT Penny Testing and Dress Rehearsal;
  • Support any cutover activities as agreed or aligned with the project team;
  • Support any user training activities as agreed or aligned with the project team.



Required Education Experience and Skill:

  • Bachelor's degree in Business Administration Computer Science or MIS;
  • Minimum 4 years of experience in TMS support for trading office cash/liquidity management accounting interfaces static data management regulatory reporting and external interfaces e.g. FXGO FXTE;
  • Knowledge of FX interest rate products equity/financing and the commodity markets is preferred but not mandatory;
  • Implementation experience in TMS(WSS or equivalent) is preferred but not mandatory;
  • Working experience in a large and global MNC is strongly preferred;
  • Strong analytical skills to interpret business needs and translate them into business requirements;
  • Able to articulate technical information effectively to non-technical people
  • Business fluency in English and Chinese to communicate with internal and external stakeholders in China.

Primary Location

Singapore

Job

Treasury

Organization

GT Business Management Unit

Schedule

Full-time

Job Posting

08-Oct-2020 10:14:33 PM

Company Background

Thunes mission is to enable businesses and their customers to participate in the global economy by providing them fast and affordable cross-border payments. Interconnecting mobile wallet operators platforms merchants money transfer operators payment service providers and banks to facilitate seamless payments we unlock opportunities for millions of people and businesses in emerging and developed markets.

Our Mission

To enable a world where emerging and developed markets have seamlessly interconnected cross-border payments.

Our Values

Our team is committed to think big work hard and smart and do the right thing. Above all we love what we do and we have fun!

Our Solutions

We act as a trusted neutral aggregator in a deeply fragmented industry. Without a trusted neutral and interoperable aggregator the partners of a payment transaction would waste time and costly resources developing their connections to multiple systems. Multiple connections would also mean that these actors have to charge higher prices which could prohibit financial inclusion and the spread of financial services.

We offer key payment solutions to tackle the speed cost-efficiency and accessibility challenges for emerging markets:
  • Business Payments
  • Mass payouts
  • Remittance processing
  • Virtual Accounts
  • International Trade Invoice Payments

CONTEXT OF THE ROLE

The Treasury team is responsible for all aspects of International Cash & Liquidity Management Cashflow forecasting Working Capital management and Foreign Exchange. The Treasury department is a friendly team-based environment that values interaction and exchange of ideas and knowledge. The new Treasury Analyst role is based in the Singapore office reporting to the Head of Treasury and FX and working closely with the rest of the team in the Singapore and London offices.

It is an exciting time to join the team for any professionals willing to progress their career.

Key Responsibilities

FX Execution Trading
  • Manage B2B FX execution flow with pay in and pay out partners including G10 and EM currencies and crosses. Confirm credit of funds at the pay out point and release pay in transactions upon confirmation; book and confirm executed deals
  • Monitor pay out partner FX costs to assure adherence to pricing agreements

FX Performance Analysis and Reporting
  • Produce FX margin analysis and reports identifying key drivers behind changes in FX margin – pay in partner volume mix FX market trends etc.
  • Work with Technology teams to automate retrieval of data and report production

Weekly FX Report
  • Design produce and distribute a short weekly FX report highlighting FX market moves affecting relevant pay in and pay out countries


Professional Experience/Qualifications

At Thunes to ensure we set out clear expectations for the business and you to succeed it is equally important for us in defining not only the nature of the role responsibilities but that the cultural fit in working style and approach is a match! So please read carefully below before putting yourself forward
  • The candidate will have 3-5 years of experience in a Treasury role with strong exposure to FX trade execution and processing
  • Solid understanding of cross border payments
  • Knowledge of market fundamentals and market analysis
  • Previous experience with FX reporting and performance analysis


About You
  • Bachelor’s Degree
  • Strong understanding of FX as a part of treasury business
  • Highly motivated with excellent analytical skills
  • Team player with the ability to communicate and coordinate with multiple parties
  • Good communication skills as the role will entail significant interaction with corporate partners
  • Curious mindset and Can-do attitude
  • Able to demonstrate a logical approach and innovative thinking

Sound like you? Apply now!

The ideal candidate will be responsible for the planning development and implementation of all of the Organization’s marketing strategies and analysis for New Equipment as well as its Service products both external and internal. As part of the Mitsubishi Power Asia Pacific's Marketing department the Market Strategy & Analysis team works closely with leadership within the Mitsubishi Power Asia Pacific's business units including New Equipment and Service and senior leadership to inform strategic decision-making—including insights into the market customers and competitors. You will lead the team with strategic data and information trend and scenario analysis and other business analytics in support of strategic planning and execution for the Mitsubishi Power Asia Pacific's business growth strategies

 

Responsibilities

  • The position reports to the General Manager Sales and Marketing and serves as a member of Marketing Organization.
  • Works with senior management to support strategic planning activities by providing actionable recommendations based on assessments of markets customers and competitors both existing and potential.
  • Identify and collect appropriate customer competitor market economic financial and/or operational data.
  • Perform financial statistical and qualitative data analysis of markets customers and competitors.
  • Translate data into executable and effective market and intelligence reports.
  • Participates with senior management and other management staff in charting the direction of the Organization assuring its accountability to all constituencies and ensuring its effective operation.
  • Within the Organization the position has primary working relationships with the President and CEO Executive Vice President senior management team staff of the Marketing function and the service providers



Market Strategy and Analysis

  • Profiles the Mitsubishi Power Asia Pacific's assigned market (including the ones requested from the HQ) and competitive environment providing insights that support strategic decision-making and for use in internal presentations by senior leadership.
  • Creates and updates comprehensive industry competitor and customer models including but not limited to market share growth projections and trends and market forecasts.
  • Performs thorough systematic analysis of key industry trends; the general social economic and political environment; legal and regulatory issues; customers; current and potential competitors.
  • Provides market and competitive insights through presentations and reports to the Executive Leadership Team and various internal management teams to allow effective strategic and tactical decision-making and implementation.
  • Supplies the market and competitive intelligence component of strategic planning and proactively makes recommendations to management concerning key intelligence items that require further consideration.
  • Maintains up-to-date knowledge of data sources evaluating their credibility and potential utility and leverages them across the company where appropriate.
  • Develops and maintains relationships with key internal customers to identify emerging needs and business challenges.
  • Creates marketing collateral for external presentations focused on key industry trends and value propositions which support our core technologies and products.
  • Works with internal business customers to enhance their use of strategic analysis and market and competitor intelligence—in particular through use of the CRM—to ensure that appropriate communication channels are maintained. Collaborates internally to ensure intelligence is shared with appropriate groups and individuals.
  • Maintains an in-depth knowledge of designated markets and trends through reading reports market research data manipulation and financial modeling and analysis.
  • Develop Long Term Market Analysis Report as well as work closely with senior management to develop Long Term Growth Strategy Plan.


Planning and budgeting

  • Responsible for the achievement of marketing/analysis mission goals and financial objectives.
  • Ensure that evaluation systems are in place related to these goals and objectives and report progress to the Sales and Marketing Vice President.
  • Develop short- and long-term plans and budgets for the market analysis program and its activities monitor progress assure adherence and evaluate performance.
  • Recommend short- and long-term Organization goals and objectives to the Sales and Marketing Vice President.
  • Develop implement and monitor systems and procedures necessary to the smooth operation of the market analysis function.
  • Keep informed of developments in the fields of marketing and the specific business of the Organization and use this information to help the Organization operate with initiative and innovation.


Organizational strategy

Work with senior staff as well as other staff to:

a. Develop and maintain a strategic perspective -- based on marketplace and constituent needs and satisfaction -- in organizational direction program and services and decision-making; and

b. Ensure the overall health and vitality of the Organization.

  • Help make sure that the Organization’s philosophy mission and vision are pertinent and practiced throughout the organization.
  • Develop and coordinate means to seek regular input from the Organization’s key constituencies regarding the quality of programs and services and the Organization’s relevance.
  • Help formulate and administer policies to ensure the integrity of the Organization.
  • Act as an internal consultant to bring attention and solutions to institutional priorities.


Managing

  • Maintain a climate that attracts retains and motivates top quality personnel both paid and volunteer.
  • Recruit train appraise supervise support develop promote and guide qualified personnel. Ensure effective management within the marketing and communications function with provision for succession.
  • Design support and oversee cross-functional teams throughout the Organization.
  • Effectively enable volunteers and staff so they can take action on behalf of the Organization by:

a.     transmitting the Organization’s values vision and direction;

b.     engaging people in the meaning of the Organization;

c.     respecting and using the skills expertise experience and insights of people;

d.    providing direction and resources removing barriers and helping develop people’s skills;

articulating expectations and clarifying roles and relationships;

e.     communicating which includes helping people transform information into knowledge and learning;

f.      encouraging people to question organizational assumptions and ask strategic questions;

ensuring quality decision-making;

g.     anticipating conflicts and facilitating resolution;

h.     engaging people in process as well as tasks; encouraging people use their power practice their authority and accept their responsibility;

i.      modeling behavior; and

j.      coaching people to success


Education level and/or relevant experiences

  • Marketing / Corporate Communications experience in Power Industry
  • Bachelor / Master Degree of Commerce/Economics (Preferred)
  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience in market analysis with demonstrated success preferably in the power industry or related industry.
  • Solid understanding of the international power generation industry.
  • Strong customer focus and organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects under tight deadline constraints.


Knowledge and skills

  • Ability to network effectively at all levels and influence without direct management oversight.
  • Demonstrated strength in problem solving and analytics and capable of driving insight to action.
  • Ability to articulate with strong presentation skills and to contribute to executive-level discourse; excellent written communication abilities.
  • Able to operate within a team environment.
  • High level of competence with Microsoft Office suite (in particular advanced Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills) is essential.
  • Demonstrated skills knowledge and experience in the development design and execution of market analysis initiatives and activities.
  • Strong creative strategic analytical organizational and personal sales skills.
  • Experience developing and managing budgets and hiring training developing supervising and appraising personnel.
  • Proficient with database software and statistical tools.
  • Commitment to working with shared leadership and in cross-functional teams.


Other requirements

  • Strong oral and written communications skills.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects at a time.
  • Out-of-town overnight travels are required.

We embrace the notion of Family at Versent working together to achieve outstanding success. We have monthly social events to bring everyone together often supporting charity initiatives such as TourXOz and RUOK Day. We're supportive of bringing both kids and dogs into the office (which makes it a bit more lively!) and have a flexible work environment.

VERSENT VALUES AND BEHAVIOURS

People: We believe in a positive team with family spirit because life is too short for anything else.

Quality: Be Artisans who care for their craft and lead change through continuous improvement.

Reliability: Do what we say we will do when we say we will do it every time.

Transparency: Full disclosure integrity and honesty in all things.

Reciprocate: Give back and assist as much as possible whenever possible.

Job Title: Business Operations Analyst| Senior to Staff (Mobile Business Unit)
Job Description:
Company:Qualcomm CDMA Technologies Asia-Pacific Pte. Ltd.Job Area:Operations Group Operations Group > Business OperationsJob Overview:
Qualcomm is a company of inventors that unlocked 5G ushering in an age of rapid acceleration in connectivity and new possibilities that will transform industries create jobs and enrich lives. But this is just the beginning. It takes inventive minds with diverse skills backgrounds and cultures to transform 5Gs potential into world-changing technologies and products. This is the Invention Age - and this is where you come in.

Job Overview

The Business Operations Analyst Senior/Staff is primarily responsible for conducting comprehensive product level analysis and reporting to enable data centric business decisions. In addition providing support for the forecast and product lifecycle management for the Mobile BU. Accountable to conduct analysis identify new requirements as needed and provide recommendations. The knowledge gained through these analyses will also applied to improve forecast accuracy and enable successful product transitions while maximizing supply and minimizing E&O.

Key Tasks To Include
  • Create reports and Dashboards to meet requirements:
    • Publish reports on a pre-established cadence (daily weekly or monthly)
    • Identify significant changes and conduct follow up
    • Conduct Demand validation


  • Support the forecasting process for the Mobile BU by conducting data validation in depth analysis and reporting. Key tasks include:
    • Track month over month changes and key drivers
    • Identify chipset changes month over month and ensure accuracy
    • Conduct chipset attach rate analysis and validation



  • Support the Design Win Validation process:
    • Conduct analysis and work cross functionally to validate volume projections

The Business Continuity Analyst reports to the Business Continuity Director and will be responsible for our BC program in APAC where 23 of our 109 offices sit. This role requires a significant understanding of business continuity planning methodologies and support of critical business operations. The business continuity analyst will assist in maintaining and improving the business continuity program to improve resiliency and protect our brand and reputation. The business continuity analyst will support preparation for and response to emergencies.


RESPONSIBILITIES:


Responsible for supporting the administration of our global business continuity program including:

Ensure that Business Continuity program components (Business Impact Analysis Risk Assessments plans strategies etc.) are current effective and address our business requirements.

Develop schedules and materials for Business Continuity training/awareness activities to ensure that business continuity teams are trained and proficient in implementing the business continuity plans.

Coordinate business recovery exercises (Walk-throughs Recovery Centre Remote etc).

Administer and manage content on the Business Continuity SharePoint and Intranet sites.

Manage emergency communications with employees Administer communications tools

Ensure that new acquisitions are integrated into our business continuity management program.

Support the Crisis Management Team to include scheduling conference calls supporting emergency communications preparing and distributing status updates guiding decision-making ensuring execution of action items and creating post-incident reports.

Support business continuity related initiatives to include site selection strategy development in-house training

On call monitoring of global events.

Work closely with the Director of Business Continuity Planning as well as Business Leadership on significant projects that support our BC program

Support the ROW when required to cover for colleagues in those regions


REQUIREMENTS:


Knowledge or experience in business continuity planning - commensurate with 3-5 years of experience.

An understanding of Information Technology concepts.

Proficient in Microsoft Office suite of applications (Word Excel PowerPoint Access SharePoint etc.).

Very strong analytical skills.

Very strong verbal written and presentation skills.

Must be able to interact and work efficiently and effectively with employees across the organization.

Strong administrative skills including effectiveness in developing project plans to achieve target dates.

Ability to be on call to support off-hours emergencies.

Able to travel (domestically and internationally)

Must be a productive team player and must also be comfortable working independently with little direct supervision.


PREFERRED:


Undergraduate degree

Professional Designation – Certified Business Continuity Professional (CBCP MBCI etc.).

Prior business continuity experience at a large organization or business continuity consulting.

Experience in managing disruptive incidents (significant multi-site incidents would be a strong plus).


BC Team

Alongside the Business Continuity Director are two other analysts one covering the Americas and the other Europe. So this role forms a team of three covering the globe. RBA has 109 offices in 25 countries

Who we are

Analysys Mason is recognised across the world as the leading Management Consulting firm focusing on telecoms media and technology (TMT).


Since 1985 we have worked with the main players in the TMT market becoming an influential and recognised adviser in the industry. Our work has an impact not only on our clients’ strategies but also on local governments and regulators who we advise on key industry developments.


Our Consultants and Analysts are based in 17 offices across 13 countries and they have worked in more than 100 countries making Analysys Mason a truly global company. 



What we do

We give strategic advice and produce quality analysis for mobile and fixed operators internet players regulators financial institutions cable and satellite companies content and media players governments lawyers postal industry stakeholders and vendors.


Analysys Mason is recognised as an influential partner for clients around the globe on all aspects of strategy transaction support transformation regulation & policy and research services.


Your new role

Depending on your experience you will join us as a Senior or Principal Analyst. You will be part of our team of influential experts who specialise in the TMT industry. While being based in Singapore you will collaborate with our teams worldwide.


You will be responsible for the development of research primarily focused on the APAC telecoms market producing innovative strategic and influential content. You will work with other programme leaders and analysts to ensure that this content support the overall business objectives.


Your topic of expertise will be led by the commercial priorities of telecoms players in the APAC region and could include prospects for 5G prepaid-postpaid migration monetisation of content digital services etc.


As a senior member of our team you will take a significant role in engaging with our existing client base. Working alongside our Sales team you will also build commercial relationships with new clients across the region demonstrating the value of your research output as well as that of the wider Research proposition.

 

To do so you will run client presentations webinars podcasts and conference presentations combining industry expertise & opinion with commercial awareness and drive. 


Your tasks and responsibilities

  • Identifying emerging technologies and growth opportunities for the telecoms sector in the APAC region and beyond.
  • Managing and executing one or more research programmes.
  • Developing thought leadership based on in-depth market knowledge of the APAC region.
  • Delivering content to high quality in line with the Analysys Mason brand.
  • Delivering reports and results to clients. Producing webinars podcasts and conference presentations. Attending summits and industry events.
  • Collaborating with colleagues setting the agenda for current & future TMT research programmes.
  • Representing the APAC client base in internal discussions.
  • Proactively engaging with existing and new clients demonstrating the value of research programmes and enhancing revenue generation opportunities.


Your skills and experience

  • Deep industry knowledge
  • Experience as an Analyst and / or ability to provide original insightful analysis.
  • Strong commercial acumen and experience in interacting with clients.
  • Ability to develop models and forecasts.

About the SGUnited Traineeships' Program

Sephora SEA is participating in the Singapore government's initiative to support those who have recently graduated or will soon be graduating from the Institute of Technical Education (ITE) Polytechnics Universities and other private educational institutions in 2019 or 2020 to take up traineeship opportunities across various sectors. Traineeship Title:

Regional Corporate Treasury Analyst (9 months)


Job Description:

The Regional Corporate Treasury Analyst – Trainee - will be immersed in a regional treasury organization with exposure to cash management in the retail industry liquidity structure FX and Treasury Management System Implementation. The Regional Corporate Treasury Analyst will work closely with the Regional Treasurer in improving daily cash management organization optimize liquidity positions and leverage on technologies to transform the Regional Treasury centre into a strategic business partner within the organization. The Regional Corporate Treasury Analyst - Trainee will be in charge of some key treasury transformation projects and will provide cash analysis in order to support the Regional Treasurer in daily treasury activities.


The Regional Corporate Treasury Analyst - Trainee will be involved in:


1.     PROJECTS

  • Support the implementation and deployment of our Treasury Management System – that will help provide real-time cash position streamline cash management processes and enhance visibility on cash performance;
  • Lead or participate in special ad-hoc projects such as Business Intelligence tool for treasury implementation automation of Balance Sheet reporting merchant fees analysis – depending on the candidate’s expectations;
  • Identify opportunities for business process efficiency improvements;


2.     CASH MANAGEMENT AND REPORTING

  • Perform daily cash reconciliation and consolidate FX transactions on monthly basis;
  • Support local teams and Regional Treasurer in building and analysing cash flows actuals variances and forecasts;
  • Coordinate internal process deadlines and reporting schedules;
  • Perform bank fees analysis;


3.     SYSTEMS / PORTALS MAINTENANCE & ADMINISTRATION

  • Administer all cash and treasury related portals and internal systems;
  • Support Internet Banking systems administration to ensure internal compliance and full security;
  • Perform ad-hoc audits on accesses;
  • Maintain bank authorized signatories;
  • Act as an expert advisor on payment issues for the local finance teams.


This is a great opportunity to join a recent and dynamic team – providing treasury expertise services and support to all SEA ANZ markets including Singapore Malaysia Thailand Australia New Zealand South Korea Indonesia and India – with a strategic Shared Service Center based in Jakarta.

About The Company


Founded in 2015 to address the unmet financing needs of SMEs Validus is today the largest online lending marketplace in Singapore with a growing presence in Indonesia Vietnam and Thailand.

 

An award-winning Fintech Validus uses data analytics and AI to provide growth financing to SMEs via funds from HNWIs and institutional investors. Backed by global VCs our mission is to drive financial inclusion for SMEs through technology data and industry collaboration.

 

As with the SMEs we serve we may be small but together we are a mighty force! Our success is dependent on what each of us does how we do it and our belief that we can always do better. We’re building a strong team of passionate capable individuals who are committed to making Validus the best online lending marketplace in the region.

 

We are looking for an enthusiastic detail-oriented professional to join our Group Technology team in our Singapore office. The ideal candidate will have critical-thinking and problem-solving abilities and a passion to drive large-scale digital projects to implementation with accuracy and efficiency. As a member of the Group Technology team of the Company they would also be expected to provide business solutions and support to markets outside Singapore for our offices in Indonesia and Vietnam.

IFC—a member of the World Bank Group—is the largest global development institution focused on the private sector in emerging markets. We work in more than 100 countries using our capital expertise and influence to create markets and opportunities in developing countries. In fiscal year 2020 we invested $22 billion in private companies and financial institutions in developing countries leveraging the power of the private sector to end extreme poverty and boost shared prosperity. The Manufacturing Agribusiness & Services (MAS) Industry Group plays an important role in supporting IFC’s strategic priorities covering investments in the global manufacturing and services agribusiness health and education sectors. MAS’ sectors play a critical role in providing goods and services to consumers; addressing core needs creating jobs contributing to government revenue and stimulating growth. In IFC’s client countries these sectors can account for as much as 80% of overall economic activity and can account for up to 90% of employment activity particularly in the poorest countries. 

 

MAS is looking for a Portfolio Analyst to be based in Singapore to support the MAS Regional Management Team (RM) in the management of MAS’ Asia-wide portfolio and new business program. The Portfolio Analyst will provide analytical and administrative support to the RM by analyzing data conducting portfolio risk analysis compiling reports and presentations and monitoring investment compliance and reporting. The Portfolio Analyst will be an integral part of the portfolio support team and will work closely with the teams in East and South Asia. 


Duties and Accountabilities:


Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Provide analytical support to RM in compiling and evaluating pipeline deal flow including tracking development impact and other corporate performance indicators
  • Analyze trends and discuss quarterly changes in portfolio returns (RAROC IRR) risk ratings and portfolio quality relating to MAS’ Asia-wide portfolio;
  • Use IFC databases and systems as well as third party sources e.g. Bloomberg to prepare regular reports for RM review and internal reporting;
  • Support RM in monitoring and analyzing industry trends company updates and reporting back to RM; 
  • Monitor the collection of income and fees from clients. Track MAS’ income statement KPIs and periodically report to RM on performance vs. KPIs;
  • Prepare quarterly portfolio reports review such reports for accuracy and consistency in reporting. Analyze and interpret portfolio report to prepare summary of portfolio performance for discussion at quarterly portfolio meetings;
  • Support quarterly portfolio meetings by scheduling meetings compiling materials identifying areas of risk and concern and benchmarking performance for the division.


Selection Criteria:

  • Bachelors degree in business statistics computer science or information management or equivalent field required and minimum of 5 years’ relevant professional experience.
  • Data management skills including knowledge of Python/R as well as ability to generate reports and presentations in Excel and PowerPoint is essential. Aptitude to learn new systems in a must.
  • Excellent written verbal communication and presentation skills plus fluency in English is a must. 
  • Ability to speak a second language e.g. Mandarin is a plus. 
  • Ability to think independently analyze problems and identify appropriate solutions is a must.
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills with proven ability to work efficiently under time constraints.
  • Strong interpersonal skills teamwork and client-service orientation is a must. 
  • Knowledge of IFC's portfolio procedures and processes or strong previous relevant experience is a plus.

Dell provides the technology that transforms the way we all work and live. But we are more than a technology company — we are a people company. We inspire challenge and respect every one of our over 100000 employees. We also provide them with unparalleled growth and development opportunities. We can’t wait for you to discover this for yourself as a Global Supply Management Senior Analyst on our team in Dell Singapore.

Global supply at one of the world’s largest technology companies is no small challenge. It’s complex fast moving ever changing and above all exciting. It keeps our people on their toes. Our Global Supply Management team within Materials and Procurement takes charge of global supply planning for specific platforms and commodity areas. Focused on business goals and objectives we take the lead in supplier selection product delivery specifications and quality. We succeed through our ability to develop and maintain strong working relationships with global internal and external supply chain partners.

Responsibilities

COS Management
  • Responsible for commodity continuity of supply
  • Acts as a single point of contact for all commodity related demand and supply issues/ requirements. Interfaces with Demand Planning organization to gather commodity demand requirements and trends. In case of demand push-outs or pull-in lead discussions with Demand Planning and other internal stakeholders to determine the best course of action on supplier commits
  • Participates in commodity management and core team meetings to support supply manager action items for all product development
  • Coordinates with Global Commodity Managers to drive the commodity COS strategy
  • Works with the supplier to negotiate the lead time and other supply requirements and communicates the supply plan to internal stakeholders
  • Works with buyers and suppliers to ensure COS is maintained at all the build sites
  • Accountable for supplier’s operational performance business and uses the commodity Quarterly Business Review (QBR) process to manage supplier performance
  • Support new part qualification as required per commodity strategy

Inventory Management
  • Plans manages and tracks inventory belonging to the commodity
  • Responsible for aging inventory depletion and E&O working with internal stakeholders
  • Tracks all the commodity risk buys and provides periodic status updates to all stakeholders
  • Support commodity EOQ inventory targets by ensuring inventories are within acceptable range defined by the commodities

Industry/Market Trends
  • Follow the industry trends on commodity
  • Keep track of supplier products/roadmaps for the commodity
  • Drive the periodic commodity outlook review with business teams

Required Expertise And Skill-set
  • Bachelors Degree or Masters in related discipline
  • 1-3 years of related supply chain experience
  • Leverages business acumen and subject matter expertise of IT/semiconductor component procurement
  • Provides deep subject matter expertise advice and program delivery
  • Contributes to the development of new techniques and plans within area of expertise
  • Manages projects and program execution
  • Works on abstract and complex problems requiring evaluation of intangible variables
  • Integrates trends data and information into plans deliverables and recommendations
  • Develops innovative and creative output based on interpretation and analysis that improve business performance and contribute to corporate goals and strategic intent
