  • Strong analytical communication influencing problem solving and facilitation skills
  • Self-motivated and able to work independently
  • Only Singaporeans may apply

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst| Payments Programme (9 Months Contract)
Job Description:
Position Description


Business Analyst is required to support the rollout of the Payments centralisation Programme. Specifically this role will need to support the implementation of the Pelican Payments and Transaction Monitoring Module in order to provider Straight Payments and compliance monitoring for client transactions. Requirements include:

     

  • Collation of client and payment data
  • currency revaluation & translation capability
  • management reporting capability
  • interpretation and aggregation of several data sets


Key Responsibilities


  • Work with the Projects Payments Team in building a best of breed payments and transaction monitoring platform with a specific focus on the Singapore clients and payments
  • Analyse and scope requirements for onboarding clients in Vistra
  • Manage and/or perform the migration of client payment and client profiles to Pelican.
  • Assist business teams to reconcile financial and non-financial data.
  • Provide key subject matter expertise for the payment program and help support local Pelican users and superusers.
  • Bridge the gap between the technical and business subject matter experts and add valuable input to implementation projects and system enhancements.
  • Organise meetings and workshops with the wider project team to evolve high level scope into detailed requirements and corresponding deliverables.
  • Support UAT activities such as prepare for UAT test cases.
  • Support the business in documenting their detailed process steps in a Standard Operating Procedure (SOP).
  • Apply industry best practices and suggest improvements to senior stakeholders.
  • Communicate insights and plans effectively to cross-functional team members and management.
  • Ensure adherence to company’s change framework governance and project management standards and templates.
  • Support project manager in developing detailed delivery plans.
  • Write BRDs (business requirements documents) FRD (functional requirement documents) gap analysis and TOM’s (Target Operating Model) and contribute to the Global Playbook material for the program


Relevant Skills & Experience


  • 5+ years of work experience in a Business Analyst capacity.
  • Good working knowledge of how client payments operate and integrates with the wider business and technology environments.
  • Good working knowledge of the relevant Pelican modules is desirable: general ledger/advanced accounting accounts payable and investment management for complex multi-currency fund structures and investor reporting.
  • Good understanding of other compliance (GDPR Privacy Banking regulations) and transaction monitoring requirements.
  • Experience of data-extraction and client onboarding processes relating to Private Wealth and Payment providers
  • Relevant industry experience and exposure to the business processes and controls relevant to the financial payment services business.
  • Advanced business analysis and problem-solving skills – gather data execute quantitative and qualitative analyses and develop recommendations.
  • Strong stakeholder management skills and ability to work closely with senior management to identify and implement efficiencies and continuous improvement.
  • Good verbal and written communication skills with an ability to effectively convey complex technical information in a clear and concise manner.
  • Strong understanding of the project management processes.
  •  Self-motivated. Must be highly organised able to multi-task balance and prioritize multiple issues and work independently with little supervision.
  • Experience of implementing and/or maintaining business systems and applications in a financial/professional services organisation is desirable.
  • Must have excellent skills with MS Excel PowerPoint Visio and other Microsoft Office applications.
  • Travel as business needs require.

 

Professional Qualifications


  • University degree preferably in a business finance or computer science discipline.
  • Qualifications relating to real estate fund services or alternative fund administration desirable.

Manufacturing and Planning Senior Business Analyst will require in-depth knowledge of Manufacturing process and solutions and other related business applications.

  • Deploy/Enhance Manufacturing applications like Oracle ERP(ASCP) MES and related applications
  • Partner with business functional owners and third party consultants to support current applications and solutions

  • Lead projects with manageable risks and resource requirements applying Project management fundamentals

  • Eager and curious to explore new digitization technology for automation

  • Adaptable to new technology and change management
  • Ensure compliance of operations within area of concern with all relevant EHS regulatory requirement and SCIEX safety policies procedures and guidelines

Zeno Group Singapore has a mantra: “Fearless work for Fearless Clients”. An integrated digital-social by design agency we produce creative campaigns for local regional and global clients. In doing so we solve business problems and help our client navigate an ever-evolving landscape through a unique blend of creativity and technology.


We are looking for a problem solver someone who has passion for modern marketing. As a Marketing Analyst you will be responsible for managing all ongoing data and analytics need for our client business. You will be responsible for working as part of a team of analysts working on various client projects serving both internal stakeholders and external clients across Asia Europe and North America. You will work well in an entrepreneurial environment be keen to innovate and be capable of melding social listening and web analytics together. In addition you will help to evolve the data and intelligence offering to improve Zeno’s products and services.

 

Responsibilities

  • Provide research intelligence and actionable insights
  • Build semantic queries used to collect data in order to respond to client’s business problems and needs developing and managing social dashboards analysing both quantitative and qualitative data and providing recommendations
  • Manage organize and present data from various sources (social web paid social etc.) developing and delivering both regular and ad-hoc reports for leadership
  • Utilize social listening tools for event-based reporting and ad-hoc reporting of pre-determined key topics
  • Conduct audits of social content to ensure maximum efficiency of creative used and to ensure correct application of tags
  • Stay abreast on best practices and latest trends in social media digital marketing web analytics SEO SEM digital content and campaign management
  • Attain proficiency in available tools to subsequently evangelize said tools to colleagues and stakeholders


Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in business marketing or related fields
  • Fresh graduates are welcome to apply
  • Experienced in social analytics media monitoring and using social measurement tools such as Sysomos Brandwatch Digimind Crimson Hexagon for analysis
  • Strong understanding of social media platforms like Facebook Instagram and Twitter
  • Proficient in Boolean keyword management data validation and data cleansing
  • Demonstrate strong understanding of English language as mandatory requirement
  • Fluent in other languages used in APAC will be highly valued
  • Excellent presentation and communication skills
  • Strong analytical skills. Must be able to analyze information at both a macro level and a more detailed level and make strategic recommendations
  • Excellent team player

ABOUT BLACKROCK

BlackRock’s purpose is to help more and more people experience financial well-being. As a global investment manager and a leading provider of financial technology our clients—from grandparents doctors and teachers to large institutions—turn to us for the solutions they need when planning for their most important goals. We are building a culture of innovation curiosity and compassion one that enables every employee to make an impact.


THE ANALYST PROGRAM

The full-time Analyst Program is a multi-year experiential journey designed to empower and support Analysts in connecting their personal passions and strengths to BlackRock’s mission principles and purpose. The program begins with an orientation to learn about our purpose business and strategic priorities – all while gaining insights into the day-to-day life of an Analyst at BlackRock.

Following orientation Analysts join their business area and stay connected with colleagues across the globe through ongoing training and professional development. This program offers Analysts the chance to have a lasting impact on the firm and contribute to our greater collective purpose to help more and more people experience financial well-being.

Throughout the program Analysts will have an opportunity to do meaningful work with diverse colleagues across the globe all with the support of a company that’s committed to their well-being and invested in their success.

We hire curious lifelong learners and support their growth through virtual and in-person training certificate programs company-wide hackathons and analyst training programs.

Additionally we provide a breadth of benefits and programs to support your physical financial and mental well-being. From virtual healthcare to money management support and free confidential counseling we continuously evaluate and update our benefits to make sure they meet our employees’ needs.


OUR BUSINESS AREAS

Advisory Services

Provide strategic advice and solve critical and complex financial issues for a diverse client base - from financial institutions and regulators to governments around the world.

Analytics & Risk

Develop and deliver tailored advice risk management and investment services to governments corporations and many of the world’s largest investors.

Business Management & Strategy

Drive key initiatives collaborate with internal and external partners and ensure coordinated delivery of our capabilities.

Business Operations

Work with business areas across the organization to deliver a seamless end to end investment management process providing operational support to our portfolio management teams and client groups.

Finance & Internal Audit

Provide thought leadership across the firm’s control and risk management environment to improve decision making and help achieve the firm’s objectives.

Investments

Build and analyze investment strategies portfolios and products for a broad range of institutional and retail clients.

Legal & Compliance

Understand and advise on the impact of regulatory requirements and best practices protect the firm’s reputation and partner with the business to meet our clients’ expectations.

Marketing & Communications

Develop strategies that grow our brands and company purpose to drive profit build relationships with both existing and new clients and solve systemic client needs in key areas across the firm.

Sales & Relationship Management

Develop and deliver investment products and solutions for clients worldwide. Create marketing strategies around these solutions and use them to build new client relationships.

Technology

Build and support Aladdin the technology platform that powers our firm and the investment industry as a whole. Utilize sophisticated technology to develop applications deliver custom solutions and ensure a superior user experience.

Job Title: Analyst Relations Manager - APAC (based in Singapore)
Job Description:
Zoom is growing at an explosive pace by every measure - revenues people innovation and customers. Led by Eric S. Yuan the #1 ranked CEO on Glassdoor our unique culture of caring and happiness makes Zoom an awesome place to work. We are expanding teams across the organization. If you are motivated by delivering happiness come join us at Zoom!

Zoom Video Communications is looking for an Analyst Relations Manager - APAC (based in Singapore) to join our Product Marketing team. The APAC Analyst Relations Manager works as part of a global Analyst Relations team to build deep strong relationships with key market analysts (Gartner Forrester IDC and others) to educate them about all things Zoom. In this cross-functional role you will work closely with our product sales and marketing teams to help grow market share and awareness through effective industry analyst interaction and engagement--on a global basis with focus on the Asia Pacific region.

Responsibilities
  • Define measure and drive our analyst relations program to meet global strategic objectives
  • Develop clear engagement plans with key Tier 1 analysts based in APAC including regular briefings inquiries messaging and collateral reviews
  • Advocate and drive our message and market position with the analyst community
  • Build meaningful and strategic relationships across a range of horizontal and vertical industry analysts
  • Establish Zoom as a leader in strategically important analyst rankings and reports
  • Connect senior business and product leaders with key influential analysts in Asia Pacific
  • Link regional customers with analysts to solidify our market position
  • Ensure consistent unified global messaging to the analyst community by facilitating communication between key analysts and Zoom executives across the business and in multiple regions and local countries
  • Collaborate with global and regional marketing and communications teams to distribute thought leadership and news to analysts
  • Contribute to planning/organization/implementation of “analyst day” events: Perspectives 202X. Determine feasibility of localized analyst events.
  • Support sales teams as well as other stakeholders on regional analyst relations programs and activities
  • Work with marketing and product teams to develop strategy messaging positioning and sales tools/assets based on analyst content and opinion
  • Work on analyst content and presentations for regional trade shows as well as for our annual user conference Zoomtopia.
Requirements:
  • 5+ years of professional experience in communications and/or product marketing/management for an enterprise SaaS company including 3+ years in Analyst Relations
  • You have excellent written and verbal communications skills in English and other languages (as appropriate)
  • You’re humble and have a natural curiosity to always learn more
  • You’re a rock star and multi-task like nobody’s business
  • You have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
  • You are comfortable presenting in front of executives and other groups
  • You are a team player and have strong interpersonal skills
  • Experience working with or leading enterprise analyst relations programs and have existing established relationships with global and regional analysts and the proven ability to tailor initiatives and activities to local markets.
  • Working knowledge of video conferencing phone and chat products in the competitive space (optional)
  • Expert-level experience using ARchitect analyst management software (optional)
  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent

Position Summary

Refinitiv Oil Research is looking for a dynamic individual to join the team as a Senior Analyst covering the Asia Crude Oil market. The Oil team is part of Refinitiv Commodities Research which is a team of more than 150 analysts committed to delivering insight and intelligence to the physical and futures markets. The successful candidate is expected to lead the coverage of the Asia Crude Oil market from an Oil Flows and Pricing perspective. Refinitiv Oil Research has built an innovative groundbreaking analytical tool to make real-time assessments of physical oil flows by demand/supply regions.

A career with us presents a unique opportunity to develop and apply new knowledge and skills to better understanding the production flow and consumption of the world's most basic materials.

Role Responsibilities
  • Produce the daily real-time Oil Flow assessments working with the Dirty Petroleum Products team
  • Studying and making assessments of vessel flow movements
  • Produce Price Forward Curves for the Crude Oil market
  • Interact with market participants regularly as part of the assessment process
  • Leveraging deep domain expertise vast data resources and the Eikon platform
  • Act as trusted partners of commodities professionals worldwide

Qualifications
  • 3-5 years of experience in the physical Crude Oil market from the trading and/or reporting perspective
  • Sound knowledge of Crude oil flows globally and deep market-level contacts from across the trading spectrum encompassing front-line traders to the broad shipping community
  • Analytical and numerate with good Excel skills to form short-term views of the Crude Oil market
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate those views clearly and concisely via regular reports to a professional audience
  • Team player
  • Degree or Masters

Job Title: HR Business Intelligence Analyst| People Analytics – 6 months Contract
Job Description:
Role Purpose

This is a fixed-term 6 months opportunity to work inside our People Analytics team.

The HR Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst is responsible for working directly with internal clients from all parts of the business to ensure they receive the HR data and reports required. This means responding to HR data requests designing and developing reports and analysis supporting data requirements assessments building data collection processes for HR and business stakeholders and providing data analysis support in executing HR projects.

In This Role You Will-
  • Develop a suite of reports analytics and dashboards for the new “Future Skills Programme”
  • Develop understanding of a broad range of JLL’s data sources and know when how and which to use to identify/answer business challenges related to JLL’s talent
  • Support the development and roll-out of new data products
  • Contribute to projects related to People Analytics/Future of Work
  • Support the research opportunities to solve meaningful business problems and communicate findings using visualizations
  • Deliver complex reporting requests
  • Support JLL-wide efforts on maturing data ecosystems and analysis tools

Education And Qualifications-
  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in a field of Mathematics Operations Research Social/Behavioural Science Statistics or Computer Science
  • 3+ years of work experience with complex datasets with an emphasis on data analytics preferably in Human Capital Analytics or employee related research
  • Ability to analyze large datasets detect and correct errors interpret and simplify results to various audiences
  • Experience in developing processes for data collection
  • Strong problem-solving skills including the ability to effectively address any issue in collaboration with others as appropriate; ability to proactively anticipate problems and opportunities and confidence to use initiative to pursue solutions

Technical Skills-
  • Extensive knowledge of Excel
  • Extensive knowledge of a visualisation tool (Tableau preferred)
  • Experience designing and developing business facing dashboards and data visualizations in BI platforms
  • Experience with SQL or other languages/statistical packages (R Python preferred)
  • Proven application and understanding of advanced statistical methodologies (regression clustering probability etc.) and academic research methodologies

Interpersonal Skills-
  • Excellent customer relationship skills and ability to listen and communicate well at all levels of the company
  • Great attention to detail with solution-oriented attitude that focuses on continuous improvement and can navigate around ambiguity
  • Good organization and prioritisation skills to facilitate working across multiple projects
  • Ability to clearly articulate problems and solutions translate complex into simple
  • High degree of professional judgment professional maturity integrity credibility

What We Can Do For You-

At JLL we make sure that you become the best version of yourself by helping you realize your full potential in an entrepreneurial and inclusive work environment. We will empower your ambitions through our dedicated Total Rewards Program competitive pay and benefits package.

Apply today!

Are you ready to join a team in a global company where you will support the Asia business and report directly into the Head of Pre-Sales for the region? Join Western Union as a Technical Implement Analyst.

Motivated by our values: purpose driven globally minded and trustworthy & respectful

We’re a FinTech that’s using insight from customers and colleagues worldwide to improve financial services for families small businesses multinational corporations and non-profit organizations. We’re a team of over 10000 people spanning 200 countries and territories. We believe when money moves better things happen.

Better requires process discipline and simplification

You’ll address customer queries that arise during the implementation process and setting appropriate expectations on WUBS capabilities. You will work closely with the business to determine scope of projects and requirements including liaising with relevant business areas to ensure complete understanding of implementation. For such a detail-driven role you will have 3+ years of experience in implementing software projects. You will have experience working with financial institutions or in the financial sector. Strong experience with IT skills in Excel and PowerPoint. You will be fluent in English Cantonese and Mandarin.

Join us and let’s move money for better

Western Union is transforming its business and shaping the financial services sector by driving quality convenience and customer service to new levels of excellence. It’s an exciting time for our organization as the largest cross-border money transfer operator trusted by millions of consumers around the world. Job Summary

The Red Hat Asia Pacific (APAC) Finance team is looking for a Compliance Analyst to join us in Singapore. In this role you will become part of the compliance program supporting Southeast Asia business by authenticating customer and order information. You’ll become part of a team that monitors sales and partners in order to ensure that they comply with Red Hat's business requirements and processes. You’ll perform evaluation of internal controls communications risk assessments reporting and maintenance of documentation related to compliance. As a Compliance Analyst you’ll be required to assist and support the organization with initial compliance and ongoing preparation testing and monitoring of conformance to the requirements of the company’s compliance policy and guidelines.

Primary Job Responsibilities
  • Obtain and document accurate end customer and order data by examining orders on a daily basis
  • Detect or prevent frauds in sales and partners from identified orders
  • Provide continued education and advice to the sales team regarding compliance requirements
  • Anticipate emerging issues through order validation findings and data analysis
  • Deliver regular validation results update and analysis report
  • Coordinate and communicate with various business teams and a variety of stakeholders both internal and external in support of clean and robust business in the region
  • Perform additional validation tasks or responsibilities when required

Required Skills
  • Fluent in Bahasa Indonesian and English
  • 2-3 years of experience working in finance sales operations order management or customer service
  • Record of working with confidential data and adhering to high ethical standards
  • Demonstrated data tracking analytical and reporting skills using G Suite
  • Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
  • Bachelor's degree in finance commerce statistics marketing communication mathematics or database management

About Red Hat

Red Hat is the world’s leading provider of enterprise open source software solutions using a community-powered approach to deliver reliable and high-performing Linux hybrid cloud container and Kubernetes technologies. Red Hat helps customers integrate new and existing IT applications develop cloud-native applications standardize on our industry-leading operating system and automate secure and manage complex environments. Award-winning support training and consulting services make Red Hat a trusted adviser to the Fortune 500. As a strategic partner to cloud providers system integrators application vendors customers and open source communities Red Hat can help organizations prepare for the digital future.

Red Hat is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. Job Title: Strategy| planning and operations Lead – Pre-sales (SE)- APJ
Job Description:
VMware software powers the world’s complex digital infrastructure. The company’s cloud networking and security and digital workspace offerings provide a dynamic and efficient digital foundation to more than 500000 customers globally aided by an extensive ecosystem of partners. A proven leader VMware allows customers to build run manage connect and protect applications across clouds and devices in a common operating environment.

VMware is committed to being a force for good from its breakthrough innovations to its global impact. Our team of 30000+ people working in 50+ locations worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term by living our values of passion innovation execution teamwork active learning and giving back. If you are ready to accelerate innovate and lead join us as we challenge constraints and problem solve for tomorrow today.

Job Role And Responsibilities

VMware is looking for a talented business partner to our CTO (and SE-leadership team) and the ultimate collaborator to fill this strategic role within our Strategy Planning and operations Organization. This individual will drive an executive level cadence and integration across the organization while managing execution of strategic initiatives to accelerate sales. As a candidate for this role you will have a proven track record of building consensus across a diverse and complex environment developing and implementing strategies to improve business outcomes and identifying areas to optimize resources processes and programs. This role requires a strong understanding of complex field organizations across sales Solutions Engineering & Architecture customer success and ecosystem partners as well as proven analytical and operational skills and outstanding cross-group collaboration.

The successful candidate will be a ‘Strategic Doer’ with great energy initiative and leadership qualities that inspire teaming and trust to influence cross functional teams.

Role Summary
The role will support Asia Pacific and Japan (APJ) Solutions Engineer & (SE) Pre-sales teams and Strategy planning and operations leadership in developing and executing sustainable business strategies supporting semi-annual fiscal planning and manage business cadence and reporting. The person will be a Business Partner to the VP for the Presales (SE) organization in APJ ensuring the continued success of this business unit. The core responsibility of the individual will be to provide analytic and business insight to support the decision making of the business.

Duties & Responsibilities
The main task is to take full operational responsibility for the APJ SE organization.
  • Measure the business performance and create clear Performance Indicators that enable the Business leaders to successfully grow the business
  • Be a trusted strategic advisor/partner to the team providing valuable insights to ensure the continued success of the business
  • Drive strategy and implementation of best practices
  • Have an in-depth understanding of resource and capacity planning modelling
  • Contribute in the Business Planning Process
  • Assists Pre-Sales (SE) management with specific and ad-hoc report and dashboards requests to support strategic and tactical initiatives.
  • Key member of the global pre-sales (SE) leadership team responsible for helping in to develop and execute our strategy in APJ.
  • Assess effectiveness of current programs processes and resource alignment in critical areas refine and optimize accordingly
  • Engage with finance and operation partners to drive P&L and business data analysis to prepare executive level reviews and make and execute strategic decisions to optimize the business
  • Drive alignment and best practices application across regions and shared functions to implement our multi-cloud vision
  • Develop frameworks to help structure the team’s thinking drive visibility facilitate alignment and establish an operating rhythm of the initiatives to ensure the programs are running effectively and efficiently to meet goals and objectives manage risks and issues and improve team communication and collaboration.
  • Triangulate leads pipe bookings by solution & competencies to support ad hoc reporting needs with data-driven insights to support business decisions.
  • Publish real-time reporting using business intelligence tools.
  • Manage Pre-sales operations including business cadence process effective pipeline management by respective routes to ensure business accountability & predictability as and when needed.
  • Actively work with cross functional teams such as Regional Partner Business Core Sales Professional Services Business Units Shared services/Centre of Excellence Enterprise Data Analytics teams.
  • Manage & present business performance in periodic business review meetings to key internal stakeholders and drive implementation of consistent processes and best practices across APJ.

Requirements & Experience
  • Proven experience in Business Operations or Finance gained within a fast-paced high-tech organization
  • Comfortable working with Senior executives at all levels to ensure the successful execution of strategy through informed decision making
  • Experience in architecting organizational engagement models
  • Exceptional analytical skills & confident working with an onsite and remote analyst team
  • Excellent communications skills with the ability to synthesize simplify and explain complex problems to different types of audience including executives
  • Proven analytical ability of designing organizing into useful business metrics & dashboards to drive business cadence and make operational decisions.
  • Experience in various Business intelligence tools such as Power BI Tableau SAP HANA preferred and with a variety of Enterprise tools including Salesforce
  • Highly motivated analytical thinker keen eye for details results-oriented with a “can-do” attitude.
  • Excellent and proven ability to manage multiple cross-functional projects with competing priorities.
  • Ability to deal with stress ambiguity and navigate through a high-paced fast-changing and sometimes unpredictable work environment and accommodate with flexibility.
  • 7+ years of experience in sales/pre-sales (SE) strategy or GTM roles enterprise software or cloud company.
  • Great business acumen and exceptional strategic thinking skills balanced with operational execution capabilities
  • Creative with strong problem-solving skills analytical and process mindset and attention to detail
  • Demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • C-suite relationship engagement and management
  • High performer with track record of exceeding performance expectations and metrics

Job Description

It's an exciting time of growth for IF we’re inviting a results driven individual to join our Greater Asia division as Senior Analyst Asia Finance Operations.

This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced talent with Finance Analytics specialization to be part of a global leading Flavors & Fragrances house!

Your Focus
As Senior Analyst Asia you will provide Finance business support to the Regional / Group Operations Director with respect to COGS cost savings Capex and inventory control.
You will collaborate with a network of colleagues in other regions to ensure best practices and standardized approaches are followed across the globe.

What You Will Contribute
  • Manufacturing Expenses analysis understanding key drivers risks and opportunities.
  • Financial Planning particularly manufacturing cost projections for input to the full-year forecasts and five-year strategic refresh. May need to represent the impact of multiple projects.
  • Comprehensive support to cost savings initiatives including compiling Business Cases where necessary.
  • Support the Operations team in applying for Capex funds for significant Regional initiatives. To ensure robust justifications and Economic Profit analysis.
  • Inventory control especially identification and reduction of potential write-off risks.
  • Material cost analysis including costing variance analysis impact of volume / mix and etc.


Job Requirements

What you will need to be successful

Essential Skills
  • A Bachelor’s degree in Finance Economics Engineering Science or any other relevant discipline.
  • A highly numerate individual able to present information in an accurate and succinct way.
  • Knowledge of profit/loss statement preparation balance sheet relationships and annual budget process
  • SAP / ERP systems Finance and Accounting system knowledge
  • Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Suite especially Excel.
  • Ability to work in a matrix structure with different business leaders and cross functional teams
  • Fluency in English; additional languages fluency is an advantage.
  • Willing to travel whenever necessary


Essential Experience
  • 5-7 years engagement experience in financial analysis financial control manufacturing operations or related fields.
  • Experience in working across functional areas to accomplish objectives.
  • Working knowledge of financial elements that support key supply chain concepts such as manufacturing expense analysis capital expenditures inventory management and financial / operational metrics.

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst - Cash Management (Payments / SWIFT)
Job Description:
Role: Senior Business Analyst - Cash Management (Payments / SWIFT)
Location: Singapore

Key Responsibilities

As a Business Analyst you would be responsible for
  • Working on client’s business operations and IT initiatives

Skills
  • Proficient in requirements management requirements gathering techniques interviews workshops document analysis surveys business process mapping/ modeling use cases user stories scenarios gap analysis business entity models data analysis mock-ups workflow analysis functionality drilldown non-functional requirements (NFR) analysis and solution definition

Job Title: Account Executive| Enterprise Corporate Sales| Thailand - BASED IN THAILAND
Job Description:
To get the best candidate experience please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Sales

Job Details

Position: Account Executive Enterprise Corporate Sales Thailand

The Enterprise Corporate Sales (ECS) Account Executive is responsible for managing a large volume of smaller size opportunities within Enterprise clients. Partnering with our most seasoned sales executives this role will suit those who are looking to take their enterprise sales skills to the next level. With a sales model that fosters collaboration and supports your success this is a great opportunity to forge a successful sales career.

With a business culture that has the customer's interests at the core of everything we do we'll set you up for success by providing a comprehensive induction and on boarding to the business including a five day bootcamp in San Francisco. On top of your own business development we provide a range of support functions to help create and drive opportunities from internal sales support to highly skilled pre- sales so it is not just you against the world.

Responsibilities
  • To exceed monthly / quarterly sales targets by selling Salesforce solutions into ECS accounts within an assigned within a sub set of major account /customer or vertical market.
  • You will manage the entire sales process to ensure delivery against key performance metrics with a strong emphasis on new business sales while expanding existing accounts.
  • Accurate monthly forecasting and revenue delivery.
  • Territory/Vertical identification and research to formalize a go-to-market strategy and create qualified target accounts.
  • Pipeline development through a combination of cold-calling email campaigns and market sector knowledge/intelligence.
  • Create and maintain a sales pipeline to ensure over-achievement within the designated market sector(s).
  • Engage with prospect organizations to position Salesforce solutions through strategic value based selling business case definition ROI analysis references and analyst data.
  • Manage the end-to-end sales process through engagement of appropriate resources such as Sales Engineers Professional Services Executives Partners etc.
  • Generate short term results whilst maintaining a long term perspective to maximize overall revenue generation.
  • Daily update of the Salesforce system with accurate customer and pipeline data.

Required Skills
  • Must speak highly fluent Thai fluent English is also required.
  • Full accountability to deliver monthly forecasted/committed deals.
  • Strong sense of urgency and always be ready to close deals.
  • Strong drive with growth mindset to drive results and take on big challenges.
  • Experienced and matured enterprise business sales personnel with proven track record of growing net new business and consistent delivery against sales targets.
  • Extensive and relevant experience of selling enterprise software solutions gained within a major software vendor.
  • Extensive experience selling to customers in Singapore.
  • Compelling communication skill to articulate Salesforce Capabilities Business Model and Advantages to C-Level and senior business decision makers.
  • Credibility at all levels including CxO.
  • CRM application sales or vertical Industry sector experience would be viewed favorably.
  • Strong tenure with previous employers.
  • Degree required

Overall Job Objectives

Primarily responsible in the planning implementation and management of various Digital and Platform Services. The Manager / Senior Manager shall work with multiple stakeholders to ensure successful delivery and operationality of the various digital and platform services projects.

Core Responsibilities
  • Works with various stakeholders from different key levels to provide strategic IT direction for the company
  • Oversee the planning designing budgeting procurement and implementing of various IT projects to meet company IT strategy plan
  • Supervise a lean internal IT team and provide oversight over external IT vendors
  • Work with various stakeholders to identify digital technology and platform services strategies that will support the different functional areas within STPI
  • Support the various department in scanning the market for innovative IT solutions and identify relevant solutions that will be able to support business objectives
  • Identify business requirements lead the project planning develop business case manage project delivery conduct user acceptance testing and monitor post implementation benefits in close consultation with various stakeholder
  • Create and maintain process technical project or other related documentations as may be required to support development project management and training
  • Manage day-to-day operational support and the related vendors for the digital and platform services
  • Engage potential solution vendors to test products develop tender specifications obtain budgetary estimates and to manage the process in the selection of competitive solutions
  • Conduct in-house briefing and training as required
  • Ensure IT Vendors’ (Infrastructure and Digital) contractual obligations performance & quality of deliverables and services.
  • Plan and execute disaster recovery plan (DRP) and ensure all risk indicators are monitored
  • Develop maintain and publish IT infrastructure operational policies standards and guidelines. Oversee the approval and awareness of these policies.


Job Specifications
  • Degree in Information Technology Computer Science Computer Engineering or equivalent
  • Minimum of 5-7 years of relevant working experience in business analyst or IT/digital project management
  • Experience in IT infrastructure projects will be an advantage
  • Strong people skills to work with multiple stakeholders to ensure smooth project delivery
  • Sound understanding and hands on experience in all phases of the project lifecycle
  • Effective written verbal communication and presentation skills
  • PMP/CITPM/ITIL or relevant technical skills/certification or relevant working experience in digital implementation will be an advantage

Based on our continued success and growth we are looking for a Senior Manager of Sales Operations to act as a critical business partner to the Security Business Unit APJ Sales organization driving revenue growth increase sales productivity and accelerating sales cycles.

Why VMware Carbon Black?

At VMware Carbon Black you will have the chance to make an impact in the ever-evolving cybersecurity space. Our advanced technology tackles even the toughest challenges and stays ahead of the latest threats.

If you want to join an agile company that’s building bleeding edge technology in the cloud VMware Carbon Black is the place for you. Driven by passionate people who are dedicated to making the world safer it’s no wonder we’ve been named a “Top Place to Work” by the Boston Globe for four consecutive years. Join us!

Why You Matter

Reporting to Director SBU Sales Operations this role will be the critical Sales Operations business partner for the SBU APJ Sales team executing strategies to accelerate revenue growth leading best practice sales execution initiatives and managing efficient operations to improve sales productivity and accelerate sales cycles.

What You’ll Do
  • Sales Strategy & Planning – leading Sales strategy and planning partnering with Sales Marketing and Operations leadership to develop and implement a Sales growth plan with optimal coverage quota and incentive mechanisms.
  • Business partner – act as a Sales business partner leveraging data and leading strategic and operational initiatives to accelerate revenue/bookings increasing Sales productivity and shorten the lead-to-close cycle. Represent the APJ Sales teams in critical programs to ensure that materials collateral methods tools processes reporting are all suitable for a rapid and effective best practice sales execution model
  • Manage the Sales operating rhythm – in partnership with Sales leadership establish orchestrate and manage the Sales management operating rhythm to drive consistent best in class planning inspection and execution against pipeline leads forecast opportunities and accounts.
  • Sales Performance – review sales performance on a weekly monthly and quarterly basis to support sales management. take appropriate action and provide input to sales enablement and management programs to improve sales performance.

What You’ll Bring
  • 5+ years Sales Operations leadership and experience in fast paced software / SaaS environments
  • Demonstrated success being a Sales Operations business partner to a sales team of 30+ sellers
  • Expert in forecasting sales methodologies SFDC and sales execution disciplines to drive efficient execution at scale
  • Excellent team and interpersonal collaboration and operational leadership skills
  • A Bachelor’s degree in Business or Technology related area is required
  • A change leader and ambassador for sales to drive revenue growth increase productively and accelerate sales cycles with a partnering solution orientated ‘easy to do business with’ approach

Job Description & Summary

At PwC South East Asia Consulting we help businesses to work smarter and grow faster. We partner with our clients to build effective organisations innovate and grow reduce costs manage risk and regulation and leverage talent. Our aim is to support businesses in designing managing and executing lasting beneficial change.
PwC’s South East Asia Consulting practice provides a comprehensive range of professional services and experience to deliver large scale cross territory transformation projects wherever our clients need us to be – from strategy through to execution.

About The Team

Strategy& is a global team of practical strategists committed to helping seize essential advantage. We do that by working alongside our clients to solve their toughest problems and help realise their greatest potential. We bring 100 years of strategy consulting experience and the unrivalled industry and functional capabilities of the PwC network to the task. We are a member of the PwC network of firms in 157 countries with more than 184000 people.

As an organisation with an increasingly agile workforce we are open to a variety of flexible working styles. These are unique opportunities offering a fun flexible and supportive work environment and the chance to build a successful career. The significant breadth of our client base ensures that challenging interesting and varied work with the globe’s best clients is always available.

At Strategy& we recruit the best and the brightest. We believe that the best most effective teams reflect diverse backgrounds ideas and perspectives. We aim to surround you with people who will inspire you and challenge you intellectually.

In return we offer you a clearly structured career path with the opportunity for rapid career progression. We consider training and career development to be core along with our on-the-job apprenticeship model the basis for successful strategy consulting. Your professional development will continue throughout your career. We’ll help you learn on-the-job and cultivate your personal strengths alongside our people programs all supported by our culture of real-time feedback.

About The Role

Managers in Strategy& are typically high achievers with an Undergraduate or a Master’s degree and an exceptional academic record. MBA from a top university is an added advantage. They come from a variety of degree disciplines. They will have demonstrated international experience participation in extracurricular activities and demonstrate the energy commitment and drive necessary to succeed at Strategy&.

Managers are expected to manage a team of consultants and work across a variety of industries. They lead teams on client assignments from identifying creative but pragmatic options against potential market scenarios developing conclusions making strategic recommendations and then developing plans to operationalize the agreed upon strategy. They are capable of conceptualizing and developing client-ready deliverable materials independently with clear logic from multiple perspective angles (i.e. client internal team etc). Managers will be required to develop and share their point of views on strategic business issues trends and anticipate the impact on clients’ needs. They are also able to integrate frameworks and models into analytical approach based on hypothesis-driven approach (HDA).

They are also able to lead teams on the analyses and evaluation of business cases market analyst reports annual reports and/or strategy documents. They are also expected to coach the team on data analytics including but not limited to identification of valid data points triangulation from multiple data sources and calculation of various business scenarios.

On any given project Managers may be asked to identify key insights from analyses interviews discussion and other sources and to build a business case to evaluate an opportunity construct a presentation to demonstrate solutions to client executives.

You Will Work Across a Variety Of Industries Including
  • Consumer & Retail
  • Communications Media & Technology
  • Energy Chemicals & Utilities
  • Industrial Products
  • Financial Services
  • Health

About You

A blend of talents and skills is required of successful Senior Manager candidates including:
  • An Undergraduate or a Master’s degree from a top-tier university
  • Minimum 6 years of pure Strategy consulting experience or mix of consulting and industry experience
  • Excellent academic achievement and demonstrated leadership skills
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills (which includes both quantitative and qualitative orientation)
  • Passion for and experience in business development through thought leadership and relationship development
  • Strong track record of apprenticeship and development of junior staff
  • Able to motivate and assist team members to understand and visualize project objectives
  • Strong core consulting skills and deep understanding of Strategy& consulting toolkit including: leading unstructured problem solving driving thought leadership leading and managing strategy projects
  • Outstanding oral and written communication skills
  • Strong client and team orientation
  • Ambition to build client capabilities that deliver lasting impact
  • Strong personal presence combined with compelling and professional presentation and communication skills

Job Title: Business System Analyst (.Net/ Perm| contract available)
Job Description:
NCS is a leading information and communications technology (ICT) and communications engineering services provider across the Asia-Pacific region. We are headquartered in Singapore and a wholly owned subsidiary of the Singtel Group. We have in-depth domain knowledge and unique capabilities that create business value for customers. We offer a broad range of services including consulting systems development and integration business process outsourcing infrastructure management and solutions and technology solutions.


Overview

The Business System Analyst will be involved in the software development maintenance and life cycle including application development implementation maintenance and post-implementation review.

 

Key Roles & Responsibilities

  • Gather analyse and formalise user’s business requirements and processes evaluate on feasibility of implementation and manage scope of project.
  • Prepare project documentation such as Requirement Specifications/Use Case Specifications etc Adhere to project scope update requirement traceability matrix inform and record out-of-scope issues.
  • Develop technical design specification and translate technical design into process/program specification. Involve in the design review session.
  • Make changes to configurable items which include hardware software documentation etc.
  • Participate in Coding and Code Review.
  • Assist in the integration testing system testing User Acceptance Test & implementation activities.
  • Prepare user manual and operations manual and plan & facilitate training of users and operators.
  • Provide post implementation support (including production support and service requests.
  • Escalate and discuss critical issues such as scope creep with the relevant managers.
  • Conduct requirement gathering sessions. Conduct gap analysis of current business process to identify improvement opportunities.


The Ideal Candidate Should Have/ Be

  • Minimum 4 years of relevant working experience in .Net
  • IT experience and technically competent in one or more of the following languages tools and technologies:

.Net Core MVC.Net AngularC#.Net ASP.Net

  • Strong Analytical skills and well verse with problem resolution methodologies
  • Strong customer-service orientation.
  • Possess can-do attitude initiative creativity and able to work under stringent time

• At least 4 years of work experience in C# & web development using .NET MVC and Entity Framework.
  • Experienced in JavaScript JQuery Angular JS or any client-side scripting languages.
  • Proficiency in SQL including T-SQL Stored Procedures SSIS & SSRS (preferably MS SQL).
  • Experienced with Web API (SOAP REST) frameworks and development.
  • Experienced with .Net framework 3.5 or 4.0 AJAX XML Web Services WCF or WWF IIS.
  • Experienced in Responsive Framework like Bootstrap

Job Description
  • 5+ SAP experience (SAP QM SAP PM SAP MII etc)
  • Experience in iterative methodology like scrum Kanban design sprint lean start-up
  • Agile certification and SAP QM & PM Module certification


Skills Required
  • Comfortable with UX Design principles
  • Facilitation change management Skills
  • Knowledgeable about: Interface technologies - web method web service etc
  • Conception Skills (prototyping wireframing data/information modelling…)
  • UX & Analysis Skills (Interview shadowing Personas)


Responsibilities
  • Understands users and formalize their needs with a user centric approach and method
  • Designs sustainable solutions from concept to launch in line with Architecture principles
  • Maintains the different product knowledge through relevant documentation Product design and project execution
  • Conducts necessary analyses with Key Users that lead to the delivery of the high-level functional needs. Formalizes process design with the Business. Conducts necessary Design Thinking workshops.
  • Provides detailed specifications.
  • Collaborates with the UI designer/ or developer / or technical expert to design the mock-up of the product or prototype. Organizes validation loops with the Business and refines specifications based on feedbacks.
  • Drives necessary alignments with developers in the building of the solution
  • Contributes to the quality of delivered solution through test design and execution playing the role of QC analyst when necessary (including regression tests)
  • Raises defects and ensures resolution
  • Facilitates user adoption through organizational procedures and user guide.
  • Organizes prepares runs/supports UAT user training roll-out and handover to Application Support Analyses and reports risk in product development and project delivery

Being part of delaware means getting to work with an SAP Gold Partner and Pinnacle Award winner with the cutting edge of technology. We have a dynamic horizontal company culture and pride ourselves on taking care of our employees. We focus on end-to-end projects that challenge us and further develop our skills in the same way that we challenge our customers to step up to the next level helping them become even better in areas where they already excel. With us you’re certain to be involved in a wide range of innovative SAP projects.

What will you be doing as a SAP Consultant (Finance)?

You play a crucial client-facing consulting role that requires fair functional knowledge of the business processes. You interact with clients to understand their requirements and help define solutions to address the client’s needs. You help in customizing the systems with proper testing and attention to quality.

Do you have what it takes to become a SAP Consultant (Finance)?

  • You come with at least 4-5 years of relevant SAP consulting experience in FICO.
  • You have been part of at least one full implementation lifecycle or have supported such in production.
  • You have business analyst (requirement analysis and gathering) exposure in your past.
  • As an experienced consultant you also assumed the responsibility to mentor and coach less-experienced colleagues. Knowledge-sharing is a key success factor and you are happy to share your expertise with your more junior colleagues.
  • You have a reasonable grasp on the technical aspects and have experience working together in teams with differing roles.
  • You recognize yourself in Our Values: respect care commitment team spirit and entrepreneurship.


At delaware we...

  • Are a dynamic stimulating team of highly-motivated professionals with attention for personal development in your expertise.
  • Offer a continuous process for learning development and growth.
  • Are involved in unique projects in Singapore (and the region) for prominent customers.
  • Offer a challenging and dynamic job in a successful organization.
  • Know there’s more to life than work. We organize team events impromptu drinks or the occasional sports day: Nothing better for team spirit than getting sweaty together right?
  • Are a flat organization with short lines of communication;
  • Offer a competitive benefits package that grows with you!

Country: Central Singapore Community Development Council| Singapore
Job Description:
This role reports to the Chief Digital and Technology Office (C DTO). The DTO is tasked with digital transformation of the business data management analytics and running day to day IT operations. The Principal Enterprise Architect will work closely with the line of business users key management stakeholders platforms teams systems integrators and product principals.


  • Design the future enterprise architecture of SingEx which will consist of customer facing engagement platforms enterprise systems (tech stack) and data repositories. The Principal Enterprise Architect is the “future maker” enabling innovation researching new tech trends (esp. in AI/ML data analytics and cloud based services as they relate to the events/MICE industry) and evaluate new products/services to determine fit for SingEx’s tech stack.
  • Own SingEx’s tech stack and govern the deployment of new systems and infrastructure with a key focus on scalability integration security and data governance.
  • The Principal Enterprise Architect will be act as the executive advisor for ongoing and future software infrastructure and data projects.
  • Review ongoing platform development and prototyping efforts and provide guidance and input to platform architecting.
  • Review and guide all ongoing technology projects which includes evaluation appointment and management of systems integrators and product principals
  • Build an enterprise architecture competency with a focus on addressing customer needs.
  • Work closely with the Principal Data Architect and data teams to ensure privacy by design.
  • Work closely with the Cybersecurity team to ensure security is built into the design of new platforms


Job Requirements:

  • A bachelor’s degree or equivalent
  • At least 10+ years’ experience in enterprise architecting solution design and/or technology advisory/consulting
  • Hands on knowledge with SaaS platforms/services is strongly desired
  • Hands on experience with API based integration tools/services is strongly desired
  • Ability to manage senior stakeholders and drive enterprise tech programs
  • Ability to work with and lead business technical and analyst teams
  • Knowledge of events industry will be preferred
  • Familiarity with agile environments will be an advantage
  • Certifications and/or working knowledge of Enterprise Architecture Frameworks like TOGAF will be an advantage

Join a team that is changing millions of lives.

Transforming smiles changing lives

 

At Align Technology we believe a great smile can transform a person’s life so we create technology that gives people the confidence to take on whatever’s next. We revolutionized the orthodontic industry with the introduction of the Invisalign system and we have never lost sight of that spirit of innovation. Our diverse and collaborative teams are constantly pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.

 

Ready to join us? 

About This Opportunity

The Business Optimization Director (BOD) is responsible for driving incremental sales market share and customer loyalty through a consultative sales and support approach within Practices. The BOD will be managing and providing clear direction to BOM (Business Optimization Managers) and responsible for analyzing the Orthodontic side of the business and finding opportunities for improvement to the overall business. The BOD will work cross-functionally to create strategic initiatives within a practice to help the business grow and scale amid changing market dynamics with BOM.
  • The BOM will work with their respective Sales Team to implement Invisalign in targeted accounts and position Align as a complete innovative solution for their Orthodontic and Digital Impression needs. The BOM will also own the strategic partnership and the development of strategic initiatives.
  • The BOMs areas of focus in an Orthodontic practice will include; maximizing top line revenue growth optimizing resources and efficiency development of systems and processes increasing profitability and further developing office culture to drive practice growth. Qualified candidates will need to show a successful track record of consulting with businesses working cross-functionally and effectively leading and training people. The BOM will need to have the ability and willingness to travel including overnight 50-60% of the time.

In this role you will…
  • Business Optimization - With the support of a data analyst perform and deliver deep analyses of practices and customer behaviors to identify opportunities for improvement growth and scale. BOM will be responsible for leading the change management in the practice. Areas of analysis include but are not limited to; cash flow KPIs profitability operational efficiency and customer experience and marketing and referral programs. These assessments and associated recommendations address all aspects of the Orthodontic organization including culture people process technology and performance metrics. Willingness to challenge SOPs and current business model will be critical to success.
  • Manages Implementation Team- Manages direct reports by helping them understand the developed strategy in order to execute and implement newly designed processes.
  • Builds High-Level Strategic Customer Relationships - Excels at building customer loyalty and multiple relationships within the highest levels of key functional areas in customer organizations; identifies strategic business opportunities within Practices; establishes effective relationships with key customer representatives and employees externally and internally; puts a high priority on both customer and Company interests when making decisions; leads by example and responds quickly and competently to customer issues; continually searches for ways to improve competitive advantage.
  • Demonstrates Leadership/Collaborates With Others - Works closely with Business Development Managers/Specialists as well as the sales and marketing team to develop business agreement proposals implement those agreements and develop timely responses to all opportunities
  • Ability to build and nurture business relationships with internal and external customers at executive levels by consultative methods
  • Demonstrate deep technical capabilities and professional knowledge. Demonstrate ability to quickly assimilate to new knowledge.
  • Effectively lead and motivate teams with diverse skills and backgrounds. Provide constructive on-the-job feedback/coaching to team members
  • Strong strategic planning and project management skills at the regional and national level
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to listen articulate and advocate
  • Strong business acumen and analytical skills
  • Remain current on new industry trends technologies competitors and place in the market
  • Pro-active; high-performance and results orientation
  • Ability to attend national tradeshows sales meetings and conferences as needed
  • Occasional weekend travel and meetings
  • Ability to consistently work manage and function with integrity
  • Comply with all safety policies practices and procedures. Report all unsafe activities to supervisor and/or Human Resources.
  • Provide support to audit processes and quality management system as required
  • Participate in proactive team efforts to achieve departmental and company goals.

In this role you’ll need …

To perform this job successfully an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  • Travel 50-60% occasional weekends
  • Exceptional organizational prioritization and project management skills
  • Self-motivated; dedicated
  • Ability to handle numerous projects and partners simultaneously
  • Able to work independently and make accurate educated decisions
  • Proactive problem solving skills with strong attention to detail
  • Excellent written and communication skills

EDUCATION And/or EXPERIENCE
  • Bachelor's degree and approximately 10-12 years of related work experience; or a master's degree and approximately 8-10 years of related work experience - degree in business administration or business-related field; MBA a plus
  • 5+ years Consulting experience required
  • LEAN or Six Sigma certified a plus
  • People Management Skills
  • Strong skills in developing a business case and knowledge of the financial impact of the proposed initiatives on the client's Profit and Loss statement
  • Strong facilitation skills and change management experience
  • Ability to articulate trends client challenges leading solutions and best practices
  • Ability to effectively communicate and present to senior level client executives (E - and C-Level)
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Word Excel PowerPoint Outlook and Salesforce.com

Sound like a good fit?   

 

Great! Click the "Apply" link to let us know you are interested. Not the right fit? Don’t worry Align is quickly growing so we are creating more opportunities to expand our Align family. Please consider joining our Talent Network to receive notifications about future jobs or sharing this opportunity with others in your network.    

 

About Align  

  

Align Technology is a publicly traded medical device company that is transforming smiles and changing lives. Our global team of talented employees develop innovative technology tools and treatment options to help dental professionals worldwide achieve the clinical results they expect. Our digital ecosystem combines the power of technology to create beautiful smiles through the integration of AI and machine learning digital imaging and visualization biomechanics and material science to develop the Invisalign system the most advanced clear aligner system in the world; iTero Intraoral Scanners and OrthoCAD digital services. Did you know? Align is the world’s largest manufacturer of custom 3D-printed materials.   

  

By joining Align you will be part of a global fast-growing company in one of the most dynamic industries. Great people innovative technologies and meaningful work - these are just some of the things employees say make Align Technology a great place to work.   

  

We respect your privacy. Please review our Applicant Privacy Policies for additional information.  

 

Global Diversity Statement

At Align we believe in the power of a smile and we know that every smile is as unique as our employees. As we grow we will continue building a workforce of diverse cultural backgrounds and life experiences and fostering a culture of open-mindedness and compassion for all our employees. We live our company values by promoting healthy people and healthy communities. All with the intent of changing millions of lives one unique smile at a time.
