Opportunity Awaits at Altus Group!

The Opportunity

Altus Group has an immediate opening for a Real Estate Valuation Analyst role within our Advisory business unit in Singapore. The successful candidate will support a team of 3 based in Singapore. The primary role of the Valuation Analyst will be to provide support to the valuation (appraisal) review process of commercial real estate portfolios located across Asia Pacific. Each quarter the Analyst will assist in the valuation review process and update of ARGUS and/or MS-Excel models for all property types as well as assist in the preparation of client deliverables.

Key Responsibilities

Assisting in the valuation (appraisal) management process for Global and Regional Real Estate funds.

Conducting reviews of external third party commercial real estate valuations across APAC.

Analysing and reviewing ARGUS and MS-Excel based valuations models for accuracy and reasonableness.

Tracking and understanding changes between valuations from quarter to quarter.

Company Overview

KLA is a global leader in diversified electronics for the semiconductor manufacturing ecosystem. Virtually every electronic device in the world is produced using our technologies. No laptop smartphone wearable device voice-controlled gadget flexible screen VR device or smart car would have made it into your hands without us. KLA invents systems and solutions for the manufacturing of wafers and reticles integrated circuits packaging printed circuit boards and flat panel displays. The innovative ideas and devices that are advancing humanity all begin with inspiration research and development. KLA focuses more than average on innovation and in 2019 we invested 15% of sales back into R&D. Our expert teams of physicists engineers data scientists and problem-solvers work together with the world’s leading technology providers to accelerate the delivery of tomorrow’s electronic devices. Life here is exciting and our teams thrive on tackling really hard problems. There is never a dull moment with us.

Group/Division

KLA has manufacturing sites across the globe including Belgium China Germany Israel Singapore and Milpitas (CA). The Global Operations (GOPS) team comprised of Manufacturing Supply Chain Management Manufacturing Engineering Installation and Quality is responsible for manufacturing our leading-edge technology. We partner with our world-wide supply base and our design engineering teams to bring new products to market. The GOPS team is continuously working to build our products Better Faster Cheaper.Responsibilities
  • Purchase direct materials components and equipment as driven by MRP system or Re-order Point system
  • Review and analyze planning report to ensure timely materials availability for production
  • Drive Gross Margin Improvements through negotiations or localization with supplier on pricing rework cost and minimizing expediting cost and purchase price variance
  • Responsible for materials lead time reduction by getting suppliers to improve cycle time negotiating on hedges and VMI program.
  • Ensure timely PO execution and address supplier’s quality capacity materials issues that may affect supply
  • Communicate with suppliers for early or delayed deliveries as required drive suppliers to meet on time delivery
  • Active participation on business review with suppliers and provide constructive feedback to help suppliers to improve their scores
  • Ensure accuracy and timeliness of claims from suppliers on ECO and EOM projects.
  • Timely review and execute on ECN and ECO changes so that production is not affected.
  • Develop actions to minimize excess inventory. Work with Inventory Analyst by providing recommendation during quarterly E&ND review. Follow through the action proposed.
  • Drive to improve inventory turns by having quick execution on MRB and quick returns on RTV.

The Business analyst will work in the Compliance domain for a leading bank:

  • Compliance financial security (sanctions embargo)

Key Responsibilities :

  • Requirements definition – gather analyse and validate business functional and non-functional requirements with the objective to meet business goals regulatory demand and operational risks faced by the Bank

  • Solution implementation – configure the systems (including scripting) to realize the solution or work with external provider to deliver the solution
  • Functional testing – prepare the test plan test cases and test data/files then execute the testing review the test results raise defects and report test progress.

  • Able to develop modify and run existing shell/batch scripts of list loading batch screening jobs and configurations in Unix AIX and Windows environment.

  • Able to use standard IT tools for project management reporting and change control processes

  • Occasionally support production deployment and system maintenance in evening or week-end



Ideal candidate profile

  • Experienced in IT project and change methodology. Hands-on end-user management experience including operational procedures documentation user training and change management.
  • Able to work in high pressure and face-paced environment. Independent self-organized systematic in delivery and a team player with professional work ethics

Job Title: First Vice President| Functional Business Analyst - Digital| Group Technology and Operations
Job Description:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific Europe and North America. In Asia we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China Indonesia Malaysia and Thailand as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time we have been guided by our values — Honorable Enterprising United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right build for the future work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work consistently be it towards the company our colleagues or our customers.

About The Department

The Retail function provides Personal and Business Banking customers with financial solutions tailored to their needs. We help them manage their money wisely and meet their financial goals through an extensive range of products and services. These include deposit insurance secured and unsecured loans investment and wealth advisory services.

Personal Financial Services

We design and provide products and services that empower our customers to enjoy greater banking convenience while they extract more value from their money. In particular we are focused on promoting and developing healthy saving and investment practices across generations.

Job Responsibilities
  • Requirements Analysis & Elicitation
  • Collaborate with BU Specialists to elicit and review business requirements
  • Analyse and document the "to be" business and operations processes based on the agreed requirements and / or function points perform impact assessment
  • Responsible to analyse and define detailed functional and non-functional requirements based on business requirements
  • Monitor and manage risks /issues related to requirements and scope creep
  • Write business functional release notes and contribute to deployment plan
  • Team Collaboration
  • Transition functional and non-functional requirements to System Analysts and ensure a clear and complete understanding of the requirements
  • Work with Test Manager to translate business requirements into test scenarios
  • Facilitate / provide "Train the Trainer" on application enhancements
  • Maintain up to date knowledge base related to application features and processes (subject matter expertise)
  • Testing & Scope Management
  • Clarify test findings escalated by Test Manager and classify the findings accordingly (either as a defect or change request)
  • Perform impact assessment and estimation for Project Change Request
Technical Skills & Experience

Job Requirements
  • Strong business domain knowledge in banking
  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering/ business/ finance or equivalent
  • Strong quantitative analytical problem solving and process design skills that can translate analysis into solutions that meet business objectives
  • Understanding of technology and operational processes across functions / departments in the bank/market.
  • Resourceful team player
  • Familiar with change management processes and project management fundamentals
  • Strategic forward thinking approach to challenges with outstanding communications influencing negotiating and persuasion skills
  • Passionate diligent and resilient individual with ability to thrive in ambiguity
  • Experience in scoping and evaluation – Defining overall considerations including scalability maintainability cost operations and technology principal risk to provide a recommendation
  • Minimum 12 years of relevant banking and/or consulting experience
Be a part of UOB Family

UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age race gender color religion sexual orientation physical or mental disability or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process please inform us when you submit your online application.

Company Name: Trapeze Group Asia Pacific| Middle East & Africa
Job Description:
We are Trapeze a leader in transportation software and we are seeking a Project Manager to work under our ASEAN VBU. You will manage the implementation and support services across our portfolio including but not limited to ITS CMMS Workforce Management Scheduling solutions for clients in South East Asia and will be mainly responsible for planning overseeing and leading projects and maintenance services from ideation through to successful completion. This cross functional role involves interaction with a range of internal and external stakeholders often managing several moving project parts simultaneously.

 

Your Key Role Responsibilities:


  • Develop and execute the project management through the solution and service delivery lifecycle.
  • Co-ordinate new projects and client upgrades including developing project plans; managing resources time costs etc and Gantt charts through monitoring updating and reporting on progress internally and to clients.
  • Monitor the status of project and provide written status reports.
  • Manage proactively risks and issues as the occur
  • Monitor the project performance to ensure revenue targets are achieved whilst identifying and promoting new opportunities.
  • Manage the P&L of the project.
  • Report and document data to communicate project information to key stakeholders.
  • Manage the ongoing relationships with clients ensuring that client’s expectations are met and exceeded.
  • Ensure contractual requirements with respect to project management and project delivery are adhered to.
  • Review the project scope optimizing and improving processes where possible.
  • Undertake effective pre-sales/tender preparation plans that aid in winning new business.


You our ideal candidate will possess the following:


  • Minimum of five (5) years’ experience in a project management business analyst role or similar leading a team or project team.
  • Demonstrable knowledge of contemporary project management methodologies such as Prince2 PMBOK.
  • Demonstrated experience with successful client engagement at a project level.
  • Experience with the Software Development life cycle as it relates to implementing products.
  • Excellent client-facing and internal communication skills.
  • Proven track record within the Transport Industry is desirable.


Our Company:


We are here for the journey


At Trapeze we strive to enhance lives by building technology for a better tomorrow and providing unique solutions for life. We work with public and private transit agencies and their communities to develop and deliver smarter more effective transit solutions through addressing everyday pain points saving money and improving customer experiences through the use of proven technologies. For more than 25 years we have been "Here for the Journey" evolving with our customers around the world to helping them move people from point A to Z and everywhere in between. You too can be a part of these efficiencies that enhance community outcomes.


As the Asia Pacific Africa and Middle East branch of Trapeze Group we have a wealth of knowledge experience and resources to draw upon both locally and from our colleagues in North America Europe and the United Kingdom. Trapeze is part of the Volaris Group (www.volarisgroup.com) of companies who acquire strengthen and grow vertical market software companies enabling them to be clear leaders within their focused industry. The Volaris Group is a subsidiary of Constellation Software Inc. (www.csisoftware.com) listed on the TSX (“CSU”). Constellation Software Group services over 125000 customers in more than 100 countries across the globe from offices on every continent. 


While our experience is broad and international we are local in our approach. We have been in the transport industry for more than 30 years and have a long history of collaborating with our customers to adapt to changing needs and new demands.


*Join the Journey*

Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014 we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company partnering with over 35000 merchants and delivering more than 1000 parcels every minute across six countries.

At our core we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation dynamic routing end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.

Ninja Direct leverages Ninja Van’s pan-regional logistics network to provide small and medium businesses with comprehensive upstream services with the goal of supporting their business. The business unit has seen triple-digit growth over the past year and we are looking to expand our team to lead our business growth across the region.

As a Commercial Strategy Analyst you will drive Ninja Direct’s commercial performance by making proactive recommendations and deriving actionable insights through the analysis of complex data sets. You will also be responsible for empowering our commercial teams through dashboards and customized reports. Over time you will be given direct ownership over various commercial initiatives and work directly with senior leadership in the development and execution of the business’ commercial strategy. This is an exciting opportunity for an entrepreneurial and driven individual to be part of the growth of a fast-growing new business unit within Ninja Van.

Responsibilities
    • Play an active role in the development and implementation of key strategic initiatives to improve commercial performance.
    • Analyze data formulate and test hypotheses to derive actionable insights address key business questions drive customer profiling and enable effective decision making.
    • Build dashboards and customized reports to track key metrics and empower business teams.

Requirements
    • 1 to 3 years of experience a strategy commercial business development consulting or similar role in high-growth environment P&L ownership experience a plus
    • Advanced Excel and Powerpoint skills comfortable analyzing and drawing insights from large data sets.
    • Experience in SQL would be a plus
    • Experience with Salesforce or other CRM software would be a plus
    • Proven track record of using data commercial or otherwise to draw actionable insights and improve business performance.
    • Proven track record of success in high-pressure environments comfortable dealing with ambiguity and change
    • Proven track record of driving complex projects and working with senior stakeholders across the business.
    • Exposure to working across geographies teams and individuals of different cultures particularly across Southeast Asia

Currently with over 17000 employees* and a presence in 13 markets BNP Paribas provides corporates institutional and private investors with product and service solutions tailored to their specific needs. It offers a wide range of financial services covering corporate & institutional banking wealth management asset management insurance as well as retail banking and consumer financing through strategic partnerships.

Worldwide BNP Paribas has a presence in 73 markets with more than 196000 employees. It has key positions in its three main activities: Domestic Markets and International Financial Services (whose retail-banking networks and financial services are covered by Retail Banking & Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking which serves two client franchises: corporate clients and institutional investors. Asia Pacific is a key strategic region for BNP Paribas and it continues to develop its franchise in the region.

BNP Paribas offers you an exciting career in an international business environment that is fast-paced diverse and focuses on creating high-value relationships with our clients. We offer competitive salary and benefits as well as a working environment where you’re valued as part of the team.

  • excluding partnerships

Job Title: SAP Business Applications Analyst (7 months contract)
Job Description:
Location: Singapore Singapore

In fast changing markets customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace transportation defence security and space our architects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible.

Thales in Singapore has been present since 1973 providing state-of-the-art solutions for customers in the aerospace defence security and transportation markets. Today Thales in Singapore employs over 600 people and is home to all regional avionics services a ground transportation integration centre and regional innovation hub.

Responsibilities
  • Effectively evaluate end user’s need and business processes. Translate communicate and document the requirements
  • Perform cost-benefit and return on investment analyses for proposed systems to aid management in making implementation decisions
  • Ensure compatibility and interoperability of in-house computing systems
  • Coordinate and perform in-depth tests including end-user reviews for modified and new systems and other post-implementation support
  • Provide orientation and training to end users for all modified and new systems

Job Title: Capgemini Technology Consulting Graduate Program (2021 In-take)
Job Description:
About the Company

Capgemini is a global leader in consulting digital transformation technology and engineering services. The Group is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients’ opportunities in the evolving world of cloud digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year+ heritage and deep industry-specific expertise Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today it is a multicultural company of 270000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran the Group reported 2019 combined revenues of €17billion.


Capgemini Graduate Program (18 Months)

At Capgemini we are committed to building a pipeline of talent capable of achieving our vision and future success. An important part of this commitment is bringing bright and talented individuals who share our values and goals through our Graduate Program. Our 18-month Program will offer you a glimpse of various technologies from cloud analytics to a wide array of digital and enterprise application platforms. We will equip you with the necessary technical knowledge and skills to take on future responsibilities to exceed expectations in everything you do and grow into Capgemini’s next generation of leaders.

 

As a Graduate you will work as part of a project team on one of our business and technology enabled transformation programs across different industry sectors helping our clients address significant business problems. You could be in a wide range of roles over the 18 month program it could be business focused role such as a Business Analyst PMO Digital Process or Change Consultant or a more technical role as a Developer depending upon the business need and your background and interest. These could be spread across our business which include service offerings across areas such as Digital Customer Experience Customer Relationship Management Cloud & Analytics and People & Change and more.

 

You will collaborate with colleagues from all over the world and develop an understanding of the business issues and technologies applicable to each industry allowing you to deliver innovative solutions for each client. From day one you will take on real responsibilities and make significant contributions to Capgemini’s success.

 

At the end of the 18 month program you will be placed in a full time role in one of our technology areas.

 

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

 

We are looking for Graduates who are talented analytical innovative and out-of-the-box thinkers committed to self-development and willing to make the most of the available learning opportunities Capgemini has to offer. You need to be armed with unbridled passion drive and tenacity. To be successful you must be comfortable with a multi-cultural fast-paced and dynamic work environment and willing to step out of your comfort zone.

 

To qualify for the Graduate Program you must hold a university degree in any discipline with 0-2 years of work experience a valid authorization to live and work in the country of choice and a demonstrable understanding and passion for technology.

 

Application deadline:

The application for the 2021 Graduate Opportunities is now open until 30 November 2020. We are offering 2 intakes: Jan or July intake 2021 (dependent on countries)

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.


Application Steps:

1.      Complete Online Assessment

2.      Invitation to Virtual Assessment Day in End Nov/Dec

3.      Final HR Interviews

4.      Offers


Visit us at www.capgemini.com. People matter results count.

To learn more about us please visit https://www.capgemini.com/sg-en/capgemini-singapore-graduate-program/

This is a career defining role for the right person!

Job Title: AML and KYC Business Analyst for Client Risk Rating
Job Description:
Job Reference #
216411BR

City
Singapore Singapore

Job Type
Full Time

Your role
Do you have a proven anti-money laundering and know-your-client experience in a banking environment but you would still like to learn more? Are you a detail focused person who is inquisitive and enjoys analyzing data? Are you a specialist with the ability to communicate with diverse stakeholder groups and work with them to define their business requirements?

We are looking for a AML and KYC Business Analyst for Client Risk Rating to:

  • capture analyze and document business requirements
  • analyze and evaluate complex client and transactional data
  • work with the front office staff IT compliance subject matter experts model developers and other Business Analysts to ensure solutions are fit for purpose
  • interface with IT on the design and testing of solutions
  • coordinate with the front office on business integration aspects such as operating model development training & communication
  • support and follow-up investigation of questions issues and defects
  • keep program managers and stakeholders informed of progress
  • ensure compliance with policies standards and regulatory requirements

Business Analysts are the essential conduit between programs; the stakeholder community around the world of various levels of seniority; and subject matter experts from Financial Crime Prevention Regulatory and Governance and IT.

Your team
You’ll be working in the Financial Crime Prevention Change team within the wider Group Compliance and Regulatory Governance (GCRG) function. We are a global team that drives the change portfolio including e.g. Transaction Monitoring Initial and Ongoing Due Diligence Case Management and Name and Media Screening in addition to Client Risk Rating. We focus on protecting the capital and reputation of the bank by making sure we become a best-in-class Financial Crime Prevention function.

Your expertise

  • a degree in Finance Accounting Economics Science Technology Engineering Mathematics or Business Administration (or equivalent)
  • previous relevant experience as business analyst or in Change Management is required
  • a solid knowledge of client risk rating in the context of banking risk control AML and/or IT
  • an understanding of software development lifecycle with experience in working in an agile project and using collaboration tools such as JIRA PPM and Confluence
  • excellent written and verbal communication skills – ability to communicate complex issues succinctly and clearly
  • fluent in English
  • analytical and documentation skills with the ability to provide practical solutions
  • proficiency in MS Office
  • able to balance numerous tasks and competing priorities in a fast paced and demanding environment

About Us
Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world.

We are about 60000 employees in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?

Join us
We're a truly global collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting apply now.

Disclaimer / Policy Statements
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures perspectives skills and experiences within our workforce.

Hypebeast Ltd. started from a sneaker website founded by Kevin Ma in 2005 to a publicly listed media company in 2016. With a total reach of over 40.5M users across all platforms The media group boasts a global readership across Asia Pacific North America Europe and more with the flagship platform available in five languages. The group has expanded its publishing brands to a wider scope in recent years encompassing Hypebeast and its multiple content distribution platforms e-commerce store HBX and agency Hypemaker. 


Hypebeast Ltd. has been featured in Forbes’ “Asia’s 200 Best Under A Billion” in 2018 and Fast Company’s “Most Innovative Companies” in 2017.


This position sits within the Data Team. They will support with technological know-how and implementation – focusing on web and customer analytics.


Responsibilities:

  • Define analytical questions & approaches based on business requirements/direction.
  • Design implement and maintain data governance dictionaries and models.
  • Identify define and compile disparate data sources (local cloud 3rd party) for ingestion in data pipelines.
  • Design and build a reliable scalable and secure data pipeline (cloud) to ingest transform and push datasets to stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with Data Analyst to generate actionable insights based on your soon-to-be intimate understanding of our data.
  • Collaborate with development team to build data products (e.g. personalization recommendation system).


Requirements:

  • 3+ years of solid experience in building data pipelines.
  • Proficient in SQL and at least one scripting language preferably in Python or R to clean transform and denormalise datasets.
  • Experience with cloud infrastructure (e.g. AWS GCP) and containerisation.
  • Experience using shell scripting big data frameworks (e.g. Hadoop Spark Kafka) relational databases (e.g. BigQuery Redshift) and data lakes (e.g. Google Buckets).
  • Familiar with web and customer analytics.
  • Experience with machine learning is a plus.
  • Love learning and sharing new technical knowledge willing to take new challenges.
  • Possess strong sense of ownership adaptive to change.


If you think you’ve got what it takes please provide your cover letter CV and expected salary.

Job Summary

FlexTrade is seeking an OEMS Implementation Specialist to join the Singapore Client Service team. This position is responsible for the successful delivery of projects that drive the immediate and strategic OEMS initiatives involving direct interaction with front middle and back-office as well as provide day to day support for FlexTrade’s global client base.

Responsibilities will include:

  • Working alongside Project Managers to implement configure and test FlexTrade’s FlexONE application.
  • Assist with creating project implementation plans including resource allocation defining milestones project dependencies and managing risk.
  • The OEMS Implementation specialist will be involved in all stages of an OEMS deployment and will establish sync points with internal teams external vendors and clients.
  • Communicate directly with clients to gather information in order to create and execute technical configuration requirements.
  • Act in a tier 1 support capacity to assist with production issues and answer client inquiries.
  • May assist the sales team during workflow demonstrations and champion best practice OMS workflows.
  • A successful candidate must have prior experience as an Implementation Management/ Business Analyst on end-to-end implementation of an Order Management System.
  • The candidate should also possess a working knowledge of buy-side investment technology strong data analysis and technical skills as well as a good understanding of the investment process and financial markets.
  • An OEMS Implementation Specialist maintains a positive and professional attitude under pressure and strives to provide the highest quality and effective client service.


Requirements:

  • 3-5 years of buy-side investment technology implementation experience
  • Experience implementing software in a large-scale environment
  • Good understanding of software product development lifecycle is a plus
  • Working knowledge of trading systems and network infrastructures
  • Familiarity with project management tools and methodologies
  • Strong understanding of the financial markets front and back office
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; client facing experience
  • Ability to develop a strong working relationship across team and other departments


Preferred

·Series 7 or Financial certification Equivalent

·PMP or CAPM certification

Due to the current health crisis related to COVID-19 and the escalating visa/travel restrictions in place we're currently unable to extend offers to anyone who cannot work from Singapore due to lockdown visa/travel restrictions or other restrictive measures until further notice. Consequently we will be prioritizing candidates who can start in this location by set date as expected. We're keeping the situation under review and would adjust our position should the restrictive measures be removed later on.

Minimum Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of experience with 5 years in Management Consulting Corporate Development Investment Banking and/or Corporate Strategy roles in a B2B Technology firm.


Preferred Qualifications
  • Distinctive problem solving analytical presentation and communication skills with a track record of independantly engaging and influencing senior executives and stakeholders in a matrixed organization.
  • Demonstrable experience of leading large programs and/or projects in Enterprise sales and strategy.
  • Extreme comfort with ambiguity and taking on high-level ideas.
  • Ability to be flexible in a fast paced environment with limited direction balance competing priorities and manage several time-sensitive projects at once.


About The Job

The Business Strategy and Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.

The Strategic Growth Initiatives Lead will be a critical leader in the Google Cloud Strategy and Operations team. Our team of highly creative visionaries thrives in deconstructing and re-creating businesses to meet changing strategic and operational needs incubate and scale new ideas build differentiated go-to-market capabilities and align stakeholders to help the company continue to achieve its vast potential.

In this role you will be a thought partner to various business leaders helping design bold “big bet” ideas to grow the business as well as build the investment rationale for those ideas. You will lead cross-functional teams to drive the execution of and secure impact from these ideas. You will help our customer and industry teams on strategic agreements by interacting with customers to understand their needs and shape their transformation vision. You will collaborate with teams in North America and EMEA to share best practices and implement in APAC.

Reporting to the APAC Head of Strategic Growth Initiatives you will be confident working independently in a fast-paced constantly evolving global executive environment. You will begin as an individual contributor and build a team over time as your impact scales.

Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities
  • Partner with Regional Business leaders and Strategy and Operations leads to identify growth themes build analytical fact base to support the ideas and develop investment cases.
  • Develop deep insights about market and competition by leveraging multitude of sources including APAC business performance data market data and analyst reports.
  • Help Business leads secure impact from their investments by co-leading execution of strategic initiatives with a cross-functional APAC team.
  • Work closely with Sales Representatives and Managers on strategic deals helping strengthen our value proposition and differentiation with edgy industry-specific insights and perspectives. Assist strategic agreement teams by front-ending customer conversations to understand customer needs and jointly shape transformation approach.
  • Work with global teams in Google/Google Cloud to help incubate and scale specific organizational-wide APAC initiatives. Share best practices with other regional/global Strategy and Operations teams.

Job Title: 2021 Mastercard Launch| Associate Analyst| Products & Innovation
Job Description:
Our Purpose

We work to connect and power an inclusive digital economy that benefits everyone everywhere by making transactions safe simple smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks partnerships and passion our innovations and solutions help individuals financial institutions governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient or DQ drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths views and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions drives innovation and delivers better business results.

Job Title

2021 Mastercard Launch Associate Analyst Products & Innovation

Job Description Summary

Who is Mastercard?
We are the global technology company behind the world’s fastest payments processing network. We are a vehicle for commerce a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded a technology innovation lab and the home of Priceless®. We ensure every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe as our company grows so should you. We believe in connecting everyone to endless priceless possibilities.

The Mastercard Launch program is aimed at early career talent to help you develop skills and gain cross-functional work experience. Over a period of 18 months Launch participants will be assigned to a business unit learn and develop skills and gain valuable on the job experience. Successful candidates will be assigned to a business unit within International Markets and rotate for a duration of 2 x 9 months each for a total of 18 months.

Role

Products & Innovation’s emphasis is on distribution and serving our customers. Our focus is to create growth centers (i.e. grow digital consumers grow acceptance grow commercial grow new payment flows) in the Asia Pacific region.

This Role Will
  • Support the team in gaining accountability to ensure the business has the right product implementation assets in the right markets at the right time to achieve the business’ strategic objectives.
  • Ability to work on projects to build use cases understand market / client feedback and needs
  • Work on requirements for products implementations ensure product documentation and implementation guides are in place and reviewed and updated regularly
Support Business Development Sales Customer and Product delivery teams against agreed metrics
  • Support the development on the team’s strategy and objectives with the necessary leaders in the business
Education

All about you:
  • Graduating seniors - Class of 2021
  • Students pursuing a Masters/bachelor’s degree (all majors welcome to apply)
Key Competencies

Job Title: Data Business Analyst| ViewPoint Cloud (6Months Contract)
Job Description:
Purpose of the role


Vistra Singapore is migrating their 3 client’s databases (currently on 2 versions of Viewpoint (“VP”) and Millogic) on premise to the global fit to standard model of VPC.


To implement VPC in Singapore an extensive data cleaning exercise will need to be performed before data can be migrated to the VPC. To perform the data cleaning and the migration an Informatica tool referred as Vistra Integrated Platform (VIP) will be used. VIP will be run by a Data Central Team (DCT) based in India with the support of the technology team also based in India.


The data business analyst will be supporting this data cleaning and migration from legacy systems (Viewpoint and Millogic) to VPC. She/he will work side-by-side with our country implementation teams to serve as the bridge between the data central team the technology team and the business. On a day to day basis this involves extensive interactions with various stakeholders to ensure that projects are running smoothly and deliver real benefits.



Job Responsibilities  


  • Work with the DCT and the VPC project team to determine the required fields and ensure data completeness.


  •  Assist the DCT in identifying the data cleaning & validation rules


  • Lead data review workshops and support business in the review and validation of these rules and any design documents


  • Continuously validate data sets with Business and work with DCT to adapt the cleaning & validation rules as required


  • Regularly extract data from all 3 systems and review to interpret and profile source data and analyse results using statistical techniques


  • Acquire and analyse data from all data sources to create accurate ETL (Extract Transform Load) processes


  • Create and circulate for sign-off all mapping and transformation design documents


  • Support the DCT and Technology team in the design and testing of ETL processes


  • Support testing of migrated data and provide data and analysis through all testing phases


  • Create reconciliation routines to track data as it migrates through the migration life cycle


  • Support business with the analysis and resolution of defects and identify data quality issues


  • Support with reporting Actions Assumptions Risks Issues Decisions Constraints


  • Ensure all Requirements Design Interface and Output Documents are delivered on time


  • Support the Design Authority on End to End solution ensuring all Data Migration design documents are delivered on time and in line with the overall functional solution


Relevant Experience &  Skills


  • Understanding of the fiduciary services market and experience in client data migrations preferred


  • Delivery experience in all phases of the end to end Data Migration life cycle


  • Able to work alone or as a team player across the wider delivery team 


  • Data Mapping delivery


  • Flexibility with regards to travel and working hours 


  • Able to work to tight deadline and against challenging timescales.


  • Possess good English communication skills both written and oral be able to articulate technical concepts to business users.


  • Excellent analytical thinking and problems solving ability.


  • Demonstrated ability to learn and understand complex software tools and data models.


  • Minimum of 4 years’ experience as a business analyst involved in large data migration programs


Education/Memberships 


  • University Degree preferably in a Business Management Information Technology Financial Management or similar relevant fields.


  • Business Analysis Certification preferred

    What's On Offer

    This is a fantastic opportunity to join an expanding team at a very critical time for the business.

    Contact: John Doyle (Lic No. R1761995)
    Quote job ref: 4154541

Do you enjoy making large sets of numerical data and extracting from them to transform them into valuable information about the company's revenue that management can use to make business decisions?


We are looking for Group Revenue Analyst to join our growing family. Come home and start your #BeHappier journey with TDCX today!


Top reasons to work here:


  • Positive Work Environment
  • Competitive Remuneration
  • Medical Benefits and Insurance
  • Experiential-based Training
  • Awards and Recognition
  • Employee Engagement Activities
  • We live by our core values of teamwork initiative courage innovation and trust
  • Room to grow + Space to breathe = Happy productive superstars


What is your mission?


As a Group Revenue Analyst you will play an important role in a company's business growth by helping maximize revenue and bringing to attention any issues and risks regarding accounting work process or finances.


These professionals serve as a point of contact within their company and relay information to other members of the revenue policy team as well as staff members from other departments/projects.


They often share with operational team members best practices to adopt and pitfalls to avoid regarding revenue systems evaluations and improvements.


You are also required to perform these job functions:


  • Regularly audit and review the group's revenue transactions sales contracts statements of work (“SOW”) and business practices.
  • Identify revenue control risk and develop/implement remedial actionable plans to ensure adherence to contractual obligations and revenue maximization objectives.
  • Prepare monthly quarterly and yearly revenue reports as well as documentation of financial arrangements.

Who are we looking for?

Who is TDCX?


We serve some of the world’s best brands from our centers of excellence in Singapore Philippines Malaysia Thailand Hong Kong China Japan Spain and Colombia. We specialize in perfecting our client's customer experience and elevating their sales.


We are guided by a talent philosophy - selecting and employing the best professionals to make the outsource industry better for our people and our clients.


Our company has won over 200 industry awards for delivering value driven by technology and continuously innovating our customer-facing brand solutions. Thanks to our premium workspaces above industry average compensation packages career opportunities and long list of perks we were recently awarded as one of the best companies to work for in Asia.

You will be joining an agile team of business analyst and software engineers to maintain and enhance our web-based insurance portal for our customers and advisers. You also need close collaboration with our business architects infra security teams and service providers to ensure quality solutioning that value-adds to our customers sales and distribution channels ​


Role Purpose

﻿

The Software Engineer performs analysis development and technical governance across both Run and/or Change and will be accountable for the maintenance quality of code and compliance to standards within the platform.


  • Analysis development & implementation of change and/or run activity in accordance with the agreed digital/platform strategy standards and governance for a business unit project programme platform or feature team

Nature of Work

  • Analysis of user needs and define technical specifications
  • Technical Development of existing programs analysing and identifying areas for modification
  • Building security performance monitoring and non-functional requirements within solution
  • Performance and availability management including system health checks performance monitoring and disaster recovery planning
  • Identify and implementing Service improvements including production of improvement plans and applying software upgrades
  • Technical development and governance of new projects and initiatives assessing the impact of initiatives or projects on systems/applications
  • Confirm that changes to the Platform are compliant with Aviva architecture standards or deviations are agreed with the relevant governance authorities
  • Champion process improvements embedding new ways of working focus on driving up quality of deliverables and the way we operate within the Platform
  • Promote and evolve Software Engineering Practice
  • Propose innovative solutions or alternative approaches to difficult issues
  • Stakeholder management of business and IT SME colleagues


Capabilities


  • Staff at this level will demonstrate an understanding of the following skills/knowledge areas:
  • Proactive ‘can do’ attitude good verbal and written communication skills enabling effective interaction with both wider IT and Business stakeholders
  • Demonstrate in depth experience of the Platform they support with practical experience gained over at least a 5 year period and above
  • Significant knowledge of Application Support and Development processes standards and associated techniques including continuous integration test driven development behaviour driven development
  • Propose innovative solutions or alternative approaches to difficult issues
  • Proven record in delivering technical solutions across run and/or change within this Platform
  • Experience of working with our Global Sourcing partners and developing solutions with will improve the customers experience
  • Proven knowledge of Technical platforms software engineering practices and system management methodologies

Join us as a Data Analyst!

We are looking for a Data Analyst with a proven track record of delivering business value through insights.

Your work will have a large impact influencing business decisions relating to millions of customers everyday. You’ll have the opportunity to work on projects across our full spectrum of departments from software development and engineering product marketing content and people functions.

Highlights
  • You are passionate about data and using it to influence business decisions.
  • You have an excellent eye for detail and can always be relied upon for quality work
  • You are inquisitive and ask insightful questions to understand what stakeholders need
  • You are eager to grow your data analysis skills
  • You seek a fast-paced environment where your contributions make an impact.
  • You love being surrounded by intelligent passionate people who inspire you.


Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst you will:
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to gain a clear understanding of their critical business questions - across topics such as: Marketing campaign attribution Customer churn & retention User behaviours & segmentation Customer support interactions Technical operations metrics
  • Turn data into insights and actionable recommendations delivering clear business value and impact
  • Evaluate available data sources understanding definitions and limitations then implementing ETL processes to derive appropriate datasets
  • Design and build dashboards that visualize data insights enabling relevant stakeholders to get answers themselves to their critical business questions.
  • Coordinate with software development teams to define requirements for your data pipelines.
  • Define and create processes to ensure stakeholders can efficiently monitor key metrics on an appropriate frequency (hourly daily weekly monthly)


Requirements

We’re hiring across a range of experience for Data Analyst roles and will assess level against these requirements accordingly.
  • 2 - 5+ years experience in a data analyst role
  • Proficient in SQL
  • Experience with visualization products (e.g. Tableau Power BI)
  • Delivering business value: you have a track record of delivering against stakeholder requirements ensuring analysis and reports are fit for purpose.
  • Excellent communication skills: you can explain complex concepts in straight forward and succinct language.
  • Curiosity: you are inquisitive by nature asking insightful questions to understand all facets of a problem and how that impacts the business.
  • Attention to detail: you are conscientious in your approach delivering high quality error free work.
  • Project Management: you can be relied upon to deliver your projects using excellent time management and prioritization skills.
  • Fluent in English.


Nice Skills To Have But Not Required

  • Expert SQL
  • Proficient in Python or a similar language to do ad-hoc data-cleansing and create prototypes for software developers to later build at scale.
  • Excellent statistical knowledge (e.g. experience in predictive analytics).
  • Comfortable talking technology and communicating with developers on technical topics.
  • Experienced in process design to ensure automation and scalability wherever possible.

What we offer
  • Challenging work in a fun and collaborative environment
  • Attractive compensation and time-off benefits
  • Spacious open-concept and centrally located offices
  • Full-time employment with flexible working hours
  • Fully stocked pantry with breakfast foods fresh fruit and snacks
  • Team lunches and company events every quarter
  • Multicultural teams represented by 30+ nationalities

This job role is supported by the structured development programme for mid-career professionals under the TechSkills Accelerator (TeSA) initiative led by Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA) in partnership with SkillsFuture Singapore (SSG) and Workforce Singapore (WSG).

TD Bank Group


Headquartered in Toronto Canada with more than 85000 employees in offices around the world The Toronto-Dominion Bank and its subsidiaries are collectively known as TD Bank Group ("TD"). TD offers a full range of financial products and services to more than 25 million customers worldwide through three key business lines:


  • Canadian Retail including TD Canada Trust Business Banking TD Auto Finance TD Wealth TD Direct Investing and TD Insurance
  • U.S. Retail including TD Bank America’s Most Convenient Bank TD Auto Finance TD Wealth and TD’s investment in TD Ameritrade
  • Wholesale Banking through TD Securities


TD had C$1.7 trillion in assets as at April 30 2020. TD also ranks among the world’s leading online financial services firms with more than 13 million active online and mobile customers. The Toronto-Dominion Bank trades on the Toronto and New York stock exchanges under the symbol "TD".


In Singapore TD operates as The Toronto-Dominion Bank Singapore Branch and Toronto Dominion (South East Asia) Limited which are collectively known as “TD Singapore” since 1979. The key business in Singapore is TD Securities which is part of Wholesale Banking.


Department Overview:


As a leading corporate and investment bank TD Securities provides a wide range of integrated capital market products and services to corporations governments and institutions. Our clients choose us for our knowledge innovation and experience in the following key areas of finance investment corporate and government banking capital markets interest rate currency and derivative products. 


Test Center of Excellence (TCoE) is a group focused on providing world class testing solutions and expertise on a global basis within TD Securities. Currently the primary focus of the team is to deliver best in class testing services tooling and comprehensive test processes made readily available to all in TD Securities.


Position Summary:


As a Senior SDET (Software Development Engineer in Test) you will play a key role in both the key QA specific deliverables throughout a project's lifecycle as well as contribute towards the automation tooling initiative to support accelerated test execution. You will be required to provide research analysis design execution maintenance and/or support of testing solutions that are appropriate to the application solution and project as assigned. You will report to and partner with the QA Manager. You will interact with business stakeholders business analyst teams development teams and senior management.


The successful candidate should be passionate about owning the delivery and implementation of the test strategy and automation solutions to support end-to-end testing while meeting all stakeholder objectives.


Responsibilities:


  • Create test plans test cases and traceability matrices based on complex business requirements documents and system design documents
  • Conduct data quality assessment & design solutions to detect and improve test data quality
  • Actively contribute to and maintain team’s automation tool set
  • Responsible for organizing and delivering End-To-End testing within a Project
  • Pro-actively seek to make continuous improvements to test coverage execution and test automation
  • Create and/or maintain automated test data sets as well as validate test environments.
  • Organize and prioritize team's needs within given automation toolset to ensure execution is as effective as possible
  • Take an active role in all testing phases partnering with the QA Manager
  • Contribute to and maintain team’s internal knowledge base and mentor other QA resources

JOB SCOPE

Summary of Job Responsibilities

The Senior Analyst is an expert level threat detection and response analyst within the Marina Bay Sands’ Cyber Security Operations Centre (CSOC). MBS CSOC operates a follow-the-sun model partnering with Las Vegas Sands Corp CSOC. The mission of MBS CSOC is to protect and defend MBS and LVS against cyber-attacks targeting the gaming retail and hospitality sector.


The Senior Analyst supervises and ensure potential cyber threats are detected investigated and escalated timely by CSOC. If required the Senior Analyst is also capable of providing focused effort and analysis of potential cyber incidents. This position is a semi-supervisory role and works closely with the global CSOC team members in other centers around the world.


Job Responsibilities

  • Consistent and regular attendance is an essential function of this job.
  • Ensure cyber threats are detected responded and / or escalated in a timely fashion.
  • Ensure cyber threat detection tools are maintained reviewed and effective in detecting cyber threats.
  • Ensure CSOC analyst runbooks are reviewed and updated timely.
  • Ensure CSOC metrics and trending including the health of the security monitoring systems are collected reviewed and analyzed timely.
  • Ensure IT compliance within CSOC operations are met.
  • Ensure CSOC compliance to regulatory requirements.
  • Coordinate with other stakeholders to resolve cases where required.
  • Provide guidance to Cyber Threat Responders and Cyber Threat Analysts where required.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.

 

JOB REQUIREMENTS

  • Degree or Diploma with at least 5 years of work experience in detecting and responding to cyber threats preferably in a CSOC environment.
  • Professional cyber related membership and certification is required
  • Experience in Gaming Banking or Critical Infrastructure InfoComm Industry is preferred but not a must.
  • Proven effective verbal and written communication skills.
  • Abilities required:
  • Apply techniques for detecting host and network-based intrusions using intrusion detection technologies.
  • Communicate complex information concepts or ideas in a confident and well-organized manner through verbal written and/or visual means.


Knowledge required:

  • Computer networking concepts and protocols.
  • Cyber threats and vulnerabilities
  • Incident categories responses and timelines.
  • System and application security threats and vulnerabilities.
  • Security service provider reporting structure and processes.
  • Defence-in-depth principles and network security architecture.
  • Common attack vectors.
  • Cyber-attack stages.


Skills required:

  • Identify capture contain and report malware.
  • Detect host and network based intrusions.
  • Collect data from a variety of cyber defence resources.
  • Recognize and categorize types of vulnerabilities and associated attacks.
  • Protect a network against malware.
  • Read and interpret detection signatures.
  • Perform packet-level analysis.

Position Summary
  • Design and implement strategies / plans / programs to accelerate market access of Pfizer Singapore products and achieve optimum business returns in Singapore market specifically for evolving HTA market environment.
  • Partner with customers and stakeholders (i.e. ACE corporate insurers and Cluster Health systems and other relevant payers etc) as Pfizer Singapore and represent Pfizer where needed to develop win:win solutions and explore alternative access and evidence based cost-sharing models with payers to improve the access environment and enhance access for Pfizer medicines
  • Lead on engagements with ACE Singapore`s HTA body to help facilitate and expedite the evaluation process and provide dossiers with improved alignment to ACE requirements a better understanding of HTA models employed and mechanisms to provide feedback on the technical insufficiencies if any.
  • Be the critical link between Pfizer Singapore commercial team and external stakeholders in Singapore in developing partnerships collaborations and joint initiatives as part of business support and patient access to medicines.

Position Responsibilities

HTA
  • Develops and leads Pfizer Singapore health technology assessment (HTA) capability / expertise.
  • Develops best practices in HTA protocol / SOP for Pfizer Singapore.
  • Applies advanced knowledge in HTA to secure access and government subsidies for key Pfizer businesses (with special focus on Oncology & Vaccines)
  • Applies expert HTA skillset to contribute to the achievement of yearly Operating Plan targets for business
  • Applies expert technical capability in HTA to develop access approach to manage HTA implementation by Agency for Care Effectiveness (ACE) – Singapore’s national HTA agency.
  • Interprets evolving HTA environment to recommend best practices to support business goals in Singapore.
  • Creates an innovative environment for HTA understanding processes and methodologies based on comprehensive specialized knowledge.
  • Makes decisions in the setup / utilization of HTA skillset and capability for Pfizer Singapore.
  • Operates independently in the HTA expertise domain and supports businesses to deliver its objectives
  • Become a HTA resource person for Pfizer Singapore
  • Self-initiate and pursue new business opportunities in Singapore HTA environment for businesses (especially in public sector business).
  • Develops and takes responsibility of patient access/assistance programs for Singapore
  • To source interpret generate and disseminate high quality Health & Value information in a timely fashion to direct and support the busines related to all HTA activities.
  • To influence and shape HTA policy in terms of methods and processes. Provide timely input into HTA consultations on methods and processes. Proactively influence HTA policy via SAPI and Pfizer specific activities
Market Access
  • Explore and assess different target customers (e.g. corporations insurance members workers in specific occupations etc) for innovative access strategies
  • Address challenges from evolving macro environment (e.g. anticipate key trend of environment and analyze organizational implication in order to prepare for environmental changes provide a strategic platform to BUs based on a comprehensive understanding through relevant long-term market access strategy).

  • Partner with key stakeholders and academia and relevant institutions to develop win:win solutions and explore alternative access and evidence based cost-sharing models with payers to improve the access environment and enhance access for medicines
  • Lead on Real World Data efforts for Singapore aligned with the market access strategy

Pricing
  • Develop and lead Singapore pricing strategy and develop best practices in price optimization for Pfizer Singapore.
  • Develop suitable solutions for optimum business revenue / returns for private business and develop monitoing and tracking systems to understand competitive landscape and market drivers (e.g. competitive product pricing tender excellence portfolio selling/offering product visibility and uptake etc).

RESOURCES MANAGED

  • This role will work very closely with the Corporate Affairs and Communications Lead

EDUCATION
  • Degree in Business Economics Law Marketing Science Pharmacy and/or health related field.
  • A Master degree in Health Economics is an advantage and preferred

Experience

  • Excellent understanding of overall healthcare industry pharmaceutical market environment pricing policies pharmacoeconomics will be essential.
  • Excellent understanding of HTA and pricing decision-making process health economics gained through experience in intensive payer communications / negotiations will be essential.

  • Knowledge and experience in public healthcare policy making process and healthcare initiatives will be essential.

  • Exceptional oral and written communication skills with fluency in English required
  • Working experience as market access director or manager in healthcare / pharmaceutical sectors is an advantage.
  • Possess a business-oriented mindset with innovative approach in strategic thinking.

About Zilingo

Zilingo is making the fashion supply chain Fair Connected and Transparent using Technology Data and Financial Services. We are working to improve the entire supply chain for fashion from the cotton farm to the closet. Our business model has three main pillars: Commerce Services and Sustainability.
  • We operate a global technology-enabled sourcing business and the largest B2B marketplace for fashion in South and Southeast Asia which connects yarn mills fabric mills factories brands and merchants through a discovery and transaction platform.
  • Services (Saas MaaS Fintech). We develop and deploy Software as a Service to factories and brands to help improve operational efficiency; help brands and factories enhance branding Marketing as a Service; and use technology to connect makers and merchants with access to working capital.
  • We provide brands with transparency into the sustainability of their supply chain. We also bring sustainable fabric and are launching a Sustainability Fund which enables factories to improve sustainability with investment.

Job description:

As a Finance analyst you will be involved in multiple aspects of Zilingo's business from helping monitor financial analysis to supporting all types of finance and accounts.

Responsibilities:

The key responsibilities of the Corporate Finance Analyst comprise:
  • Overall Project Manager for the group ERP Implementation work as a main administrator for the ERP system and be point of Contact between NetSuite and Zilingo.
  • Address queries from the system user and come up solution within the ERP system to suit the finance/ business needs. For new entities that are not on Oracle gather requirement from end users setup the system based on processes tax requirement accounting booking customization; conduct training to user in the midst of Phase 3 preparation

  • Collaborate with other department to fully utilize the system and how all the numbers can be recorded in to the system. Take care of Projects like Benefits a la carte for India Singapore and Thailand Processes are set-up reports and dashboard are created to track the amount MaaS subscription screen & getting input from the Subscription Screen team to configure the system according to their needs educate and train the team on the Oracle interface and how to use it. Bridge the connection between NetSuite team and the Subscription Screen team to address on technical requirement such as API
  • Train and onboard new and existing employees onto the system ensure they are trained and know how to use this. Create training guides on the system user will have a hard copy material to go through it. Upload CSV files from team reducing time on manual entry.
  • Collaborate with Citibank to integrate the banking platform with the ERP reduce an extra step of using the bank platform. Take care of transactions: The bank can feed the bank statement in the ERP and we can reconcile the books directly on the ERP system. Payment file is generated from the ERP we can feed the file direct on the ERP to the Citibank platform.
  • Thomson Reuters install it's tax engine into the ERP system to calculate tax for India and Thailand (localization) be point of Contact between Thomson Reuters and Zilingo Configure the system ensuring it works well with NetSuite Testing on the Tax Engine ensuring the tax is calculated correctly for India and Thailand. Gather information from India and Thailand to ensure the information are correct so the tax calculation works. Check and upload the data to ensure all the information are there.
  • Main point of contact with Citibank manage relationship between Zilingo and Citibank. Assist with any Citibank administration & work on Bank Account Opening for other entity. Security Manager for the CitiDirect Platform. Give access to new user onboard new user train user on the CitiDirect Platform create access profile to ensure users are getting the correct access. Reduce addition step of getting signature from management.
  • Track the payment made by the card ensure that there is no extra or suspicious charges. Ensure the security of the card and address colleague needs on the credit card. Communicate with Citibank Corporate Card for any request.
  • Main point of contact with Amex manage relationship between Zilingo and AMEX. Track the payment made by the card ensure that there is no extra or suspicious. Communicate with AMEX Corporate Card for any request
  • Make Payment track the cash inflow and outflow. Do weekly reporting on the cash dashboard cash pnl. Make Payment & payroll. Make payment via the Citibank HK USD account.

Company Name: Committee for Private Education Group (SkillsFuture Singapore)
Job Description:
Responsibilities

A Portfolio and Accounts Manager with strong Project Management and Business Analyst skills. You will report to the Deputy Director and be part of a team responsible to:

  • Flexibility to adapt to fast-moving and rapidly changing environments and ability to deliver results in a high pressure environment.

• Major Well-established Organisation in the Services Sector
  • Key Specialist role

Job Title: Senior Compensation Consulting Analyst - HR Consulting Team
Job Description:
Extraordinary people. Extraordinary results. With more than 20000 employees in more than 40 countries worldwide Mercer is a leading global provider in talent health retirement and investment consulting. Mercer works with clients to solve their most complex benefit and human capital issues designing and helping manage health retirement and other benefits. At Mercer we say we Make Tomorrow Today.

In order to support our team and strengthen the growth of our business in Singapore we are looking for:

Senior Compensation Consulting Analyst - HR Consulting Team

This role is responsible for contributing to the growth of Singapore career products business by growing the respective industry’s annual remuneration survey participants be the client point of contact for all clarifications and queries. The role holder would need to ensure timely project delivery for rewards consulting projects as a senior level analyst supporting the respective consultant or project manager. The role shall be responsible for providing analytics on compensation analysis projects and work on industry level insights and trends. The position shall be responsible for survey revenue and project delivery targets.

What can you expect?
  • Contribute to the growth of Singapore Career Products business by growing the respective industry’s annual remuneration survey participants.
  • Be the client point of contact for all clarifications and queries.
  • Timely project delivery for rewards consulting projects as a senior level analyst supporting the respective consultant or project manager.
  • Providing analytics on compensation analysis projects and work on industry level insights and trends.
  • Survey revenue and project delivery generation targets.

What is in it for you?
  • Work for a market leader and the largest compensation and rewards consulting firm in Singapore.
  • Join a vibrant culture and affable team and enjoy a flexible work arrangement.
  • Run projects and stay intuitive
  • Work with clients across a variety of industries and countries
  • Exposure to multiple domains in compensation including advanced rewards projects such as Sales Incentive Plan design and Specialist Job Architecture design
  • Employee benefits include :- Dental and vision care TCM gym membership insurance coverage

We Will Count On You To
  • Deliver impeccable stakeholder management and presentation skills to penetrate and grow accounts for survey and data subscriptions.
