  • Strong support on any custom survey/project assigned across all domains of total rewards working closely with the industry lead or project managers.

What You Need To Have
  • 4-5 years domain knowledge in compensation consulting and driving business development in this space.
  • Passionate about Compensation Consulting

Job Title: Account Management Coordinator (Transportation Operations on-site at customer premise)
Job Description:
Company Description

“We’re not in the shipping business; we’re in the information business” -Peter Rose Expeditors Founder

Global supply chain management is what we do but at the heart of Expeditors you will find professionalism leadership and a friendly environment all of which foster an innovative customer service-based approach to logistics.
  • 17000+ trained professionals
  • 300+ locations worldwide
  • Fortune 500
  • Globally unified systems
Job Description

The Transportation Operations Analyst works on-site with a large global customer. It requires a dynamic individual with a strong transportation & logistics background as well as excellent communication and customer service skills. An integral part of a Global Command Center Team the Transportation Operations Analyst is responsible for the safe and timely delivery of freight as it moves through the global supply chain network. May lead and/or support regional and global project initiatives. Analyzes shipment issues and works to resolve problems quickly through proactive communication with carriers vendors and cross-functional departments. Collaborates across functions and regions at all levels to improve relationships and streamline operations.

Primary Duties And Responsibilities
  • Actively manage the safe and timely delivery of freight as it moves through the supply chain network
  • Coordinate with customers carriers warehouses and other service providers to proactively reduce delays in shipments reaching destination
  • Quickly gather and analyze information from multiple sources develop incident reports and escalate to stakeholders through established communication protocols
  • Conduct shipment track and trace respond to ad-hoc price quotes and other transportation related activities
  • Ensure accuracy of data metrics dashboards and reporting tools
  • Lead or support regional and global projects within the Command Center and support projects across functional areas as applicable
  • Work with fellow analysts to identify global inconsistencies and develop methods for global standardization
  • Conduct handoffs with regional Command Center teammates facilitating 24/7 global operations
  • Develop and maintain relationships with cross-functional departments as well as carriers vendors and other service providers
  • Provide outstanding customer service maintaining a positive attitude & professionalism
  • Maintain proficiency on Command Center systems and tools
  • Work within a team to identify security gaps constraints and trends
  • Ensure processes and procedures are documented in updated SWIs/SOPs
  • Create presentations process maps and visual charts as applicable
  • Crosstrain and assist with other transportation and logistics requirements as needed
  • Meet minimum annual company training requirements
Qualifications
  • Works collaboratively within a team proficient u sing multiple communications platforms (i.e. email chat video conference etc.)
  • Effective interpersonal skills proven ability to listen and communicate effectively
  • Accustomed to leading meetings with customers vendors and key stakeholders
  • Risk sensitive recognizes when problems arise or are likely to arise
  • Critical thinking using logic data & qualitative reasoning
  • Ability to develop evaluate and recommend best options
  • Analytical with a strong attention to detail
  • Highly motivated proactive strong sense of urgency able to work in a fast-paced environment
  • 2+ years transportation logistics distribution or related experience
  • Demonstrated leadership experience
  • Undergraduate degree in Business Logistics Supply Chain or other related field
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Must speak English fluently
  • Proficient in Microsoft suite
  • Continuous process improvement experience a plus
  • Industry certifications a plus
  • Must be willing to occasionally work outside normal business hours including weekends
  • Domestic and international travel as needed (less than 25%)

Additional Information

Expeditors Offers Excellent Benefits For Full Time Employees
  • Health Plan: Medical Accident Insurance
  • Training and Personnel Development Program
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Job Description

UST Global® is a leading provider of platforms; digital innovation; artificial Intelligence and end-to-end IT services and solutions for Global 1000 companies. We are transforming corporations through deep domain expertise; knowledge-based ML platforms; as well as profound anthropological efforts to understand the end customer and design products and interactions that create delight. We are deeply committed to developing a comprehensive understanding of our clients’ problems and to develop platforms to address them.

CyberProof is a fully owned subsidiary of UST Global; helps companies increase their cyber resiliency and reducing their cyber risks by providing managed cyber security center out of a newly architected Security Operation Centre that dramatically increase the ability to react; detect and respond to cyber-attacks. CyberProof provides 24x7 security operations capability; supported by expert cyber security resources and cutting-edge tools; along with mature operational methodologies to address our customers cyber security operations requirements. All of our services are delivered through our advanced CyberProof Defense Centres located around the globe. Our goal is to provide enhanced detection abilities; faster response; collaborative issue resolution; effective recovery and actionable intelligence delivered through our state-of-the-art Security Orchestration; Automation and Response platform to increase scale and differentiation for our customers.

At the core of what we do is our people. The Security Operations Group of CyberProof consists of a global team of highly talented people. With 100+ highly experienced; certified cyber security experts; researchers and analysts; majority of our tier 3-4 expertise comes from Israeli Intelligence. This group strategize; develop and execute all cyber security activities locally and globally. Individuals and teams in this group work closely with client cyber security team and customer CISOs; CIO’s and/or senior business management on business & cyber security strategies and solutions.

SOC level 2 Analyst

The SOC level 2 Analyst will be part of our growing SOC group; which handles monitoring and investigating security incidents and violations; as well as suspicious activity and handle their resolution.

Areas Of Responsibilities
  • Resolve; escalated report and raise recommendations for resolution and remediation for security incidents
  • Advanced monitoring of system logs; SIEM tools and network traffic for unusual or suspicious activity.
  • SIEM (Security Information and Event Management):
  • Setting up various SIEM solutions and troubleshooting connectivity issues.
  • Investigate and resolve security violations by providing postmortem analysis to illuminate the issues and possible solutions.
  • Collate security incident and event data to produce monthly exception and management reports.
  • Report unresolved network security exposures; misuse of resources or noncompliance situations using defined escalation processes.
  • Assist and train team members in the use of security tools; the preparation of security reports and the resolution of security issues.
  • Develop and maintain documentation for security systems and procedures.
  • Recommend; schedule and/or apply fixes; security patches and any other measures required in the event of a security breach.
Desired Skills
  • Experience in working as a Senior Analyst as part of a Soc group for 2+ years
  • Experience working with different Siem vendors like Qradar; Archsight; RSA; Logrythem
  • Experience in incident response; writing procedures runbooks and playbooks
  • Ability to work with customer's IT and security teams as well as directors’ level.

Do you love HealthTech and Singapore put together? Then you just might love IHiS. IHiS is a multiple award-winning Healthcare IT Leader that digitises connects and analyses Singapore's health ecosystem. Its ultimate aim is to improve the Singapore population's health and health administrations by integrating intelligent highly resilient and cost effective technologies with process and people. We’re looking for a highly-driven and motivated Business Intelligence Analyst for our Health Insights team in Singapore.


In this role you will be using the big data in the public healthcare to analyse design and develop BI solutions that provide strategic insights to improve decision-making in Singapore healthcare system. You will then implement & deploy your solutions and work with the team to maintain and support these complex data platforms.


If you are looking for a dynamic environment and to work with projects that use data to make a difference in our public healthcare system this is the right place for you. 


Responsibility:


Communication:


  • Build strong relationships with stakeholders to understand business challenges and opportunities. 
  • Identify issues gather information from various sources and translate essential business needs into technical specification that are used as reference for data product design. 


Functional & Technical Expertise:


  • Regular use of leveraging common BI tools such as Tableau and/or OBIEE to design and develop business reports and/or dashboards.  
  • Regular use in any of the various BI standard languages such as SQL Python C# Java VBA etc
  • Possess superior organisation skills to be able to manage end-to-end data product development with production development conducting system integration/user acceptance testing etc. 
  • Be a steward of good data practices - robust documentation (i.e.: metadata) versioning playbooking processes and knowledge sharing.
  • Ability to work with the team to support the maintenance of data platforms 


Innovation:


  • Develop good working knowledge of available technology capabilities and how and where to deploy them
  • Evaluate potential technical solutions and make recommendations to resolve business problems.


Requirement: 


  • Degree/Diploma in Computer Science/ Engineering Information Technology/ System or equivalent. 
  • 2 to 5 years of experience in design develop deploy and maintenance of BI solutions Candidates without prior working experience are welcome to apply.
  • Knowledge and relevant experience in one or more of the following areas:
  • Data visualisation tools such as Tableau OBIEE
  • ETL tools such as Informatica
  • Data modelling experience 
  • Knowledge in healthcare domain; or exposure to hospital information / clinical dashboard is an added advantage

Perform audits on recorded client interactions and provide evaluation feedback through QMS

Conduct regular 1:1 or group calibration to ensure evaluations are aligned based on business requirements.

Support the business in managing and implementing Quality Management standards and processes that are aligned with the global standard and relevant to the local market nuances

Highlight trends and red flags to the business for better improvements

Ensure accurate maintenance of sample calls/chats library

Provide a bi-weekly QA dashboard highlighting QA audits completion and QA trends to all stakeholders.

Requirement

Degree preferred or equivalent practical experience;

Minimum of 2 years Quality auditing experience in a call center environment

Has a clear understanding of Call Center’s quality framework and methodology.

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

Bilingual - Fluent in English and Vietnamese language. (speaking and writing)

Self-motivated entrepreneurial and comfortable dealing with ambiguity.

Ability to work in a fast pace environment.

Strong attention to detail.

Coaching experience is a plus

Knowledge of digital advertising is a plus

Experience in performing Root Cause Analysis/drilldown is a plus

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted

Job Summary

Gerson Lehrman Group is seeking a Associate / Senior Associate to support the GLG Southeast Asia Private Equity Client Solutions team in Singapore. The Associate / Senior Associate will help to drive GLG’s business model and develop the Private Equity client base through close coordination with senior members of the research team and working with clients to fulfil their primary research needs.

Specific Responsibilities Include (but Are Not Limited To)
  • Support the client facing team. The Associates / Senior Associates will provide project support to the client facing team who manage multiple projects on a day-to-day basis.
  • Facilitating educational interactions between GLG Council Members and our clients enable our clients to make more informed and confident investment decisions. The Senior Research Associate is tasked with fulfilling time sensitive research requests by analysing client requests and building and qualifying primary populations of topic experts. Most GLG client/expert interactions consist of telephone consultations but also may consist of surveys research travel programs and in-depth engagements.
  • Assist in the programming of live/virtual meetings. The Associate is responsible for supporting the client facing team organise and host small group conversations between GLG Council Members and GLG clients and programme private meetings for GLG Council Members at client offices.
  • Enhancing the GLG Councils. Developing relationships with GLG’s most respected thought leaders across sectors as well as recruiting new senior executives and leading consultants into the GLG Councils through research networking and direct outreach.
  • Working towards growing GLG client relationships. The Associate will be working towards gaining responsibility of developing relationships with GLG clients who are primarily leading investment professionals across APAC. This relationship development will stem from in-person client meetings project execution and telephone interactions.
  • Team-wide collaboration. The Associate is expected to work closely with our Sales and Business Development team and other research professionals to develop customized products for GLG clients.


An Ideal Candidate Will Have The Following

GLG attracts employees from the most distinctive professional and academic backgrounds. Across all of our positions we insist upon excellence integrity creativity and professionalism.
  • Bachelor’s degree or above
  • Excellent communication skills and fluency in English. Fluency in Business Mandarin is an added bonus
  • Curiosity about the financial markets including trends and white spaces
  • Able to write speak and present succinctly to deliver investment theses/ideas
  • Demonstrated performance and business judgment in some or all of the following areas:
  • Sales negotiation or networking with high-end professionals; and/or
  • Business development corporate development product development
  • Product and project management
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritise activities effectively while ensuring a high level of accuracy and attention to detail
  • 0 to 5 years of work experience in client-facing account management or analyst roles in relevant industries such as banking business services consultancies and financial services etc. plus significant ongoing curiosity about trends and personalities in the project-related sector


    • About GLG / Gerson Lehrman Group

    GLG is the world’s knowledge marketplace. Our clients rely on GLG’s global team to connect with powerful insight across fields from our network of 700000+ experts (and the hundreds of new experts we recruit every day).

    We serve thousands of the world’s best businesses from Fortune 500 corporations to leading technology companies to professional services firms and financial institutions. We connect our clients to the world’s largest and most varied source of first-hand expertise including executives scientists academics former public-sector leaders and the foremost subject matter specialists.

    GLG’s industry-leading compliance framework allows clients to learn in a structured auditable and transparent way consistent with their own internal compliance obligations and the highest professional ethical standards. Our compliance standards are a major competitive differentiator and key component of the company’s culture.

    To learn more visit www.GLG.it.

Job Summary

The Red Hat Asia Pacific (APAC) Finance team is looking for a Senior Compliance Analyst to join us in Singapore. In this role you will become part of the compliance program supporting South East Asia business by authenticating customer and order information. You’ll become part of a team that monitors sales and partners in order to ensure that they comply with Red Hat's business requirements and processes. You’ll perform evaluation of internal controls communications risk assessments reporting and maintenance of documentation related to compliance. As a Senior Compliance Analyst you’ll be required to assist and support the organization with initial compliance and ongoing preparation testing and monitoring of conformance to the requirements of the company’s compliance policy and guideline.

Primary Job Responsibilities
  • Obtain and document accurate end customer and order data by examining orders on a daily basis
  • Detect or prevent frauds in sales and partners from identified orders
  • Provide continued education and advice to the sales team regarding compliance requirement
  • Anticipate emerging issues through order validation findings and data analysis
  • Deliver regular validation result update and analysis report
  • Coordinate and communicate with various business units and a variety of stakeholders both internal and external in support of clean and robust business in the region
  • Additional validation tasks or responsibilities may be assigned when required

Required Skills
  • Excellent communication skills in Malay Filipino or Thai; business level communication skills in English
  • Demonstrated strong data tracking and analytical skills using Google sheets Tableau Salesforce.com reporting or Power BI
  • Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
  • Detail-oriented team-focused and result-oriented
  • Record of working with confidential data and adhering to high ethical standards
  • Compliance or audit background in the software industry is a plus

About Red Hat

Red Hat is the world’s leading provider of enterprise open source software solutions using a community-powered approach to deliver reliable and high-performing Linux hybrid cloud container and Kubernetes technologies. Red Hat helps customers integrate new and existing IT applications develop cloud-native applications standardize on our industry-leading operating system and automate secure and manage complex environments. Award-winning support training and consulting services make Red Hat a trusted adviser to the Fortune 500. As a strategic partner to cloud providers system integrators application vendors customers and open source communities Red Hat can help organizations prepare for the digital future.

The Strategic Account Director maintains and expands relationships with strategically important and large enterprises. Assigned to a number of named customers the strategic account director is responsible for achieving sales quota and assigned strategic account objectives as well as developing business within some white space accounts.

As an Associate Business Analyst the trainee will be part of a team to implement high value business solutions to our clients using our proprietary manpower planning products. Ultimately the trainee will be equipped with training and mentorship and be exposed to the entire life cycle of business solutions implementation. The trainee can look forward to supporting our wide arrays of projects with large enterprises across Singapore promising an unprecedented opportunity to learn and gain extensive experience.

Requirements

The trainee will be required to assist the Project Managers & Consultants on various end-to-end project implementation processes including
  • Gathering requirements - Understand analyse and document the clients' pain points problem statements and functional requirements
  • Customization - Work with client and WorkforceOptimizer technology teams to configure and personalize WorkforceOptimizer’s product suite to align with our clients' business requirements
  • Education & Training - Educate end-users on best practices for time and labour management by conducting customer training workshops
  • Testing & Review - Manage testing and deployment activities to obtain clients' feedback (e.g. user-acceptance testing)


Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science Information System Engineering or Business
  • Background in HR Payroll or Time & Attendance functional areas is an advantage
  • Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills to apply strong analytical abilities or instincts at the right times to make the right judgment call
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills an astute listener who can pick up subtle cues that others may fail to notice
  • Able to work independently and as a team able to support multiple clients concurrently able to multi-task and stay organized in a fast-paced environment


Eligibility Criteria for SGUnitedTraineeships
  • Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident; and
  • Graduated or graduating in calendar year 2019 or 2020 from ITEs polytechnics universities or other educational institutions (e.g. private universities and overseas institutions); OR
  • Graduated earlier from above institutions and completed National Service in 2019 or 2020.

Duration of Traineeship 9 months

  • IMPORTANT You will also be required to file an application on the My Careers Future portal https //www.mycareersfuture.gov.sg/job/consulting/associate-business-analyst-sgunitedtraineeships-workforce-optimizer-20af81ba1de375c767eed9175c942c99 (log-in required)

    Benefits

    Competencies Trainee will learn during SGUnited Traineeship Programme
    • Business Needs Analysis Gain understanding in typical requirements gathering processes business requirements and business requirement documentation. This is achieved through active participation in requirements gathering requirements analysis and documentation activities such as meetings and team discussions.
    • Solutioning gain understanding of technical consideration in product solutioning through active participation in translating business requirements into software configurations.

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation flights and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings our 4000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity creativity and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership enabling our customers to experience the world.

Get To Know Our Team

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts marketing strategists and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science product strategy and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data creative ideas and technology.

The Opportunity

We’re looking for Senior Manager Marketing Business Strategy and Innovation to scale and drive growth across multiple verticals. You will work directly with multiple stakeholders including executive leadership product leadership and data analyst teams.

In this role you will impact Agoda's business through exploring new opportunities identifying experiments analyzing complex scaling challenges and formulating structure and framework to existing operations. We’re looking for the future leaders who think critically test learn from mistakes and adapt quickly.

This position offers high visibility with senior management and with other departments within the company. This position is based in Bangkok Thailand.

In This Role You'll Get To
  • Drive business-level vision by providing strategic context to product roadmaps
  • Implement competitive analysis and develop actionable insights on our markets and business trends and disseminate this knowledge across Agoda to make key decisions
  • Set up operational processes and help our leaders run the business skillfully which includes clarifying accountability putting structure and framework as well as seeing through business-critical success metrics


What You'll Need To Succeed
  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative/numerical field; MBA or other advanced technical degree preferred
  • 5+ years' experience in top-tier management consulting investment banking private equity or strategy/business operations for a fast-growing globally operating tech company
  • Strong analytical abilities especially with respect to experimental design and analysis
  • Strategic thinking and planning hands-on mentality
  • Excellent skills in presenting and analyzing data and creating actionable reports
  • Experience in and a passion for projects involving big data and statistical models
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to report and persuade different levels including senior management

Description

Business Analysts (BA) at P&G are a specialist group belonging to the Analytics & Insight Department. BAs provides the expertise and deep understanding in data-driven analytics about consumer retailers and market understanding and insight.

The core work is to identify and activate growth opportunities for our brands at country/ trade channels/ and specific retailers levels. We identify these big insights through outstanding analytics based on data and advanced analytic & statistical tools. Our analytics are a combination of insight and foresight. Business Analyst is to deliver P&G business goals by using data and analytics to derive impactful consumer and business insights.

As a Business Analytics Intern
  • You will embed data analytics decisions into P&G's monthly business process based on both external data (e.g. market share and household consumption) and internal data (e.g. sales data)

  • Ability to query and analyze data on a big data environment

The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst will work with the team to develop a strong data driven marketplace environment to lead project growth and business decision making on a regional level.

Scope
  • Engage with local and regional teams to understand the business vision requirements & priorities and help to translate this into actionable insights
  • Develop accessible creative and engaging data visualization to facilitate access to insight
  • Connect Insights to business processes or results and flag abnormalities
  • Refine challenge and support requests from stakeholders and create new data analyses based on commonly defined specifications
  • Analyse trends in our data and providing insight and explanation to our local teams to improve their operations using data
  • Help identify define and specify future insight and data needs to support the different business units
  • Improve existing procedures; identify the needs for new procedures; train and advocate the team on quality improvements
  • Collaborate with other data analysts data engineers and product owners


Requirements
  • You gained 3-6 years experience as a BI/Data analyst working for internet companies ideally in an FMCG or eCommerce environment
  • Terms like Category Management SKUs CVR AFV GMV or user behaviour get you excited not frightened
  • You are keen to understand the business vision and help the global & local teams to make the best decisions based on your provided reports
  • You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Redshift or BigQuery for big data analyses
  • You have knowledge of different types of data visualization and being aware of how to use them best ideally via Looker or Tableau
  • You gained experience working with huge amount of unstructured & unclean data
  • You are passionate about data and their insights as well eager to deep dive into problems
  • You like to improve existing procedures to drive data quality and advocate others
  • Excited to learn and try out new things


Nice To Have
  • Familiar with a programming language such as Python

• Principle duties are collecting functional requirements from stakeholders and able to document and explain the requirements to IT team (developers and testers)
  • Facilitate requirements workshops to engage the various stakeholders such as Front Office Middle Office Finance users to elicit and validate business requirements.
  • Lead and manage issues during UAT/Sprints and ensure all requirements have proper traceability.
  • Leverage the subject matter experts in Technology & Operations in delivery of structured and well-thought through solutions.
  • Become an effective “bridge” between users and technology.
  • Good team player with strong interpersonal skills.
  • Respond promptly to issues raised through good understanding of business operational and technical considerations and recommend sound solutions.

Job Title: Regional Claims Business and Reporting Analyst
Job Description:
The position is primarily responsible for the reporting and analysis of Asia Pacific’s Claims key business metrics and financial performance across all lines of business. 
This position is also required to assist key regional stakeholders on ad-hoc reporting and analysis as well as preparation of presentation materials to senior management and provide business with relevant information/reports to support business decisions.
In addition this role will also provide Business Analysis to various ongoing projects and new initiatives.
This position works closely with country claims managers Regional product/functional heads and Regional Claims Management.

Reporting Analysis
• Prepare and distribute MAR (monthly activity reports) and Dashboards to Regional and Country claims managers.
• Prepare and distribute Quarterly reports for Senior Management.
• Ability to manage significant amounts of data across multiple data sources is a key success factor.
• Analyse trends and monitor business performance.
• Perform quality control on output produced to ensure accuracy of information.
• Design and build financial templates required for business reporting.
• Develop and create data layout like tables charts graphs heat maps and process flow diagrams where required.
• Provide support to local business analysts and act as a regional lead.
• Ensure reports are up-to date and accurate at all time
• Support Ad-hoc reporting required by regional and in country claims management.
• Work with COG to streamline reporting efforts and tools.
• Manage annual LOA (Letters of Authority)
updates and maintenance
• Gather across the Region External Vendor Monthly Spend collate clean and integrate it to the COG monthly report; support the development of a SQL data base.
• Work with all claims stakeholders across the Region to launch support and develop due diligence protocols and processes for external vendors.

Business Analysis
• Communicate with internal colleagues to understand the needs of departments and the organisation as a whole.
• Develop and maintain project documents like Business Requirement Documents process flows SOP’s etc.
• Document future business process.
• Participate in UAT cycles including preparing and executing test cases and resolving issues with technology;
• Develop end user training.
• Use data modelling practices to analyse your findings and create suggestions for strategic and operational. improvements and changes.
• Identify the processes and IT required to introduce recommendations.
• Communicate the benefits of recommendations across departments and help to address any uncertainty and concern.
• Produce written documentation to support your work report on your findings and to present to stakeholders when necessary.
• Assist and support ad hoc project needs and requirements

The Opportunity

  • Adecco is partnering our client a leading technology company
  • We are looking for a junior experienced Business Intelligence Analyst who is well versed in business management reporting & score-carding.
  • Office Location: Central

The Talent:

  • Bachelor’s Degree
  • Min 1-2 years of related working experience.
  • Previous experience in financial or business management reporting and score-carding.
  • Excellent technical skills communication organization and strong problem-solving skills with good attention for details
  • Possess good Excel skills preferably with PowerBI experience (Good to have)
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity and changing business requirements
  • Good time management and strong in following up
  • Team player with good interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Training will be provided for reporting how to build Power BI dashboard etc.
  • Great learning attitude

Job Description

Responsibilities

  • Work with Consulting Services business unit to define needs set expectations for delivery and execute on commitments.
  • Design implement and maintain scorecards standard reports and various workflows (from strategic and management view to tactical execution tracking)
  • Partner with internal teams on development and deployment of reporting for APJ Region as needed.
  • Analyze and troubleshoot existing processes and workflows and make necessary changes to optimize performance including automating the reporting process
  • Provide first level analysis and tracking on the various program rollout throughout the year

Next Step

  • Prepare your updated resume (please include your current salary package with full breakdown such as base incentives annual wage supplement etc.) and expected package
  • Simply click on 'Apply here' to drop your resume and contact us to follow-up or send your resume to corpstaffing@adecco.com!

All shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Job Description:
Job Purpose

You will be involved in Digital Projects as a Lead IT Business Analyst with BAU responsibility throughout the entire life-cycle of the conceptualization and implementation. As a Lead IT Business Analyst you will need to communicate with various stakeholders (Business and IT) to gather / validate requirements create / validate UI Mock-ups create / validate Interface Specifications and support testing through test scenario / case / data creation and reviews.

The role will engage with the regional delivery teams (SG MY and INDO) working to incorporate common governance and methodology standards into the treatment of BAU issues.

The Job
  • Work with various Business and IT stakeholders to create a detailed process analysis outlining problems opportunities and propose solutions to improve the process.
  • Gather and analyze user requirements prepare detailed functional specifications & related documents in compliance with organizational standards and procedures.
  • Competent ability with SQL - able to write functional queries and procedures.
  • Work with delivery team in system delivery and ensure all tasks assigned to the team meets the prescribed delivery schedule and quality.
  • To perform and support application / system testing including functional non-functional and interface tests spanning the entire testing life cycle from test management and strategy test planning test scenarios / case / data preparation test execution and problem resolution.
  • Support / execute activities for post application / system delivery maintenance.
  • Facilitate communication with all stakeholders to ensure deliverables are delivered.
  • Provide coaching and training to Users.
  • Working alongside the core project team looking at post go live / BAU issues and tickets
  • Working with/ managing our 3rd party providers who are resolver groups for project issues.
  • Prioritising and managing the BAU tickets and resolver group management process.
  • Reporting to the business on planned changes and outcomes.
  • Takes accountability in considering business and regulatory compliance risks and takes appropriate steps to mitigate the risks.
  • Maintains awareness of industry trends on regulatory compliance emerging threats and technologies in order to understand the risk and better safeguard the company.
  • Highlights any potential concerns /risks and proactively shares best risk management practices.
Our Requirements
  • Degree in Computer Science IT or related discipline.
  • Minimum 8 years’ of IT business analyst and BAU experience.
  • Must be a team player and able to work collaboratively with others.
  • Familiarity with project management approaches tools and phases of project SDLC and DevOps.
  • Experiences in ANY of the following areas will be more preferred:
  • SQL
  • Agile / Scrum/Jira
  • Tableau
  • Cloudera / Hadoop/Hive/spark
  • Experience of running BAU application service delivery teams.
  • Experience of managing 3rd party teams.
  • Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.
  • First-hand experience of using the Analytics system and an understanding of the issues the customers face.
  • Ability to prioritise tickets.
  • Confident using Jira.
  • Experience of operating within a large complex multi-site/ supplier environment and able to demonstrate delivery of a robust BAU approach.
  • A strong background in driving applications efficiency in an organisation of relevant size complexity and scale having implemented business change and improvement.
  • Able to work under pressure.
  • Proficiency in the ITIL principles methods techniques and tools.
  • Highly motivated flexible team player and manager with the ability to deliver in a timely and professional manner.
  • Customer focus driven with a commitment to "do the right thing"
  • Lead with positive intent.
  • Be a strategic thinker with a long term view.
  • Ability to communicate motivate and influence at all levels.
  • Ability to build effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders at multiple levels in a global regional and local team.
  • Ability to deal effectively with pressure.
  • Reliable for upward reporting and able to make rational decisions regarding the escalation of problems.
  • Hands-on sleeves-up approach.
  • High level of integrity takes accountability of work and good attitude over teamwork.
  • Takes initiative to improve current state of things and adaptable to embrace new changes.

Synechron supports clients by successfully translating business strategy into organisational design optimised business processes and technology solutions across the financial services value chain and business areas. We are always on the look-out for ambitious talent to add to our existing group of dedicated innovators experts thinkers and delivery experts. Our deep domain expertise within financial services and our primary focus on banking is a key differentiator for us in the market and makes us the consulting company of choice for a large number of top tier global financial institutions.

 

We offer a fast-paced dynamic work environment where self-starters who want to be a part of our growth journey as a leading consultancy firm in APAC will thrive. In line with our goal of becoming a leading global consultancy in the region we are rapidly expanding our APAC Business Consulting team and seeking professionals who are looking to take that next step in their career to join us on our journey.  

 

What will I do as a Financial Markets BA?

As part of the Synechron Business Consulting team you will work on a wide range of large-scale exciting projects for our clients. You will be an advocate for change a trusted Advisor Project Manager or Business Analyst able to engage with senior stakeholders to deliver end-to-end solutions. Working as a BA especially within Financial Markets can be both demanding and challenging with projects that vary in size type location and may require travel. Your ability to understand data extract value visualize and communicate it effectively is what will set you apart.


What skills and competencies do I need?

  • Experienced with regulatory reporting processes as well as an overview of data flow within systems.
  • Involvement with current MAS 610 requirements and basic accounting knowledge advantageous
  • Have the knowledge of the MAS reporting requirement for new MAS 610 reporting
  • Knows how to handle project complexity in terms of how stakeholder management systems conflict management analysis and execution.
  • Understand concepts such as static data industry codes data governance and control as well as financial reporting
  • Have worked in a finance department and understand basic reporting concepts
  • Experience working in team engagements to finalize new operating models and roadmaps for change across people process data and technology
  • Run requirements from head office regional office and local office to prepare specific data and processes IBOR Transition ranging from operations to Risk Legal Front Office Finance IT Business and ComplianceExtract process and prepare data for treatment by regional team to assess risks and opportunities in the transition including highlights of key dependencies and blocking points
  • Review processes bypasses challenges ahead and propose proxy approach
  • Adaptable to an evolving scope of tasks comfortable with uncertainty as well as changing global requirements
  • Both projects require a dynamic mindset which can shift between change manager / product owner / project manager / business analyst depending on the level of involvement in each workstream and/or project.
  • Leads by example change management best practice on initiatives driven by the workstreams
  • Lead requirements workshops to engage stakeholders such as Front Office users to gather and validate business requirements with proper traceability
  • Familiarity with AGILE methodologies


You’re also excellent at….

  • Getting the job done – You have an entrepreneurial mind set and are results-orientated
  • Being part of a team – You are a team player who enjoys working with customers and sharing knowledge with your colleagues
  • Going the extra mile – You’re ambitious and want to be the best in your field
  • Having fun! – You have excellent social skills with a positive attitude
  • Taking the lead – Proven leadership abilities and a desire to make an impact


What are the benefits?

  • Being part of an ambitious global company driven by a strong futuristic and client-centric vision with an entrepreneurial spirit by contributing to our mission
  • A people-orientated culture of excellence and compassion supported by focus on strong career development performance management and robust coaching and mentoring support processes
  • Support from and participation in Engagement groups such as Corporate and Social Responsibility (CSR) Women in Business LGBTQ and Wellness
  • A fun international environment coupled with an open-door culture

Description

Amazon.com has been rated one of the most admired companies in the US #1 most innovative and # 1 in Customer Service. Amazon’s technology business (AWS) has a history and tradition of leading the world in Web-related technologies and services. Now with Amazon Web Services (AWS) you have the chance to help individuals and businesses within the start-up community take their computing infrastructures and applications into the cloud.

The AWS Startup Business Development team is looking for a talented driven self-directed Business Analyst to join an organization that is responsible for driving adoption of the AWS platform by startups around the world. This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in a fast growing business and to provide significant value for customers building lean innovative new companies. Specifically this role will include defining building and scaling metrics and analytical insights that will measure the success and drive the day-to-day behavior for the AWS Startup BD team. You will work closely with members of the BD and Analytics teams to ensure we are capturing and surfacing the best data and information to make optimal business decisions. You’ll collaborate with engineers to build self-service reports and establish automated processes for large scale data analyses. Successful candidates will be analytical with business acumen and detail driven with excellent problem solving skills.

The ideal candidate will have a rock-solid background in data analysis including experience extracting and manipulating data using SQL leveraging advanced Excel features for data analysis and producing digestible business intelligence and actionable information. The candidate should also have strong communication and project management skills enabling them to work with key business stakeholders to understand requirements and shape analytical deliverables. He/she should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business product and technical challenges with the ability to work cross-organizationally. A keen sense of ownership drive and scrappiness is a must.


Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics Statistics Engineering Computer Science Economics Finance or related field
  • 7-10+ years of industry experience in data analysis.
  • Experience in SQL and manipulating large data sets in a database
  • Advanced proficiency in Excel (including VBA Pivot Tables array functions Power Pivots etc.)
Preferred Qualifications
  • Advanced proficiency in SQL ETL data modeling and working with “Big Data”
  • Computer programming experience in Python Ruby or Java
  • Experience using AWS analytical services (e.g. Redshift Data Pipeline EMR Machine Learning Kinesis)
  • Experience or familiarity with the startup ecosystem including dynamic of startups accelerators venture firms and more
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Excited to learn new technologies and analytical methodologies relating to business intelligence and data analysis
  • Strong communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills to translate ambiguous business requirements into complex analyses and actionable insights

Job Description:

Get to know our Team

The Grab Financials Group Data and Insights team is an established team responsible for growing business by use of data. We make an impact by converting data into information required for data driven decisions making. Our team is made up of data analytics business analytics and data engineers. If you are looking to make a difference in the lives of millions in SEA with Data and Insights then you should join our team!

Get to know the Role

We are looking for an Experienced Professional to drive insights and data team. We believe a successful candidate has a solid understanding of Data Driven Insights but if you believe you have what it takes then we’d love to hear from you either way.

Role also involves helping set up and execute small scale business experiments that provide insights on how the business can find ways of being more effective. This requires working closely with various teams within Grab (Product Data Engineering etc.) to understand data requirements identify and track key metrics and provide data driven insights that are tailored and relevant to market evolving needs .

Day-to-Day Activities

  • Design implement and maintain a world-class data reporting and insights framework across GFG.
  • Deliver elegant exec-ready dashboards and insights. Use advanced visualisation techniques to leverage facts into initiatives to support the business.
  • Get things done across multiple analytics stakeholders within the group to ensure accurate data collection processing storage and maintenance.
  • Support business operational reporting needs such as case management insights as well as workforce management and planning processes.
  • Develop reporting toolkits and dashboards for Grab Financial Groups to optimize campaign performance across digital and offline channels
  • Understand business requirements and work on objectives in order to conduct in-depth analysis on relevant customer data sets and propose actionable recommendations. The recommendations should provide strategic business insight and support the business in their decision making and planning process.
The Must Haves


  • You have the Heart Hunger Honour and Humility required to work at Grab
  • At Least 5 years experience in Data Analytics/Business Intelligence
  • Solid experience in reporting to CEO / directors in delivering analyses and reports
  • Extensive expertise in data modeling both logical and physical
  • Extensive expertise in at least one data reporting tool (e.g. Tableau PowerBI QlikView Looker Microstrategy)
  • A solid understanding of key BI trends
  • Expertise in data retrieval data modeling data warehouse design and predictive modeling
  • Excellent English language skills able to communicate effectively and persuasively across a diverse set of stakeholders
  • Comfortable in dealing with ambiguity and operating in a fast-changing unstructured environment
  • Payments and FinTech experience (e.g card schemes PSPs acquirers APMs) is a strong advantage

About Standard Chartered

We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia Africa and the Middle East.

To us good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise Here for good.

We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.

The Role Responsibilities

CIB ITO is a world class technology group in Standard Chartered bank providing both technical and operational process solutions to support the bank's Financial Markets business. We bring a deep understanding of the market a scientific approach and innovative technologies to bear on the challenges of profitable trading in the world's highly competitive environment. This is a rare opportunity to get into an organization working with smart great technologists globally in the financial markets domain. The culture in CIB ITO is open intellectual and fun. Learning opportunities are plentiful: organized classes and seminars; freewheeling discussions; intensive one-on-one mentorships. Career advancement is always waiting for those highly-energized talents to pursue.

As a Business Analyst you will be involved in projects enhancements bug fixes and second line support activities working in a dynamic global team with software engineers project managers business stakeholders Operational partners and other technical experts globally.
  • Interact with the users to gather core business requirements and or assist with the support of both UAT/DR. This includes the documentation of the requirements for socialization to the relevant parties.
  • Design smart and scalable solutions following the banks development standards with a view of Front to Back solutions where industrialization of processes and maximization of STP is paramount where possible.
  • Creation of Business Requirement Documentation and Functional Specifications following the banks internal standards.
  • Coordinate with other teams within GTO Engineering and Global Technology Operations as well as the respective counterparts on the business side providing strong support from the position of a partner.
  • Be an active part of the Analyst community within Standard Chartered and contribute to the progression of standards within the bank.
  • Take a leadership role within the team from an analysis perspective and be the reference point for analysis processes and standards.
  • Provide 2 nd line support and business analysis services to Front Office and Operations staff looking at and resolving application issues from a development and solution perspective.
  • Provide accurate status updates to Senior Management and engage all relevant stakeholders in partnership.

Our Ideal Candidate
  • Minimum 4 years hands on experience in relevant business domain and market products
  • Experience of capturing requirements and liaising directly with senior business stakeholders
  • Played a leading/major role on design and implementation of large scale complex system development such as Bloomberg Trading System (BTS TOMS) or similar trading platforms in the Fixed Income domain - highly recommended
  • Fixed Income Front Office exposure required (Product Knowledge Pricing Trading Trade Capture settlements).
  • Repo trading - Product Knowledge Trade booking SBL Tri-party trades using Martini or similar Repo platforms.
  • Trade and Settlement life cycle knowledge
  • Understanding of the clearing lifecycle with Asian and European CCP's (LCH and SGX) for both House and client flows.
  • Middle and Back office processes (trade validation fixing settlements accounting confirmation clearing)
  • The ability to document clear and precise business requirements and be able to marry this to the appropriate technology solution and present this for approval to senior technology counterparts.
  • Development Estimates and Resource Planning (inclusive of time management and budget ownership for development assignments)
  • Should be well versed with excel / can create macros.
  • Motivated passionate about technology and the Financial Markets
  • Proactive self starter autonomous good analytical skills
  • Good team spirit
  • Strong level of Oral and Written communication

Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.

Application Support Analyst (L1)

JLLT Digital Solutions

Job Summary

What this job involves-

The Application Support Analyst applies customer support skills in addition to business and technical knowledge to triage diagnose troubleshoot and escalate or resolve customer application issues and ensure excellent customer service. The Application Support Analyst provides “Level 1” technical support for the client organization's internal applications. The Application Support Analyst will assist the Application Support Lead in developing and ensuring adherence to Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and implementing best practices for achieving support objectives. The Application Support Analyst will ensure that the Support Organization maintains a strong and trusted relationship with JLL colleagues and clients.

Application and Customer Support
Reporting to the Application Support Lead (L2) your primary responsible is to research and resolve end user IT application service requests and incidents within defined service levels and ensure escalations are handled appropriately. The role involves improving quality of solutions delivered in order to reduce customer demand for user support services implementing service and process improvements and maintaining customer satisfaction.

Relationship Management
To succeed in this role you’ll need to develop and maintain relationship with internal clients globally regional and global IT teams in various IT functional areas including; technology service center development infrastructure training adoption and transition teams as necessary. You’ll be expected to coordinate with internal and outsourced service management functions on service issues and problem management and efficiently communicate challenges and successes to management.

Product Expertise
You will learn applications from both a functional and technical perspective to resolve basic technical problems. You are responsible for the proper utilization of the help desk ticketing management system to track and document identified service requests as well as strengthening and enhancing support capabilities by developing knowledge skills through feedback training and other opportunities.

Sounds like you? To apply you need to be-
We are looking for someone with 1-2 years of relevant experience and/or an Associate’s Degree. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills excellent communication and customer service skills self-motivated; able to set priorities and work independently and strong technical skills with the ability to learn new applications quickly. You are required to be proficient in the use of Microsoft Office Suite and other JLL systems. An ideal candidate should have experience implementing supporting or using enterprise CAFM/CMMS/IWMS applications; using help desk service management applications; using or supporting CAD systems. Familiarity with basic accounting SQL and relational and object-oriented databases a plus. IBM TRIRIGA Certified Application Developer or other IBM TRIRIGA Certifications a plus.

What We Can Do For You-

Job Title: Retail Credit BD - Business Analyst (Portfolio Management)
Job Description:
Responsibilities
  • Responsible for credit product management; design financial features such as pricing repayment plan revolving credit and so forth
  • Manage P&L for credit products analyze data and recommend improvement areas work with cross-functional teams to rollout improvement plans
  • Strategize portfolio segmentation and optimize portfolio profitability while achieving business scale goals

Requirements
  • A degree from a worldly recognized university with good academic credentials
  • 2-8 years of work experience required preferably in areas of consumer/digital lending or similar retail financial products
  • Builder mindset solid customer management experiences with reputable consulting firms internet fintech banking or financial institutions
  • Strong data analytics skill is a must-to-have
  • Ability to develop good work relationships within and outside the company

  • Excellent communication skills able to communicate clearly and concisely
  • Ability to demonstrate a high level of verbal and written English and another Asian language (Mandarin Bahasa Indonesia Malay Thai Vietnamese Tagalog)

An exciting T24 Business Analyst (12-month contract) job opportunity has become available at a leading financial services company in Singapore.

About The T24 Business Analyst (12-month Contract) Role

This role sits in the Wealth Management Core Banking Technology department and allows the successful candidate to work closely with technology teams across the business.

Key Responsibilities
  • Proactively collaborate and work with stakeholders to lead the effort of understanding business requirements and business processes translating them into specifications that accurately reflect the business use cases whilst relating them to TEMENOS T24’s product capabilities
  • Functional analysis of various requirements in the Wealth Management domain including Client Reporting and various Asset Classes
  • Write specifications (BRDs and/or FSDs) create process models/diagrams/charts to ensure that the development teams have a clear understanding of these requirements
  • Lead and drive the implementation of the requirements with a focus on leveraging the T24 core product (out-of-the-box) functionality over customisation
  • Participate in high-level technical design/implementation discussion to ensure that the requirements are transformed into effective solutions adhering to the firms standards guidelines and policies and leverage the T24 core product (out-of-the-box) functionality
  • Conduct workshops prepare and deliver presentations to demonstrate the product’s capabilities to meet the specific project needs
  • Identify and validate any gaps together with proposals for their resolution (e.g. workarounds or changes in processes) and ensure any solutions proposed are realistic and within the agreed scope of the project
  • Provide support to project teams to ensure that any tactical solutions are lean and will be able to be replaced with preferred strategic architecture in the future
  • Support the Project/Program Manager and PMO team in tracking functional activities and deliverables including requirements specifications and test design and execution
  • Facilitate and participate in quality peer reviews of requirements artefacts to ensure they are consistent comprehensive feasible and confirm to standards

To succeed in this T24 Business Analyst (12-month contract) role you will need strong business analysis experience in T24.

Key Requirements
  • Bachelor's or master's degree in technology or business disciplines
  • Very strong business analysis skills with Core Banking functional expertise possessing significant work experience in commercial software engineering and an in-depth product knowledge of Temenos T24
  • At least eight years of T24 experience including proven experience (minimum of five years) in business analysis with solution delivery experience in the Private Banking/Wealth Management domain
  • Experience/exposure to European Banking is a significant advantage
  • Proven ability to work well in delivering complex systems in a fast-paced changing environment
  • Real passion for and experience of Agile working practices like Scrum with a strong desire to work with baked-in quality disciplines such as TDD BDD Test Automation and DevOps principles
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills with strong trouble-shooting and problem-solving abilities and should be able to manage communication with business and technology stakeholders to drive outcomes

This organisation needs no introduction and is recognised as a key leader within the financial services field. The culture is demanding but if you are confident and have a can-do attitude the potential rewards are significant. The business is also very focused on developing and training their people to the highest standards.

If you are driven determined and want to take the next step in your career this is the role for you. Great career progression opportunities await the right person in this exciting T24 Business Analyst (12-month contract) job in Singapore.

Apply now to learn more.

Do note that we will only be in touch if your application is shortlisted.

Job Title: Vice President| Functional Business Analyst - Cash| Group Technology and Operations
Job Description:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific Europe and North America. In Asia we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China Indonesia Malaysia and Thailand as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time we have been guided by our values — Honorable Enterprising United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right build for the future work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work consistently be it towards the company our colleagues or our customers.

About The Department

The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership technology operations risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.

Job Responsibilities

Requirements Analysis & Elicitation
  • Collaborate with BU Specialists to elicit and review business requirements
  • Analyse and document the "to be" business and operations processes based on the agreed requirements and / or function points perform impact assessment
  • Responsible to analyse and define detailed functional and non-functional requirements based on business requirements
  • Monitor and manage risks /issues related to requirements and scope creep
  • Write business functional release notes and contribute to deployment plan
  • Team Collaboration
  • Transition functional and non-functional requirements to System Analysts and ensure a clear and complete understanding of the requirements
  • Work with Test Manager to translate business requirements into test scenarios
  • Facilitate / provide "Train the Trainer" on application enhancements
  • Maintain up to date knowledge base related to application features and processes (subject matter expertise)
  • Testing & Scope Management
  • Clarify test findings escalated by Test Manager and classify the findings accordingly (either as a defect or change request)
  • Perform impact assessment and estimation for Project
  • Change Request
Job Requirements

Business Domain: Cash and Payments.

Technical Skills & Experience
  • Strong business domain knowledge in banking
  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering/ business/ finance or equivalent
  • Strong quantitative analytical problem solving and process design skills that can translate analysis into solutions that meet business objectives
  • Understanding of technology and operational processes across functions / departments in the bank/market.
  • Resourceful team player
  • Familiar with change management processes and project management fundamentals
  • Strategic forward thinking approach to challenges with outstanding communications influencing negotiating and persuasion skills
  • Passionate diligent and resilient individual with ability to thrive in ambiguity
  • Experience in scoping and evaluation – Defining overall considerations including scalability maintainability cost operations and technology principal risk to provide a recommendation
  • Minimum 10 years of relevant banking and/or consulting experience
Be a part of UOB Family

UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age race gender color religion sexual orientation physical or mental disability or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process please inform us when you submit your online application.

Apply now and make a difference.

The Business Solutions Analyst will work closely with the various functions such as supply chain retail finance and manufacturing in Eu Yan Sang (“EYS”) to understand their processes and requirements design and deliver solutions that drive rationalization optimize efficiency and maximize cost effectiveness.

 

This is a regional role that entails defining the solutions to be used across EYS functions and subsidiaries. He/she will also need to work closely with other IT teams on system integration security governance compliance and DRP/BCP.


KEY ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

 

Essential duties and responsibilities include the following:

 

  • Business solutioning and delivery
  • Understand the Company’s business priorities requirements structure and processes in order to define scope for solutions.
  • Monitor and report project progress and initiates corrective action as appropriate to ensure that deliverables are on time and within budget.
  • Oversee testing and system integration for applications
  • Ensure knowledge transfer to the local support team is completed upon implementation.

 

Application management and governance


  • Identify and plan change management activities to implement approved new or alternative business processes.
  • Provide support for corporate applications minimizing outages and disruption to business operations.
  • Ensure adequate and timely support to resolve system issues/bugs.
  • Establish governance and processes to manage change requests.
  • Facilitate periodic end user training as necessary.

 

Vendor Management


  • Ensure the quality of vendor support is maintained over time through regular vendor assessments and evaluations.
  • Manage vendors to ensure project deliverables are completed in timely manner.


EDUCATION

 

  • Degree holder in Computer Science Information Technology or equivalent discipline.
  • Professional certifications (PMP ITIL Lean Agile etc.) could be an advantage.

 

SKILLS KNOWLEDGE AND RELEVANT EXPERIENCE


  • At least 4 years of experience in IT with 3 years of business analysis in finance retail or supply chain.
  • Experience in multi-vendor management in an outsourced environment.
  • Experience in ERP and CRM (Microsoft Dynamics NAV is an added advantage
  • Customer-oriented with strong analytical communication and problem solving skills.
  • Experience in the retail or manufacturing industry is a plus.
  • Experience in IT transformation and change management is an advantage.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Able to multitask and manage conflicting priorities.
  • Positive attitude and willingness to learn.

Who is Thermo Fisher Scientific?

When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific you’ll do important work. Surrounded by collaborative colleagues you’ll have the support and opportunities that only a global leader can give you. Our respected growing organization has an exceptional strategy for the near term and beyond. Take your place on our strong team and help us make significant contributions to the world.


Reports to: Senior Manager IT

Location: Marsiling Singapore (5-10 mins walk from Woodlands MRT / bus interchange)

Office hours: Mon-Fri 830am-530pm


Position Summary:

This is a client facing role for JD Edwards / Oracle Enterprise One (E1) Quote to Cash Projects and Regional support. Overall the candidate will be responsible for the end to end Lifecycle of deployment activities like Business requirement Analysis and facilitation configuration testing cutover and go-live planning. The Primary technology focus will be on Oracle E1 and linkages of the quote to cash process from SalesForce.com SAP and Agile for Item creation.

The role will challenge you to manage and prioritize multiple initiatives like Quote to Cash standardization projects in the region managing Business Demand and enhancements in the ERP for changing business scenario’s and requirements.

The role will require the candidate to possess strong communication skills and the ability to work with the APAC regional Business users IT and Global IT teams.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Analyze business needs and suggest system improvements
  • Collect business requirement
  • System configuration and development to meet the business requirement
  • Prepare functional specifications for development configuration and testing
  • Validate and test configuration
  • Support user testing and data migration
  • Train the users and provide go-live support
  • Respond to and address user requests via ticketing process
  • Work closely and communicate with the global team in the USA
  • Comply with company’s Global IT Policies and Procedures
  • Perform other duties as assigned



Requirements/Qualifications:

  • Bachelor of Science or similar qualification and/or relevant experience training and proven delivery capability.
  • Must have JDE/Oracle E1 Quote to Cash experience of minimum 4-7 years which should include implementation support design training and configuration
  • Must have experience with a major ERP platform such as Oracle E1 – strongly required and/or SAP ECC6 – desired.
  • Experience in regional user co-ordination working with Global IT teams on initiatives impacting the region is required.
  • Experience with SalesForce.com Oracle Siebel Oracle Agile IBM Cognos Web Methods MS Fast Search Day Content Management Comergent commerce TRAX PPS credit card processing EDI and use of SQL would be a plus
  • Having experience in mapping "as-is" to "to-be" and able to perform gap analysis is a plus.
  • Hands on experience in Design & Configuration and support for Oracle E1.
  • Experience in component testing integration testing and user acceptance testing.
  • Positive attitude towards problem solving and working in teams
  • We are looking for a team player who can plan and manage communication across different teams and client. He/She should also be able to provide business process and Oracle E1/SAP expertise and guidance on complex processes.
  • Experience in maintaining managing global templates.
  • Experience in higher end mobility environment would be beneficial but not must.
  • Excellent Written as well as Oral Communication Skills
  • English speaking is a must.



At Thermo Fisher Scientific each one of our 60000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier cleaner and safer. Apply today http://jobs.thermofisher.com

Job Title: AI/ML - Annotation Quality Analyst - Mandarin language
Job Description:
Summary
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products services and customer experiences very quickly. The people here at Apple donʼt just craft products - they build the kind of wonder thatʼs revolutionized entire industries. Itʼs the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple and help us leave the world better than we found it.


Are you interested in being part of a team that continues to innovate the way people and machines interact? The launch of Siri was a defining moment in the history of Artificial Intelligence. Siri offers a faster easier way to get things done on your Apple devices even before you ask. Millions of people now use Siri to send a message play their favorite song or even take a selfie. The AI/ML Annotation team is passionate about technology with a focus on enriching the Siri customer experience. We are looking for a motivated Annotation Quality Analyst that demonstrates critical thinking integrity and acute attention to detail. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.


Key Qualifications
Experience in content quality review or a similar environment

Excellent Mandarin Simplified and Traditional Chinese reading writing and comprehension skills including grammar and proofreading

Fluency (verbal and written) in English

Excellent judgment and integrity with the ability to make decisions in a fast paced environment

Effective time management including the ability to organize prioritize and manage a heavy workload independently while achieving exceptional quality in a dynamic environment

Ability to track analyze and provide accurate reporting

Data analytics experience highly desirable

Knowledge of one or more of the following: iOS PC or Mac experience and Siri preferred


Description
As part of the AI/ML Annotation team you’ll play a central role in enhancing the Siri customer experience. You’ll work in a fast paced dynamic technology focused environment. You’ll review the Annotation Analyst evaluations from customers who have opted-in to the grading program and provide quality feedback. You’ll use your analytical skills to track and report trends. You’ll collaborate with team members and share ideas for business improvements. Because we believe our individual backgrounds perspectives and passions help us build the ideas that move all of us forward. This position comes with competitive pay great benefits eligibility to participate in our company stock plan time off and employee discount.
