- Knowledge of CRM (e.g. Peoplesoft) and ERP (e.g. SAP) systems deployed in the consumer electronics industry (preferred).


- Experience and familiarity with Apple's products is preferred

Job Title: VP / AVP| Technical Business Analyst - Finance Platform| Middle Office Technology| Technology and Operations
Job Description:
Business Function

Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity quality & control technology people capability and innovation. In Group T&O we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.

Responsibilities

You will lead a team of 2-3 Business Analysts and work with business users to understand their requirements and translate them into functional requirements in form of user stories. You will gather requirements to ensure Tech team understand users’ expectation and build IT solution accordingly; and ensure development are as per functional solution with regular reviews and via QA process.
  • Validate user stories to ensure functional requirement/story meet overall business requirement(s).
  • Participate in User Acceptance process as a guide to users
  • Act as liaison between business team and offshore/onshore development and QA team.
  • Identify and analyse user requirements and assign to development team.
  • Provide technical insight into feasibility analysis and execute proof of concepts.
  • Provide technical leadership mentor direct and train application development team.
  • Prepare technical design options consult with hardware and software technicians on options and strategies.
  • Prioritize assign and execute tasks throughout the software development life cycle and ensure applications are secure and up to date.
  • Design and write code and document the development phases.
  • Support Scrum Master/Product Owner in managing customer expectations for project deliverables manage stakeholder communications and support implementation.
  • Formulate design and develop software solutions based on business requirements and application roadmap in alignment with architectural direction and standards.
  • Ensure all designs are performant scalable resilient and align to appropriate recoverability pattern.
  • Collaborate with PM BA QA and cross-functional teams to resolve technical issues.
  • Participate in daily stand-up calls with scrum team discuss open issues statuses and roll out action items.
  • Provide functional expertise to generate test data.
  • Ensure that relevant project documentation confluence pages are up to date with latest information.

Requirements
  • Master or bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field with 12-15 years of experience as a Business/System Analyst preferably from a banking domain.
  • Good understanding of Finance domain – MIS/Financial Reporting Cost Allocation Fund Transfer Pricing Customer Profitability. Knowledge on other sub-domain like Reg Reporting Capital Management etc. will be a plus
  • Curious business mindset with an ability to condense complex concepts and analysis into clear and concise takeaways that drive action.
  • Strong proficiency with SQL-based languages. Experience with Bid Data technologies such as Hadoop and Spark will be added advantage.
  • Good communication social and presentation skills with meticulous attention to detail.
  • Strong time management skills with the ability to handle work to tight deadlines and the pressure of executive requests
  • Experience working in cross-functional and regional teams
  • Familiarity with agile processes and tools (JIRA & Confluence)

Our client a leading Singapore based banks has undertaken journey to migrate existing legacy data warehouse to a new system that can support future enhanced data requirement for internal and regulatory reporting. The project is remapping of Bank's existing Moody's RiskAuthority (RAY) capital calculation engine to new data warehouse system to support Basel II/Basel III Regulatory Reporting at present and Basel IV reporting in future.

    • Experience in SQL MS PowerPoint Excel and Word

How To Succeed

  • Results and customer oriented team player with strong organization and people handling skills
  • Resourceful curious and motivated self-starter
  • Excellent communication skills both oral and written with the ability to pitch ideas and influence stakeholders

About The Company

My client is an international leader providing integrated and comprehensive wealth management solutions for financial institutions and they are one of the largest independent financial solutions provider in the world. They are currently operating across US Europe Asia and works with the most reputable retail investment private banks in the world. They are now expanding and you would now have the chance to join this exciting and challenging role as a Business Analyst (Avaloq).

Job Title: Vice President| Functional Business Analyst - Asset Management| Group technology and Operations
Job Description:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific Europe and North America. In Asia we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China Indonesia Malaysia and Thailand as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time we have been guided by our values — Honorable Enterprising United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right build for the future work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work consistently be it towards the company our colleagues or our customers.

About The Department

The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership technology operations risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.

 Requirements Analysis & Elicitation

Testing & Scope Management
  • Clarify test findings escalated by Test Manager and classify the findings accordingly (either as a defect or change request)
  • Perform impact assessment and estimation for Project Change Request


Job Requirements

 Requirements:
  • Strong business domain knowledge in banking Minimum 12 years of relevant banking and/or consulting experience

  • Strong quantitative analytical problem solving and process design skills that can translate analysis into solutions that meet business objectives

  • Resourceful team player

Reporting to the Lead of Advanced Analytics this role is responsible to ensure the successful delivery of group wide advanced analytics initiatives. These initiatives typically include the application of advanced analytics models on structured semi structured and unstructured data to derive business insights with a potential to drive business performance.

The Lead Analyst is expected to work closely with key stakeholders and possess the relevant technical skills required to implement analytics solutions that enable the use of data as a strategic asset.

The Job

  • Experience in Insurance or Financial Services is a plus.
  • High level of integrity takes accountability of work and good attitude over teamwork.
  • Takes initiative to improve current state of things and adaptable to embrace new changes.

Job Title: CIB F&BM – Relationship Partner – Global Corporate Bank - Associate
Job Description:
Department Description
 
The Corporate Investment Bank Relationship Partner  team plays a critical role in ensuring that as an organization we are compliant with multiple regulations in order to protect the bank’s reputation and ﬁnancial assets.
 
The Relationship Partner team operates in close partnership with Bankers Operations Credit Legal and Compliance to provide eﬃcient and timely on-boarding of new/existing client relationships to the JP Morgan infrastructure.
 
Job Summary
 
The Relationship Partner will be responsible for managing the Front Office relationship for business requests in KYC Onboarding Remediation and Renewals. The Analyst /Associate will be required to facilitate the end to end client onboarding process ensuring all due diligence documentation is sourced and delivered to the Wholesale Client Onboarding team to incorporate into the KYC platform.
 
Key Responsibilities:
- Manage new business requests received from the Front Office and facilitate the KYC process end to end
- Act as an SME and Due Diligence expert to guide clients through the KYC requirements and variation of documents which may fulfil due diligence requirements
- Conduct in-depth analysis on the ownership structure of the client on publicly available sources (not limited to company registries) or client documentation and seek additional confirmation or approvals as required
- Work closely with the Front Oﬃce and potentially direct with clients as required to obtain all necessary supporting evidence to full KYC due diligence
- Follow up with Client Onboarding teams to ensure onboarding is completed within agreed timeframes
- Liaise regularly with the business to conduct workload planning review status of key onboardings and prioritize open requests
- Frequently interact with key stakeholders such as Legal Compliance Credit and Operations to develop strong partnerships eliminate roadblocks and ensure continuity of information ﬂow across the groups
- Assist Relationship Managers with overnight screening client exits and any other KYC related tasks as required
- Manage personal workload and priority items and ensure timely escalation of key risks/issues to management
- Keep informed of any changes to processes and procedures regulatory change and ensure open verbal dialogue with colleagues across the region
- Identify and execute process improvements provide guidance and support on key process and technology initiatives to the business
 
 
Qualifications
 
Qualifications and Skills Required
- At least 3 years of working knowledge of KYC/Compliance/AML procedures and standards in the banking industry
- Knowledge of multiple client types (i.e. Corporates Special Purpose Vehicle Trust Financial Institutions etc.)
- At least 3 years of working knowledge of ﬁnancial industry with in-depth expertise in various lines of business (Corporate Investment Bank and heritage lines of business)
- Strong verbal and written communication skills
- Strong time management organizational relationship building skills
- Quality client focus strong controls mind-set and strong customer service skills(e.g. oral and written communication skills)
- Prior experience of adhering to controls and compliance standards
- Ability to grasp/learn concepts and procedures quickly
- B.S. Degree or equivalent

Job Title: 2021 Mastercard Launch| Associate Analyst| Account Management - Citi
Job Description:
Our Purpose

We work to connect and power an inclusive digital economy that benefits everyone everywhere by making transactions safe simple smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks partnerships and passion our innovations and solutions help individuals financial institutions governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient or DQ drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths views and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions drives innovation and delivers better business results.

Job Title

2021 Mastercard Launch Associate Analyst Account Management - Citi

Who is Mastercard?
We are the global technology company behind the world’s fastest payments processing network. We are a vehicle for commerce a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded a technology innovation lab and the home of Priceless®. We ensure every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe as our company grows so should you. We believe in connecting everyone to endless priceless possibilities.

The Mastercard Launch program is aimed at early career talent to help you develop skills and gain cross-functional work experience. Over a period of 18 months Launch participants will be assigned to a business unit learn and develop skills and gain valuable on the job experience. Successful candidates will be assigned to a business unit within International Markets and rotate for a duration of 2 x 9 months each for a total of 18 months.

Role

Account Management – Global Account
  • This role is responsible for supporting activity within the selected customer group supporting initiatives and executing the strategy for each customer and coordinating resources.
  • Partner cooperatively in a team environment to support evolution of a wide array of programs across Mastercard business.
  • Develop strong relationships across levels and functions (particularly product portfolio/usage fraud marketing operations strategy and information technology) to influence or change customer preference towards Mastercard as a strategic partner and solution provider.
  • Interface with customers both internal and external to effectively communicate and educate on program rules procedures and best practices.
  • Support larger team functions related to ensuring customer compliance with Mastercard standards.
  • Will work with analytic insights and tools to facilitate compliance investigative and reporting initiatives.
  • Perform project management duties creating and documenting processes developing timelines managing compliance cases supporting risk mitigation for our third parties.
  • Communicate across key stakeholders to out into place action plans to address vulnerabilities and weaknesses.
  • Perform desktop research to identify regional or global trends and develop key performance metrics and reporting.
  • Assist with ad hoc requests participate in special projects as required and provide cross-functional support as needed.
Education

All about you:
  • Graduating seniors - Class of 2021
  • Students pursuing a Masters/bachelor’s degree (all majors welcome to apply)
Key Competencies
  • Analytical investigative and problem-solving skills.
  • Strategic thinker with ability to derive and translate data analytics to meet business goals.
  • Sound written and verbal communication skills.
  • Project management skills highly organized with strong attention to detail.
  • Ability to work independently in developing and mapping out solutions.
  • Able to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment handle multiple tasks consistently meet established deadlines and deliver exceptional results.
  • Expert skills including proficiency in Microsoft Excel Word PowerPoint and Access; programming and coding ability a plus.
  • Experience with Tableau Domo or other comparable business intelligence tools.
  • Understanding of risk management disciplines.
Languages
  • English required
  • Additional languages a plus

Our Ideal Candidate

  • Experience maintaining confidentiality without creating barriers to success in a fast-paced intellectually demanding and service-oriented environment

Project Description

Our client a leading Singapore based banks has undertaken journey to migrate existing legacy data warehouse to a new system that can support future enhanced data requirement for internal and regulatory reporting. The project is remapping of Bank's existing Moody's RiskAuthority (RAY) capital calculation engine to new data warehouse system to support Basel II/Basel III Regulatory Reporting at present and Basel IV reporting in future.

Responsibilities

    1) Work with technology vendor and business change teams to gain an in depth understanding of the end-to-end system implementation architecture and credit risk business process
    2) Work closely and collaboratively with development and partner engineering teams.
    3) Document and present systems solution design/data flow/process flow and architecture
    4) Create Source System to target system data mappings
    5) Prepare detailed component functional specifications/data mapping documents in line with bank standards.
    6) Conduct impact analysis and create solutions managing technology impact and clearly document and raise assumptions/risks.
    7) Provide support and guidance across all phases of the project lifecycle including assistance defining test strategy/plans data migration strategy release planning etc.
    8) Support release implementations weekends when necessary.
    9) Assist with urgent ad-hoc business requirements that may arise.
    10) Build relationships with key stakeholders both business and technology. Timely and clear communications to management.

Skills

Must have

    1) Data Analyst with at least 5 years of experience working on Basel II/Basel III Credit Risk calculation/Reporting projects
    2) Have functional/project experience in working with Moodys RAY(RiskAuthority) /FERMAT CR Solution
    3) Good understanding of various credit risk metrics such as PDLGDEADRWA etc
    4) Good understanding of various RWA calculation approaches A-IRBF-IRB Standardized method
    5) Ability to write medium to high complexity SQL queries for data analysis/data mapping
    6) Experience as a business analyst preparing business requirement document (BRD) functional requirement (FRD/FSD)data mapping documents user test strategy and test cases
    7) Experience with system related work and good knowledge of project planning and implementation including requirement gathering system testing and end-user maintenance
    8) Experience in SQL MS PowerPoint Excel and Word
    9) Participate in User Acceptance Testing and facilitate user testing. Document and provide training to end users with regards to process and systems changes.
    10) Team player with strong interpersonal skills and initiative excellent communication skills critical thinking.Ability to deal with all level of stakeholders.

Nice to have

    1) CFA/FRM/PRM
    2) Experience with BI tools like Tableau/Qlikview/OBIEE/Power BI etc
    3) Experience with other risk management solutions (e..g. OFSAA FIS AXIOM etc)
    4) Basel IV Implementation experience

Languages

English: C2 Proficient

About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific Europe and North America. In Asia we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China Indonesia Malaysia and Thailand as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time we have been guided by our values — Honorable Enterprising United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right build for the future work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work consistently be it towards the company our colleagues or our customers.

About The Department

The Global Market function leverages our in-depth knowledge of markets to provide timely financial advice products and solutions to our clients. Together with our segment managers we manage our clients’ investment liability and risk management needs through a comprehensive suite of treasury products and services across multiple asset classes.

Job Responsibilities

  • Process documentation
  • Products under support includes Foreign Exchange Money Market and Interest Rate derivatives


Job Requirements
  • A Bachelor or Master degree in Applied Finance Computational Finance Computer Science Technology and relevant discipline from reputable institutions
  • A minimum of at least 2 years’ work experience in front office support or middle office role
  • Knowledge of Treasury products in particular FX FX Derivatives IR Derivatives and money market products

Job Purpose

 Reporting to the Lead of Advanced Analytics this role is responsible to ensure the successful delivery of group wide advanced analytics initiatives. These initiatives typically include the application of advanced analytics models on structured semi structured and unstructured data to derive business insights with a potential to drive business performance.

The Lead Analyst is expected to work closely with key stakeholders and possess the relevant technical skills required to implement analytics solutions that enable the use of data as a strategic asset.

The Job

 • Participate in the build of group wide advanced analytics capabilities with a focus on organizing analysing and interpreting data to uncover patterns and trends and establishing how these findings can help increase business value through making better informed decisions.
• Work closely with business stakeholders to drive integration and adoption of analytics insights into new and existing business processes by demonstrating the ability to communicate the business benefits provided by analytics insights.

• Ensure all analytics project undertaking comply with both internal and external policies guidelines and regulations.
• Collaborate with third party solutions providers to identify next generation analytics solutions through a series of proof of concepts (POC)
• Provide group level support to extended Analytics team based in other GE offices such as Malaysia. Support ad-hoc requests as and when required.
• Takes accountability in considering business and regulatory compliance risks and takes appropriate steps to mitigate the risks.

• Highlights any potential concerns /risks and proactively shares best risk management practices.

We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia Africa and the Middle East.

We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.

The Role Responsibilities

The purpose of the role is to provide Business Analysis and delivery management support to the Financial Markets Operations group focusing on post trade systems re-platforming. The joiner will join a high performing team delivering strategic systems change to the FM business. The system is built entirely in-house using bleeding-edge architecture and technologies such as micro-services and Kafka. The role involves working closely with senior business stakeholders developers and the dev Ops team. The initial assignments will involve Equity Derivative re-platforming with a focus on cash settlement nostro and suspense reconciliations and may involve analysis for regulatory programmes such as IBOR transition and European benchmark reform.

Strategy
  • Business requirement gathering process re-engineering and design systems impact analysis
  • Define and document business functions and processes functional requirements / user stories for FM systems re-platforming and
  • Track and fully document changes for functional and business specifications; write detailed universally understood processes/steps/requirements/user stories/epics for use in training
  • Serve as a conduit between the customer community (Key Stakeholders and end-users) and the software development team through which requirements flow; Ensure developers understand the context of the changes;
  • Drive and challenge the business on the implementation of FMO processes
  • Highlight risks suggest mitigation and to manage and actively monitor them to reduce the likelihood of occurrence
  • Promote proactive communication and collaboration across all the teams.
  • Perform Data Gap Analysis map the data requirements to the target state for FM Re-platforming
  • Planning and coordinating profiling of data at source to ascertain data quality and consistency
  • Proposing data quality validation rules and data quality maintenance where appropriate
  • Planning and performing acceptance testing activities to ascertain standards and recommendations are being followed
  • Support functional design testing and deployment of change initiatives
  • Define the user demonstrations training materials and conduct formal system and user training sessions; facilitate train-the-trainer approach. Assist in training/mentoring other staff on the project
Business
  • Ability to prioritise user stories and requirements against business priorities.

Risk Management
  • Ability to identify potential operational risk and propose technology-based solutions to mitigate as part of the system design.

Regulatory & Business Conduct
  • Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct.
  • Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics including regulatory and business conduct across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with in letter and spirit all applicable laws regulations guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
  • Lead to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank's Conduct Principles : Effective Financial Markets; Financial Crime Compliance
  • Effectively and collaboratively identify escalate mitigate and resolve risk conduct and compliance matters.

Our Ideal Candidate
  • Experience as IT Business Analyst or back office function change/SME
  • Proven experience in writing documentation for projects. Determine the level of formality required and consider options for documenting and packaging requirements based on project type priorities and risks
  • Must have worked in global enterprise scale applications development and implementations
  • Ability to plan an approach for analysing categorizing and managing requirements
  • Ability to communicate effectively technical information to non-technical audience and business information to technical audience
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office (including PowerPoint and Excel) and JIRA/Confluence
  • Good presentation skills and highly effective verbal and written English communication skills;
  • Good working knowledge of international banking; experience in Wholesale Banking especially in Equity Derivative FX Option Rates Derivatives applicable product knowledge is highly preferable

Job Title: Front Office Quality Control Analyst SG – 18 month Assignment
Job Description:
With satellite groups across International Private Bank (IPB) locations the Front Office Quality Control team will have the responsibility for monitoring and testing adherence to policies and procedures by Client Advisors. Based on a series of detailed established procedures team members will identify when specific key processes need to be performed by advisors and subsequently engage with the advisor/team to ensure these tasks are completed in a timely manner and to the standard required.
The primary areas of focus will include (whilst not exclusive to):
·        the logging and completion of call memos to the required quality standards under the global cross border procedure.
·        oversight of any missing client documentation which is deemed outstanding including those relating to Investment Management fee schedules Cross Border Request forms( CRF) and upcoming Suitability Assessment Forms (SAFs).
·        assisting investors in ensuring the timeliness and completeness of Suitability post-trade reporting Cross-Border activity and Selling Practices. 
Role Description:  
This is an 18 month assignment in the Front Office Quality Control Team. The Front Office Quality Control Analyst will be a member of a newly formed team whose objective will be to maintain a strong and consistent review of specific front office tasks which are driven through regulatory obligation.
 
The key objective of the Analyst is to enforce an effective and timely approach to supporting and validating key tasks in advance of final Business Quality Assurance assessment.
 
Responsibilities:
·        With a focus on a specific set of front office tasks the QC Analyst will help to ensure the application of the appropriate processes and subsequently implement regular controls within each Market team.
·        Engage with control colleagues across the firm business operations management legal compliance risk audit and technology control functions to optimize processes and address regularly occurring issues.
·        Provide the QC Lead with a pre-fined set of metrics on a regular basis to illustrate volumes and trending patterns of issues and behaviors.
 
Qualifications & Skills:
·        At least 2 years of work experience in Wealth Management
·        Minimum 3 years of administrative support experience to Wealth Management Client Advisors
·        Excellent interpersonal and relationship/teamwork skills
·        Strong organization and time management skills
·        Ability to follow detailed instructions with high attention to accuracy and completeness
·        High degree of professionalism self-motivation and sense of urgency
·        Fast learner; desire and ability to learn new skills
·        Strong Microssoft Office skill

The Company

Our client is a European MNC one of the leading players within the management consulting space. Due to business expansion in the APAC region they are now recruiting for a Senior Billing Analyst to be based at Singapore.

The Role

Reporting to Finance Director you are responsible for billing matters for APAC region and you will have to work closely with senior stakeholders and external clients to resolve any queries or dispute. You will also have to support in credit control and cash flow management.

Your Profile

To be considered for this role you will need a degree or professional qualification in accountancy and at least 5-7 years of working experience in a similar scope of work. Regional remit exposure is preferred. You will need to have good communication and interpersonal skills as well as strong in Microsoft Excel.

Job Title: Digital Business Analyst - ERP (SAP / Workday- Financial / HCM)
Job Description:
The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.

Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

As a Business Analyst you will be managing the FI/ HCM service delivery aspects of the project. You will collaborate with a team supporting a shared HR finance and procurement system used by subscribing government agencies i.e. statutory boards.

You will advise agencies on key trends and best practice for ERP solution locally and internationally to meet the business domain’s objectives and solve business problems assess applicability for adoption manage user requirements and provide IT solutions to bridge business needs. You are knowledgeable in SAP FI / HCM modules or Workday. Success in this will be demonstrated by your ability to conduct business analysis including business analysis planning and monitoring business needs exploration and identification requirement analysis solution assessment and validation and requirement management and communication.

What To Expect
  • Review and analyse agencies’ ERP needs and recommend solutions within the shared System capabilities.
  • Work with suppliers and agency representatives to evaluate requirements discuss solutions and develop plan of approach; analyse existing processes and make recommendations to better streamline overall processes within the ERP solution to ensure smooth deployment and adoption of new solution.
  • Manage service delivery of shared FI / HCM system and related sub-systems including integration points with finance system and related technical areas.
  • Work directly with and manage the supplier and agencies for new implementations.
  • Manage post-implementation support and maintenance of the shared FI / HCM system including software patches / upgrades disaster recovery service quality and compliance with service levels applicable policies standards and processes.
  • Assist with integration of ERP solution with other business systems and applications used by agencies and other Singapore Government shared systems and services.
  • Validate design and effort of change requests for quality reliability maintainability and reasonableness.
  • Review and analyse existing policies and processes and recommend improvements.

How To Succeed
  • Degree with major in Information Technology Information Systems Systems Development or closely related areas.
  • At least 5 years’ experience implementing and maintaining Workday or SAP FI / HCM with hands-on SAP ECC 6.0 (Netweaver) FICO / HR ABAP/Webdynpro programming workflow and configuration.
  • Completed at least one full SAP project implementation and maintenance life cycle with hands-on experience.
  • Knowledge of SAP Organisation Management Personnel Administration Time Management to Personnel Development including the suite of Talent Management (Appraisal Recruitment Talent Management & Development Compensation and Learning Solution) functionalities and features.
  • Knowledge of SAP GL budgets funds control & procurement functionalities and features and Singapore accounting practices.
  • Experience in any of the leading cloud ERP products in FI / HR domain will be preferred.
  • Possess good communication interpersonal organizational and planning skills.
  • Able to interact and communicate effectively with all levels of management users and suppliers.
  • Must be a self-starter and able to work independently with minimum supervision.

Pluses+
  • Knowledge of and experience in SAP ERP ECC 6.0 EhP 7 and related areas (e.g. process / product trends best practices and technologies)
  • Knowledge of Singapore Government accounting practices and policies
  • Business Analysis certification: Certification of Competency in Business Analysis (CCBA) or Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP)

Job Title: VP / Assistant VP| Lead Systems Analyst| Enterprise Workflow
Job Description:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific Europe and North America. In Asia we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China Indonesia Malaysia and Thailand as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time we have been guided by our values — Honorable Enterprising United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right build for the future work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work consistently be it towards the company our colleagues or our customers.

About The Department

The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership technology operations risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.

Job Responsibilities
  • Systems Analysis Lead/ Solution Lead:
  • Devise and own the functional/capability roadmap for Enterprise Workflow (Scanning Imaging and Workflow)
  • Study/Evangelize new/unused capabilities in underlying products and suggest practical use case for UOB
  • Study/Evangelize new trends in Document Automation/Workflow/NLP and suggest practical use cases for UOB.
  • Work closely with process experts and various business units to analyze and design solutions based on business requirements
  • Devise cost effective solution aligned with guiding principles/best practices for application and product
  • Manage and mentor a team of System Analysts to conduct user workshops provide and deliver functional specifications/User Interface as per guiding principles
  • Influence key stakeholders from Business Units and OCs on application solutions and Process Re-engineering
  • Collaborate with architect and other Development manager on the conceptualization of the solution.
  • Influence/Review SIT Test Plan and Strategy
  • Application Delivery
  • Concurrently manage delivery of 2 or more medium sized projects
  • Meet or exceed quality KPIs for Application Delivery
  • Manage requirements according to planned objectives project/ CR scope and assess impact to existing processes and applications
  • Manage up-stream and down-stream teams and system for each release and ensure the overall solution is sound and scalable
  • Manage delivery end-to-end with development leads adhering to scope schedule and cost allocations
  • Engage stakeholders on scope delivery and updates
  • Manage development team and/or vendors if required in quality delivery
  • Be abreast with latest technology and business needs and plan ahead to use and support them
Job Requirements
  • At least 10 to 14 years of experience in business process and/or technology implementations with at least 5 years of experience in leading/ managing application teams
  • Strong Business Process acumen. Ability to solve business problems via Process Re-engineering and practical/ structured solutions.
  • At least 3 years as a solution or a process lead and 5 years as a hands on Business/Systems Analyst.
  • Experience/Working knowledge on latest automation technologies like NLP BPM RPA etc.
  • Experience in managing team size in the range of 2 to 10 team members
  • Experience in managing project deliveries in the range of 100-200 man days
  • Experience in implementing/ solutioning large scale transaction/workflow processing systems
  • Ability to work independently and excellent problem solving skills is a must
  • Strong Negotiation skills with an ability to challenge status quo
  • Passion to experiment and learn new Technologies
  • Experience on Pega IBM Workflow RPA OCR NLP is an advantage.
Be a part of UOB Family

All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs job requirements and qualifications. Job Title: Cloud Migration & Implementation – Senior Analyst / Consultant

As you advance your journey as a cloud migration & implementation professional you'll want to join forces with individuals and teams who will make your work rewarding and exciting. Join our global powerhouse of cloud professionals. With your insights and expertise your work will span the end-to-end spectrum of as-a-service solutions while you collaborate with our security analytics automation and artificial intelligence teams.

  • Provide technical expertise to plan analyse define and support the delivery of future functional and technical capabilities for an application or suite of applications leveraging a cloud-based architecture.

  • Consolidate account into AWS organisation

  • Define policies and standard for AWS organization

  • Be a major actor in VPC Architecture

  • Design transformation of on-prem connectivity to public cloud

  • Design and implement solution for multi-cloud interconnection architecture

  • Actively control and optimize AWS Cloud costs

  • Ensure Cloud environments are compliant to security policies

  • Familiarity in Documentation and Drawing of AWS Architecture Standards and Operating Procedures

  • Excellent communication interpersonal and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail. Understanding of Infrastructure monitoring logging alerting release and configuration management

  • Flexibility to work non-business hours that may include weekends and/or holidays

  • Self-starter who is able to identify and perform tasks with minimal supervision

We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online in the classroom or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do and the experience it offers provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.

Job Description:
Regional Finance Analyst - World Leading FMCG Conglomerate
  • *Be part of a top FMCG firm with learning & growth opportunities

Job Title: 2021 Mastercard Launch| Associate Analyst| Technology Account Management
Job Description:
Our Purpose

We work to connect and power an inclusive digital economy that benefits everyone everywhere by making transactions safe simple smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks partnerships and passion our innovations and solutions help individuals financial institutions governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient or DQ drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths views and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions drives innovation and delivers better business results.

Job Title

2021 Mastercard Launch Associate Analyst Technology Account Management

Who is Mastercard?
We are the global technology company behind the world’s fastest payments processing network. We are a vehicle for commerce a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded a technology innovation lab and the home of Priceless®. We ensure every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe as our company grows so should you. We believe in connecting everyone to endless priceless possibilities.

The Mastercard Launch program is aimed at early career talent to help you develop skills and gain cross-functional work experience. Over a period of 18 months Launch participants will be assigned to a business unit learn and develop skills and gain valuable on the job experience. Successful candidates will be assigned to a business unit within International Markets and rotate for a duration of 2 x 9 months each for a total of 18 months.

Role

Technology Account Management
The role will provide opportunities to be involved in the following projects:
  • Contribute in creating best practices lessons learned and sharing knowledge across the team
  • Understand Mastercard core systems and operational processes and relevant products
  • Support implementation of products and/or services including researching and responding to customer queries
  • Creating and managing team knowledge repository
  • Support in creating and maintaining team dashboards
  • Assisting Technology Account Management in analyzing data to support operational/business reviews with Customers
  • Supporting researching issues managing a project
  • Getting involved in customer conversations in real situations (projects/ operational matters/ issue resolution)
  • The role inherently requires developing a strong understanding of core business of Mastercard and will entail interacting with Mastercard teams platforms/systems and processes.
Education

All about you:
  • Graduating seniors - Class of 2021
  • Students pursuing a Masters/bachelor’s degree (all majors welcome to apply)
Key Competencies

Interest in both technology and business
  • Ability to learn and is self-driven
  • Able to learn on the job while making a useful contribution to the team
  • Enjoys problem solving and analyzing data
  • Good written and verbal communication skills
  • Well organized and structured
Experience And Skills Required
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Ability to work on a team and independently
  • Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced deadline-driven environment
  • Advanced Word Excel and PowerPoint skills
  • Attention to detail
Languages
  • English required
  • Additional languages a plus
Application end date will be on: October 31 2020

Due to COVID-19 most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.

Job Title: Operations Automation Business Analyst / Project Manager
Job Description:
Job Purpose

Project manager (PM) with strong Business Analyst (BA) skills for the Prime Futures Delta 1 (PFD1) Operations project team.

The role is to manage and deliver a portfolio of projects within PFD1 focused on utilizing low code / innovation capabilities. Business analysis will also be a significant part of this role.

The candidate must be an experienced in project management and familiarity with the financial markets industry and various PFD1 products and operations. Experience of implementing low code solutions would be highly beneficial to the role.

As PM/BA the candidate should be able to analyze business requirements issues and risks and work closely with the operations line technology teams and other relevant functions within Citi to define and clarify requirements and propose solutions.

This candidate needs to articulate and be able to effectively communicate to the senior stakeholders across functions.

This role will report to the Regional manager in Singapore for PFD1 Operations Change Management.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain project materials and deliverables

Produce business cases ensuring that all projects have a viable business proposition

Create Project Plans business requirements User Acceptance Test Plans and present strategy and status to Seniors on regular basis

Determine verify and document business requirements (including impact to other business areas)

Assist Global Project Manager with the development and maintenance of the project plans

Identify and communicate key project risks define mitigation strategies and manage to resolution

Track and maintain Change Request documentation to ensure that all additional requirements are traceable

Develop test strategies document test scenarios and coordinate the execution of test scripts

Organise and deliver of presentations for steering committee and other stakeholder meetings

Adhere to Programme and Project Management policy and ensure those connected to your projects do as well

Manage the relationships within the project

Facilitate meetings with the appropriate subject matter experts to obtain specifics on requirements; resolve issues and mitigate risks

Liaise with Operations Technology and Front Office staff to ensure that required project artefacts are collated

Liaise with Technology staff to ensure that requirements are understood and that functional and design proposals are fit for purpose

Identify and communicate inter-project dependencies to stakeholders and other project team members

Business analysis

Consult and collate business requirements; identify and document Use-Cases;

Perform business analysis and provide stakeholders and senior business management with information key to decision making for project direction and strategy.

Produce Business Requirement Documents and obtain stakeholder sign off; be disciplined in managing changing requirements

Project Management development

Utilize approved Methodology and Tools for Business Analysis

Liaise with PFD1 project team members globally to achieve consistent best in class documentation standards and methodologies

Lead peer reviews and inspections of project documents

Participate in the PMO education forums

Knowledge/Experience

Consulting background or previous Project Manager experience in Financial Services

Experience in futures and Cleared OTC will be an added plus.

Experience in low code solutions. Knowledge of Appian Automation Anywhere and Xceptor would be highly beneficial to the role.

Practical experience in analysis design and implementation on successfully implemented projects in the financial services industry

Experience and high level of expertise in all aspects of project & programme life cycles; ability to operate in waterfall or agile approach

Familiarity with daily activities performed within PFD1 Operations and an appreciation of the interaction with supported/related business areas (Equities Futures Commodities Securities Lending)

Experience of compiling data and analysing results

Experience of working in a process-driven environment

Experience of interacting at senior levels and ensuring credibility is maintained through solid delivery against commitments

Experience of a financial services environment Experience of working in a heavily controls-focused environment

Skills

Computer literate and ability to grasp systems and flows quickly

Strong presentation skills

Strong analytical and problem solving skills

Strong oral and written communication skills and ability to facilitate discussions

Quickly grasp and master new requirements and related knowledge

Manage tight deadlines or unexpected requirement changes

Ability to learn/understand some technical implications of system design

Microsoft Excel Word and PowerPoint MS Project MS Visio MS Access

Qualifications

Competencies

Team player in both solid line and matrix reporting organizations

Willingness to ask questions challenge the process and seek out answers

Ability to work independently multi-task take ownership and drive parts of the project

Individual contributor with the ability to work in a team of diverse skill sets and cultures

Strong people process and business focus

Ability to react to a dynamic environment

Ability to remain calm and objective in a high-pressure environment

Job Description:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific Europe and North America. In Asia we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China Indonesia Malaysia and Thailand as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time we have been guided by our values — Honorable Enterprising United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right build for the future work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work consistently be it towards the company our colleagues or our customers.

About The Department

The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership technology operations risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.

  • Manage budget coming from different projects.

Job Description:
Our Purpose

We work to connect and power an inclusive digital economy that benefits everyone everywhere by making transactions safe simple smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks partnerships and passion our innovations and solutions help individuals financial institutions governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient or DQ drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths views and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions drives innovation and delivers better business results.

Job Title

2021 Mastercard Launch Associate Analyst Digital & Emerging Partnerships

Who is Mastercard?
We are the global technology company behind the world’s fastest payments processing network. We are a vehicle for commerce a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded a technology innovation lab and the home of Priceless®. We ensure every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe as our company grows so should you. We believe in connecting everyone to endless priceless possibilities.

The Mastercard Launch program is aimed at early career talent to help you develop skills and gain cross-functional work experience. Over a period of 18 months Launch participants will be assigned to a business unit learn and develop skills and gain valuable on the job experience. Successful candidates will be assigned to a business unit within International Markets and rotate for a duration of 2 x 9 months each for a total of 18 months.

Role

Digital & Emerging Partnerships manages the overall Mastercard business with digital players and other non-traditional partnerships
In this role you will be shaping the response of Mastercard to the emerging Asian (and global) digital players.
This team is focused on digital-first customers. All Mastercard products and services are in scope when we define what we can do with these customers: Core issuance (Prepaid Debit Credit) Commercial and B2B and services including new acquisitions.

About Standard Chartered

We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.

The Role Responsibilities

BAs are responsible for defining scope analysing and developing process data and analytical models eliciting and documenting requirements identifying solutions and verifying that they meet requirements and supporting development activities.
  • Work with the business users/product owner and capture business requirements accurately comprehensively and without ambiguity facilitate traceability and in harmony with existing application functionalities
  • Requirements Analysis and Design Definition: Needs to have a good "eye-for-detail" and describe the tasks used to organize requirements specify and model requirements and designs validate and verify information identify solution options and estimate the potential value that could be realized.
  • Solution Evaluation: Should be able to describe the tasks used to assess the performance of and value delivered by a solution and to recommend improvements on increasing values in the functions.
  • Hands-on experience in requirements life cycle management in banking and financial domain. Should be able to manage requirements from inception to implementation.
  • Well-versed in elicitation and multi-team collaboration at global level. Highly skilled in defining the scope as well as describing the tasks related to the scope.
  • Co-ordinate amongst internal and business stakeholders to review and obtain business signoff for the project cost plan specifications etc
  • Ensure gaps in deliverables are identified early and addressed effectively
  • Strategy Analysis and Stakeholder Management - Candidate to possess' skills to identify the business needs address those needs and align the change strategy with the Bank.
  • Work with delivery and project services organizations as well as other technology and vendor organizations in ensuring requirements are transformed into effective solutions with-in cost schedule and quality - adhering to the bank's standards guide-lines and policies
  • Involve in high level technical design / implementation discussions and contribute
  • Assist development testing and support teams by providing them business focus and ensure issues are thoroughly analysed and taken to closure
Customer Expectations
  • Client Focus: Ensure the business requirements and proposed solutions achieve the customers' goals
  • Stakeholder Delivery: Build effective relationships with stakeholders both directly and via the project team to ensure timely delivery of solutions which support the business
  • Form and maintain key relationships of mutual trust and respect which fosters a climate of collaboration around project delivery
  • Ensure proposed solutions meet the needs of the business / business requirements and will deliver appropriate outcomes
Business Delivery and Financial Performance
  • Strategic Planning: Communicate the vision scope and business case for the project as defined by the project manager and signed off by all stakeholders. The BA should be able to link the business case and strategy to their subsequent business analysis and design deliverables
  • Ensure solutions are aligned with meeting the Bank's strategic goals and architectural vision or gain explicit approval for non-compliance
  • Provide support to the project manager to ensure engagement with stakeholders to track and deliver benefits
  • Use a structured process for data gathering and analysis to specify key dimensions of the problem and determine root cause
  • Elicit and analyse the business requirements from all stakeholders (and where relevant understand and incorporate requirements originating from the other key related projects / programmes / change activities)
  • Produce the business requirements document ensuring all requirements (functional and non-functional) are unambiguous feasible traceable and solution-free
  • Where business process re-engineering is required develop current and to-be process and data models
  • Challenge business around requirements and solutions - provide insight into alternative methods for resolving business problems and bringing external / industry experience and insight to offer alternatives
  • Identify possible solutions verify that these meet the requirements and communicate recommendations to stakeholders to facilitate decision making
  • Provide assistance if required to the project / programme manager with conducting the vendor selection process
  • Produce the functional specification for the development team using standard tools (JIRA) and techniques e.g. use cases flow diagrams logical data model
  • Ensure stakeholder engagement throughout the lifecycle of the project by using effective and targeted communications
  • Continuous Improvement of BA standards: Be aware of and follow Markets Business Analysis practices and processes. Evaluate them and contribute to making them more robust and effective
People
  • Bring drive energy and enthusiasm to any particular initiative inspiring others to continually perform at the best
  • Collaboration: Maintain open relationships with other areas and roles to ensure project deliveries are not slowed but delivered on time and with high quality.

Our Ideal Candidate

Essential Experience - Must-Have Skills
  • Bachelors / Masters in from Information Technology Engineering or Business Administration with seven to ten years in the financial services banking industry as a IT business analyst;

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific Europe and North America. In Asia we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China Indonesia Malaysia and Thailand as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time we have been guided by our values — Honorable Enterprising United and Committed. The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.

Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

The Government Digital Services (GDS) Team aims to spearhead the digital transformation of government. Our team aims to design and develop software applications that help government agencies to better serve the needs of the people of Singapore. You may check out our various initiatives here: https://www.hive.gov.sg/

Software engineers thrive on interesting challenges and problems. In GovTech instead of solving problems to generate revenue or maximise profit our engineers strive to solve problems in order to create meaningful impact for the people our applications serve.

For example working with MOE on Parents Gateway our engineers have helped to improve communications and interactions between schools and parents while easing the administrative load of teachers. The engineers on the LifeSG team aim to ease Singaporeans' interactions with the government at key moments of their lives such as when having a baby. You can read more about us and what we do at our blog: https://blog.gds-gov.tech/

For this role you will be working to build a platform for Government agencies to effectively render social services support to citizens who are in need. This platform aims to provide a coordinated support plan to citizens who need help without them going through multiple silo agencies. If the idea of applying your skills and expertise to serve the public good resonates with you our team of like-minded engineers in Digital Design & Development (DCUBE) welcomes you to join us and our colleagues in digital nation-building.

What To Expect
  • Deliver and deploy high quality software including:
    • Writing code that is clean readable testable
    • Reviewing fellow developers' code
  • Collaborate closely with other specialists within an agile and collaborative team environment including:
    • Advocating a positive team culture
    • Working with UX Designers to implement their designs into working software
    • Working with Business Analyst to craft user stories by providing technical analysis
    • Working with Quality Engineers to develop automated tests and fix defects
    • Working with DevOps Engineers to manage builds and releases
    • Working with Security Engineers to address security issues/vulnerabilities

How To Succeed
  • A desire to serve the public through the use of technology
  • A hunger to learn and to share your learning
  • A healthy discontent with the status quo and an itch to improve things
  • Good communication skills as we believe software development is a team sport
  • Experience with modern web application technology stacks such as:
    • NodeJS TypeScript and associated ecosystem
    • JSON REST API design & implementation
    • Web front-end technology and frameworks such as ReactJS Webpack

Preferred (Additional Requirements)
  • 1 or more years' relevant working experience although fresh graduates are also welcome to apply
  • Working experience in an agile environment
  • Working experience with the following:
    • Cloud platforms e.g. AWS GCP Azure
    • Automated testing tools
    • Docker and/or other related container technologies/tools
    • Mobile app development for iOS and/or Android (native or with cross-platform tools like React Native)

DBS Bank Ltd

The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.

Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

Software engineers thrive on interesting challenges and problems. In GovTech instead of solving problems to generate revenue or maximise profit our engineers strive to solve problems in order to create meaningful impact for the people our applications serve.

For example working with MOE on Parents Gateway our engineers have helped to improve communications and interactions between schools and parents while easing the administrative load of teachers. The engineers on the LifeSG team aim to ease Singaporeans' interactions with the government at key moments of their lives such as when having a baby. You can read more about us and what we do at our blog: https://blog.gds-gov.tech/

For this role you will be working with a team on expanding the services in the GoWhere product suite for the Citizens beyond COVID-19. GoWhere is the de facto portal for mask and TraceTogether token collection listing of PHPCs and finding COVID-19 support schemes. If the idea of applying your skills and expertise to serve the public good resonates with you our team of like-minded engineers in Digital Design & Development (DCUBE) welcomes you to join us and our colleagues in digital nation-building.

What To Expect
  • Work within an agile development team to deliver secure high-quality applications. This may include: Web application front-end development and Server-side / API development

○ Advocating a positive team culture
○ Working with UX Designers to implement their designs into working software
○ Working with Business Analyst to craft user stories by providing technical analysis
○ Working with Quality Engineers to develop automated tests and fix defects
○ Working with DevOps Engineers to manage builds and releases
○ Working with Security Engineers to address security issues/vulnerabilities
○ Assisting Product/Delivery Managers in technical assessment of new feature requests or engagements

How To Succeed
  • Minimum of 2 years’ relevant working experience is preferred.
  • Experience in modern web application technologies:
○ React / React Native
○ Node.JS
○ Typescript
  • Experiences in the following would be advantageous:
○ Agile Frameworks (e.g. Scrum)
○ Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment
○ Cloud/PaaS platforms such as AWS/Heroku/OpenShift
○ Docker and/or other related container technologies/tools
○ Automated testing tools
○ Infrastructure as a Code

Preferred Character/personality Traits
  • A desire to serve the public through the use of technology
  • A hunger to learn and to share your learning
  • A healthy discontent with the status quo and an itch to improve things
  • Good communication skills as we believe software development is a team sport

About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific Europe and North America. In Asia we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China Indonesia Malaysia and Thailand as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time we have been guided by our values - Honorable Enterprising United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right build for the future work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work consistently be it towards the company our colleagues or our customers.

About The Department

The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership technology operations risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.

  • Collaborate with BU Specialists to elicit and review business requirements
  • Analyse and document the "to be" business and operations processes based on the agreed requirements and / or function points perform impact assessment
  • Responsible to analyse and define detailed functional and non-functional requirements based on business requirements
  • Monitor and manage risks /issues related to requirements and scope creep
  • Write business functional release notes and contribute to deployment plan
  • Team Collaboration
  • Transition functional and non-functional requirements to System Analysts and ensure a clear and complete understanding of the requirements
  • Work with Test Manager to translate business requirements into test scenarios
  • Facilitate / provide "Train the Trainer" on application enhancements
  • Maintain up to date knowledge base related to application features and processes (subject matter expertise)
  • Testing & Scope Management
  • Clarify test findings escalated by Test Manager and classify the findings accordingly (either as a defect or change request)
  • Perform impact assessment and estimation for Project
  • Change Request

Business Domain: Cash and Payments.

Technical Skills & Experience
  • Strong business domain knowledge in banking
  • Bachelor's degree in engineering/ business/ finance or equivalent
  • Strong quantitative analytical problem solving and process design skills that can translate analysis into solutions that meet business objectives
  • Understanding of technology and operational processes across functions / departments in the bank/market.
  • Resourceful team player
  • Familiar with change management processes and project management fundamentals
  • Strategic forward thinking approach to challenges with outstanding communications influencing negotiating and persuasion skills
  • Passionate diligent and resilient individual with ability to thrive in ambiguity
  • Experience in scoping and evaluation - Defining overall considerations including scalability maintainability cost operations and technology principal risk to provide a recommendation
  • Minimum 10 years of relevant banking and/or consulting experience

Job Title: Private Bank Client Reporting Technology Business Analyst
Job Description:
The Citi Private Bank (CPB) Client Reporting Technology team is responsible for legal statements advices confirms relationship reports regulatory client reports performance and other supplementary reporting.

The candidate will design and develop the user interface create or update existing report sections ensure data accuracy and review end to end data flows.

The Technology Business Analyst will apply business understanding analytical processes critical thinking experience and project management capability to create document and guide the implementation of advanced application solutions for the CPB user base

Key Responsibilities

Liaise with business to understand strategies and interpret underlying business needs and with developers to propose and design technology solutions thoughtfully transform them into clear business and design requirements and project manage to attain successful implementation

Review key regional and global regulatory changes in the industry and assess its impact to Client Reporting work stream

Develop these requirements to ensure that they are sufficiently complete and correct for execution

Understand at a very low level the functional data analysis requirements in the financial services space

Analyzing financial data flows security master requirements client and account relationships Private Banking business processes etc.

Play a consultative role to business partners and continuously seek out and propose creative solutions and innovative technology ideas to meet business goals

Candidate must interact with developers based in multiple locations and work with external vendors as well as internal legal compliance marketing branding and other partners

Build a deep understanding of CPB business products and processes and provide a business perspective to project teams

Analyze data processes and usability input and produce clear and logical documentation of results

In addition to collaborating with professional designers use tools such as Balsamiq or Adobe InDesign to create mockups and wire frames

Utilize data query tools to confirm data quality and investigate user queries

Create effective presentations to be used with business audiences of various levels

Manage timelines milestones and streams related to own projects

Track resolve and escalate issues for own projects while keeping relevant stakeholders informed

Communicate continually with all stakeholders including Investment Centre Heads Bankers Technology Managers Legal & Compliance on the status of deliverables and flag potential risks and delays to successful completion of all projects

Maintain project deliverables including reporting and tracking statuses using Powerpoint Excel Jira and Confluence

Act as advisor or coach to new or lower level analysts and work as a team to achieve business objectives performing other duties and functions as assigned

Has the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision

Can exercise independence of judgement and autonomy

Required Skills

Experience in Financial Services industry with a focus on Private Banking/Wealth Management including in-depth knowledge of Banking Lending and Complex Investment products

Experience with financial accounting and performance calculation flows (cash flows accruals performance return calculation e.g. time-weighted money-weighted contribution attribution transaction code mapping security asset classification mapping)

Strong knowledge of the full software development testing lifecycle

Experienced practitioner of agile development methodology

Experience with data query/processing/engineering development (PL/SQL Scala Python)

Strong cross-group collaboration and relationship management skills including coordinating with geographically dispersed teams to achieve deliverables

Strong skills in developing and maintaining relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders

Education And Qualifications

Bachelor's degree/University degree with 6 or more years’ relevant experience in business analysis within a technology area

Good organizational skills with attention to detail

Astute analytical skills

Strong relationship building skills

Very self-motivated and independent thinker

About The Company

Our Client is a high growth company with strong presence across APAC. They are also the market leader in the Industrial sector that it operates in. As the business is growing this is a newly created role and an exciting opportunity for a dedicated Treasury manager/analyst to join their business to drive transformation projects.

About The Job

Reporting to the Corporate Treasurer you will manage large cash flow across the business within the APAC region and work with top management like the audit committee CEO and board of directors. You will manage the opening and closing update and maintain bank account details authorization and user entitlements. Monitoring debt covenants for all credit facilities monitoring project financing and performing cash positioning for visibility and forecast for liquidity management. You will manage oversee the interest rate risk management ensuring compliance with treasury policy and supporting countries in the hedging overall treasury risk operations and systems matters. You will also support implementation and maintenance of treasury management system projects. Developing treasury reports and dashboard to monitor exposure and analysing financial risks. Supporting on execution of FX hedging and ensure compliance to internal treasury controls. Evaluating new opportunities for banking products and liaison with the banks administer transactions and short-term investments other reporting requirement like bond corporate update. In addition you will also support ad-hoc proijects as the treasury function expands.

Skills And Experience Required
  • Finance Professional qualified with a recognized professional body
  • Has experience with a fast paced multi-national company
  • Resilient and demonstrates maturity and integrity at the highest level at all times
  • Able to stay focused work across multiple projects simultaneously in a timely manner and optimize/simplify processes where necessary.
  • Excellent communicator in English with good influencing skills and the ability to communicate well with peers and senior leaders locally and on a remote basis.

Our client is a leading consulting firm and due to business needs they are currently looking for a Financial Analyst to join the team.

Reporting to the Financial Controller for FP&A you will be responsible for preparing monthly financial performance reports reviewing and analyzing monthly actuals vs. budgets / forecasted results and variances and provide analytical support to facilitate understanding the financial results of their business. As a Financial Analyst you will also have to monitor and report SG&A expense trends vs. targets and identify areas of cost reductions.
