Licence No.: 11C4684

EA Reg No: R1109257

What STT Cloud does?

ST Telemedia Cloud (STT Cloud) is ASEAN's leading cloud modernisation solutions provider. Created to deliver world-class cloud development migration and management solutions integrated with leading cybersecurity techniques and technology. STT Cloud consists of a portfolio of three specialist companies CloudCover Cloud Comrade and Quantum Security with operations across the ASEAN region. As an end-to-end solutions provider we are passionate about pulling our customers forward from existing IT to large scale modern software cloud technology and operations. As cloud native we celebrate mastery autonomy experimentation continuous innovation agility collaboration and above all a growth mindset.

Why work at STT Cloud?

STT Cloud is young and ambitious and growing at great velocity! We are constantly on the lookout for the best talents to accelerate our momentum. STT Cloud is the place for you if you want to be part of a hyper-growth environment that continually challenges itself to surpass its goals for growth and innovation. Talent join us and stay because they are constantly learning contributing and having fun!

The Ideal Candidate

You are a highly motivated bright dynamic and adaptable individual contributor who thrives in an innovative performance-oriented environment. Continual learning is everything. Your strong organisational skills and action orientation make you a key contributor in a team full of diverse experienced technology and business leaders. Deep down you have a passion for life embrace change and thrive in a creative environment. You are a strong communicator with a strong bias for action. You understand the needs of customers and team members and you initiate and track action to ensure customer and staff objectives are achieved.

You are comfortable dealing with executive teams and know how to identify create and establish “c” level meetings and communications. You find solutions to problems that are economic strategic and elegant. Importantly you are a strong culture carrier both within and on behalf of our business. In addition you have a strong desire to understand and learn the business so that you can proactively find new ways to add value.

You will be part of a team which is focused on creating disruptive high-quality products and services and solving challenging customer problems that will revolutionize enterprise computing in the cloud. You will get ample opportunities for growth and you must possess drive and ambition to constantly improve and innovate to new customer areas.

Your Purpose

  • Identify drivers model and analyse business data and help define business problems then synthesise into reports for management’s decision-making.
  • Creatively think and develop insights into what the data is or is not saying.
  • Conduct market and competitor research to support strategic and business planning.
  • Recommend and implement initiatives for improvement to increase the company’s efficiency and profitability.
  • Train other stakeholders who could partner to improve efficiency and profitability.

    • Your Responsibilities

    Business and Operational Analysis
    • Define collect and maintain key metrics and databases that measure business portfolio performance business development and operational improvement opportunities.
    • Partner with other stakeholders (e.g. sales finance) to monitor business issues and collect data to quantify impact to business performance.
    • Perform detailed analysis to identify business opportunities and issues.
    • Conduct surveys and interviews to understand operational issues and gather suggestions for improvement.
    • Conduct competitor and market research on current and prospective requirements across business functions chains market size market growth market share relative profit margins distribution strength and production capacity.
    • Conduct and coordinate product market operational and related research to support strategic and business planning.
    • Synthesise data from finance and operations combined with market research into reports using data visualisation techniques and tools.
    • Interpret evaluate and interrelate research data and develop integrated business analyses and projections for incorporation into strategic decision-making.
    • Plan and coordinate the development of primary and secondary market research studies in support of strategic planning and specific marketing initiatives as required and presents findings of studies to client committees.
    • Provide oversight and support in the delivery of business analysis activities across the portfolio of projects.

    Data for Management Decision-Making
    • Create informative actionable and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement.
    • Present analysis findings to management with the aim to provide insights and make recommendations.
    • Make recommendations including reduction measures revenue generation ideas streamlining and reengineering operations and ways to increase customer satisfaction.

    Business Improvement Initiatives
    • With the business leaders develop and implement plans of action.
    • Prepare business cases to support new investment strategic and other business decisions.
    • Evaluate proposed introduction of new CAPEX and OPEX eg. programs facilities and provide insights.
    • Monitor implementation of changes and quantify impact to business and operations.

    Training
    • Provide training to key relevant stakeholders/employees who could contribute to better profitability and efficiency eg. sales and business development managers.


    Must Have Requirements
    • A minimum of 8 years experience in business analysis or a related field.
    • Strong knowledge of the IT software business and industry.
    • High level of commercial acumen.
    • Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
    • Advanced modelling skills and knowledge of business architecture.
    • Strong command of data visualisation tools and techniques.
    • Infectious enthusiasm to help business growth and improvement.
    • Proven communication and collaboration skills.
    • Comfortable with various business intelligence tools.


    Good To Have Requirements (Work Experience Further Qualifications)
    • Excellent planning organisation and time management skills.
    • Great presentation and documentation skills.
    • Proven ability to work well under pressure amidst multiple demands.


    Formal Education
    • Bachelor's Degree in appropriate field of study or equivalent work experience

  • You will be part of the dynamic team responsible for facilitating and supporting the Bank’s Ecosystem strategy from planning executing and scaling up ecosystem partnerships across the region.
  • As an important team member you will have the opportunity to support a variety of assignments perform market research develop partnership roadmap prepare business case and gain in-depth exposure to the breadth of our regional business and the complexity of our operations and products.
  • You will get to participate in strategy review meetings with senior management and take part in the bank’s digital transformation journey
Requirements
  • 2-4 years in banking financial services or related industries
  • Degree in Accountancy Finance or Business is preferred
  • Good team player positive work and learning attitude
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity thrives in fast-moving and high-growth environment

Standard Chartered Bank

About Standard Chartered

We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia Africa and the Middle East.

To us good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise Here for good.

Job Title: Lead IT Business Analyst (BAU Manager)| IT - Data-Driven Business
Job Description:
Job Purpose

You will be involved in Digital Projects as a Lead IT Business Analyst with BAU responsibility throughout the entire life-cycle of the conceptualization and implementation. As a Lead IT Business Analyst you will need to communicate with various stakeholders (Business and IT) to gather / validate requirements create / validate UI Mock-ups create / validate Interface Specifications and support testing through test scenario / case / data creation and reviews.

The role will engage with the regional delivery teams (SG MY and INDO) working to incorporate common governance and methodology standards into the treatment of BAU issues.

The Job

  • Work with various Business and IT stakeholders to create a detailed process analysis outlining problems opportunities and propose solutions to improve the process.
  • Gather and analyze user requirements prepare detailed functional specifications & related documents in compliance with organizational standards and procedures.
  • Competent ability with SQL - able to write functional queries and procedures.
  • Work with delivery team in system delivery and ensure all tasks assigned to the team meets the prescribed delivery schedule and quality.
  • To perform and support application / system testing including functional non-functional and interface tests spanning the entire testing life cycle from test management and strategy test planning test scenarios / case / data preparation test execution and problem resolution.
  • Support / execute activities for post application / system delivery maintenance.
  • Facilitate communication with all stakeholders to ensure deliverables are delivered.
  • Provide coaching and training to Users.
  • Working alongside the core project team looking at post go live / BAU issues and tickets
  • Working with/ managing our 3rd party providers who are resolver groups for project issues.
  • Prioritising and managing the BAU tickets and resolver group management process.
  • Reporting to the business on planned changes and outcomes.
  • Takes accountability in considering business and regulatory compliance risks and takes appropriate steps to mitigate the risks.
  • Maintains awareness of industry trends on regulatory compliance emerging threats and technologies in order to understand the risk and better safeguard the company.
  • Highlights any potential concerns /risks and proactively shares best risk management practices.

Job Title: Singapore Private Banking Full Time Analyst (Investment Consulting)
Job Description:
Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich Switzerland we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees provide wide-ranging training and development opportunities and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse.

We Offer
Credit Suisse has been dedicated to serving entrepreneurs throughout its 164-year history. The Asia Pacific (APAC) Division strives to be the Trusted Entrepreneurs' Bank of the region and a key destination for talent. It offers integrated private banking and investment banking financial solutions to entrepreneurs wealthy individuals institutional investors and corporate clients in the region drawing on Credit Suisse's global resources.

In Private Banking APAC we have been building partnerships for generations working closely with our clients to help them realize their ambitions and aspirations. Each of our ultra-high-net-worth and high-net-worth clients' has a unique story and we aspire to be a consistent reliable flexible and long-term partner focused on all client needs - from the simplest to the most complex. By listening attentively to our clients and offering them comprehensive advice on a wide array of products and services we empower them to make better financial decisions.

Join the ranks of one of the world's largest Private Banks and develop your talents in the area of Wealth Management. Our Private Banking Analyst Program (Investment Consulting) is designed for fresh graduates or recent graduates with a keen interest in pursuing a career as an Investment Consultant (and with less than three years of working experience).

You will begin your Program as an Analyst in an Investment Consultant (IC) team - each IC team is embedded in a key Market Area within Private Banking APAC. The IC Analyst plays an integral role in the client advisory lifecycle working closely with ICs to actively service our clients and deliver financial advice that aligns to our clients' investment strategy. In this role you can expect to receive hands-on experience in critical front office work as well as gain exposure to the full suite of products and services within our Private Banking business.

High potential IC Analysts who demonstrate key competencies through their individual performance and contributions to their teams will distinguish themselves and qualify as candidates for a Junior IC role.

Training
The two-year Analyst Program includes an extensive array of on-the-job training ranging from hands-on learning to stretch assignments and individual coaching. You can also expect to receive structured learning through a holistic curriculum consisting of product and technical training as well as professional skills development. Taken as a whole the Program will address all the competencies you need in order to excel as an IC Analyst.

You Offer

To apply for the IC Analyst Program you should be in your final year of an undergraduate program (graduating between December 2020 and June 2021) or a recent bachelor degree holder with less than three years of working experience (as of July 2021). Credit Suisse is noted for the diversity of its employees but we seek talented individuals with a common set of abilities – highly motivated and creative individuals who have demonstrated academic achievement and have the ability to work independently and as a member of a team. We’ll be looking at your potential your ability your academic background and your extracurricular activities. We’re looking to build future leaders who add fresh perspectives to our business.

You’ll Also Need To Be
  • Interested in the private wealth management industry and the products and services within this area of banking.
  • Interested in the financial markets and its various asset classes and instruments (a degree in Finance or related disciplines is preferred).
  • Outgoing service-oriented with excellent interpersonal and communication skills (language skills may be an advantage in certain locations).
  • Motivated by challenging and dynamic goals.
  • Able to work well in a demanding fast-paced environment and adaptable to change.
  • A critical thinker with excellent problem-solving skills.
  • Able to work in a team and build strong relationships with internal and external partners.
  • Committed to the highest standards of ethical behavior.
How To Apply
You will need to complete an application on the Credit Suisse careers website (Experienced Professionals section) – https://www.credit-suisse.com/careers/en/career-opportunities/experienced-professionals.html – for consideration.

Application deadline: November 1 2020

Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success.
